review: I love this product and would love to repurchase it

name: Lana
review:
Finally a color in between caramel and


cappuccino!! This is the best long wearing full coverage with a natural look foundation I've ever tried. HOLY GRAIL!

name: Sidney
review: I discovered this over a year ago and have been in love since. I have EXTREMELY oily skin and have tried high end & drug store foundations for "oily skin" but this is the ONLY foundation I've ever found that lasts all day. Highly recommend if you have oily skin and your skin has trouble keeping on the product while staying matte.

name: sadie
review: I accidentally bought the combo/oily skin foundation since I'm more on the dry side and it works perfectly with my skin. I don't set it with powder unless I'm baking and I never wear foundation without lotion on my face so it all melts into my skin nicely. Honestly I'd compare this to Naked skin where the UD Naked Skin is so lightweight and build able coverage and I only ever need 1 pump for each foundation. I used the colorstay foundation for almost a year until I switched to Naked Skin and now back to Revlon and I'm saving so much money for practically, in my opinion the same thing. I personally think the UD foundation is the best on the high end market for the price and the only differences I find are the scent (Revlon is much better) and the consistency. Naked skin was very watery whereas the Colorstay foundation was more whipped. Anyways, I prefer the colorstay foundation now over anything and it's so affordable. Bless

name: Nicole
review: As a makeup artist this really upsets me that they changed the formula and added SPF.. This only means that I can't use this on my clients anymore. Which was a cheaper alternative for me. I personally have used this brand for years and by far was my favorite and I've been noticing with the new formula that it's just not as great anymore. They should have left the formula alone. If someone wanted SPF then they could wear that as a base layer. It can always be added in but it can't be taken out. Bad move Revlon.

name: Whitney
review: I have pretty oily skin and this foundation works really well for me. The only thing that I didn't like is it's hard to get out of the bottle sometimes.

name: Barbara does makeup
review: I was looking for a foundation similar to Tarte foundation and this one is pretty close without spending a fortune.  It left me the extra money to buy more products.

name: Makeupbyyar
review: Ive used every foundation possible. Much better than all the ones I've used and it's very affordable. It doesn't make me breakout and it lasts all day and night! I would highly recommend this product!

name: Sagira
review: I used to use bare mineral for several years until I started seeing dry patches on my forehead. Although bare mineral gave me a good coverage, it didn't last long and looked horrible after a few hours. So I decided to try revlon colorstay and I was impressed. I use revlon colorstay powder to set it and makeup lasts all day. I am planning on buying it again.

name: Anna B.
review: I have oily skin, but it's not super oily. This foundation made my skin incredibly dry and flakey.

name: Have no nickname
review: Use it every day

name: PSmommy25
review: I've always been one to reach for the more high end makeup brands when it comes to foundation but a beauty blogger recommended this product so I thought I'd try it out. It was horrible! It was hard to blend, dried extremely quick once on the skin, and left my face looking cakey and gross. And it only looked worse as the day progressed. I took this back and got my money back. I'll stick with my more expensive, better looking foundations in the future. No more trying to skimp when it comes to foundation!!

name: Shoppersr95
review: I don't normally purchase drug store brands of makeup, but I went out on a limb for this purchase! I have oily/dry patches and this just went on smooth. And lasted all day! I only had to use cover powder once.

name: ana
review: miss the old formula like crazy! can't find a replacement and i would pay anything for the old formula!

name: Angeleyes
review: Ive been using the color stay for years.  Tried other brands to see if i found one better ,but they have all failed the  medium coverage,all day work my butt off keep makeup up flawless test. Love the new pump despenser,in love with it so much more now.. Thank You Revlon

name: MJ
review: The only foundation that I have found that will last all day and my face does not look oily by the end of the day.

name: swcoody
review: I started using this foundation a few years ago and absolutely loved it. At the time, I was strictly using drugstore makeup and had never even thought about purchasing high end. That all changed when my Mom bought me the Urban Decay Naked palette for Christmas in 2014. From then on I was addicted to buying and trying high end makeup. I wanted to see what else I was missing out on. So I started a 1 year long journey of buying several different high end foundations. I tried Makeup Forever, Becca, Urban Decay, Tarte, Lorac, Too Faced, and Benefit, just to name a few. I liked a few of those but nothing was ever so amazing that I ended my search. Then, a few weeks ago I was looking at some pictures (selfies lol) on one of my old phones and could not believe how AMAZING my skin looked! I didn't realize how dull and blah my skin looked this past year until I saw the old pictures. It took me a little while but I realized it was because of the foundation. (I tried buying new blushes and highlighters and they made no difference.) I immediately ran out to Ulta and bought a bottle of my old favorite and used it the very next day. I was SO EXCITED to see that glowing flawless skin again! I will NEVER waste my money on any other foundation again. The coverage is amazing and it never looks heavy or cakey. I LOVE this stuff!

name: Tabitha
review: I have the oiliest skin ever! my nose forehead & cheek area most makeup works but after an hour I'm shiny and greasy look and have to wear powder after 4 hours my face still looks fresh and oil free I was shocked especially for the price. I would definitely recommend for oily skin and it covered all my redness and acne as well.

name: Rose Golden
review: I love this foundation. It's the best foundation out there! I've been using it for the past 7 years.

name: Kela
review: I've used this foundation for 15yrs. I have oily acne prone skin and this gives me buildable full coverage without clogging my pores.  Ive tried other high end products but always come back!  So glad they finally added a pump!!!!!!

name: SA
review: I'm usually the type to spend a good $40 on some brand name foundation, but if i'm not in the mood to break my wallet, I always resort back to ColorStay. I will say that ALL of the expensive foundations that i've tried, they're so much harder to match my skin tone or it's not full coverage or some other reason that it's not to my liking.  To my surprise, the shades ColorStay has is right on & it's extremely great coverage for the $10-$13 price depending on where you get it. I will reccomend this to anyone who wears foundation on a daily basis and doesn't want to break the bank.

name: Stef da turtle
review: Perfect drug store foundation. Blends well with sponge or brush.

first, but definitely not most important, THIS FOUNDATION DOES NOT HAVE A PUMP! it's just a glass bottle without a pump or a squeeze tube! so inconvenient, messy, and wasteful for me. secondly, this is not a lasting matte foundation. I looked oily right after applying and throughout the day, even after powdering and blotting occasionally. my skin isn't even extremely oily so I can't imagine what the result would be with skin that is! in addition, this transfers so easily! onto fingers, clothing, ANYTHING! it just comes off! I made a huge mistake buying this product and regret it even more so considering I can't find the receipt to return it. instead I repurchased loreal infallible pro matte foundation. go check it out, it's amazing for oily, acne prone skin

name: Sidney T
review: I have tried tons of foundations and this one has worked out the best on my skin; my skin is usually too oily it to hold up a foundation for long without getting greasy and rubbing off but this foundation has had the best results & stayed on all day with 0 shine and it's really inexpensive! Love

name: Sita
review: I really like this product because it doesn't break me out.  I wish it had an even heavier coverage to hide my sun spots.

name: Revival
review: The container is new, I am use to the old one. Since they changed the container, it seems like they changed an ingredient.  It does not have that full coverage look it use to have.

name: J
review: I'm torn. I REALLY wanted to love this. I tried it with/without primers and powders and no luck. It actually looked best all by itself. It is full coverage and looks nice when first applied. but unfortunately, I felt like all it did was emphasize any bumps or lines I had on my face. It did help with oil control and stayed all day, Looked fine in pictures but up close, you could see everything. It made me look a lot older because it sank into my smile lines and pores terribly. I like the elements of it but hate the final look - ended up returning.

name: Vc
review: I have been purchasing this foundation over and over again that's how much I love it. Covers my face throughly and long lasting

name: Carmen.
review:
I don't know what it is about this but it's made me break out nasty. I got a shade that was to light for me so I use it under my eyes and on my chin to highlight. I love this foundation because
it covers and looks flawless. But now for some reason it's making me break out. so sadly I won't be repurchasing /:

name: Bekah
review: Other than the color being a little off, I'm pleased with the product. I have very oily skin by midday but with combining the translucent colorstay pressed powder, the foundation stays on well and my face doesn't look oily so early in the day. I have not tried it without the pressed powder.

name: ussms1107
review: I absolutely love this foundation! I just turned 38. I have noticed a change in my skin and I have been on a foundation roller coaster. I have...Mac, Este Lauder, Lancome, IT Cosmetics, Laura Mercier, Clinique...all these foundations in my makeup collection. None of them can give me the coverage and staying power of Revlon ColorStay. For it to work nicely on my face, I have to moisturize, prime, apply a powder for a finish, and then spray on a setting spray. This technique will last me from 6 in the morning, until I go to bed around 10 or 11. I have yet to find a high end foundation that comes close to Revlon ColorStay.

name: Lsitz
review: Didn't even try on face.  Open the bottle and the color did not match

name: Amanduh
review: I really enjoyed using this product. It bless well and matches perfectly

name: vanessa
review: I have redness on my face and most foundations don't cover most of it but this foundation does. Not completely, but I think this foundation has pretty good coverage without having to cake it on. After hours of wear, I can still see that coverage too. This is my favorite drugstore foundation I've tried. I have normal skin that can get a little oily in the t-zone so I can't talk for anyone who has combo or truly oily skin. If I were to buy a drugstore foundation again I'd buy this or the whipped version of Colorstay

name: Bay
review: Easy to apply smell and color is fine but it just wipes off so easy. Whenever I would even blot my face it would come off.

name: Meghan
review: I have been on an endless goose chase for a good foundation since I started wearing it ten years ago - and I have not found one I've been THIS excited about ever! I tried this a few years back before it was reformulated, and I have had such awful luck with foundation lately I decided to give this a try. I have very, very tricky-to-match fair, combination skin so it's virtually impossible for me to find foundation that will not dry my dry spots, melt off in my oily ones, can match my skin & not oxidize, and last all day through the southern humidity and long work days. This. Stuff. Is. Gold. I love this! I've been applying it with a damp Real Techniques sponge and it covers all of my discoloration beautifully and dries to a beauty Demi-matte finish which I can easily make luminous or perfectly matte. And I'm here to tell you, I will put this on at 6 am, go through my entire day (including a sweaty workout and humidity) and this foundation will not have budged. I've also noticed I have not had too bad of a problem with this foundation transferring, either. I will DEFINITELY be repurchasing this foundation! Drugstore goldmine.

name: Nikki
review: Cheaper than other stores

name: Combination
review: I have a very oily T-zone and dry cheeks. This foundation goes on looking awfully cakey and literally flakes even in areas I'm not dry it just makes my skin look so disgustingly dry and flakey and it's not smooth at all and on top of that my skin ends up looking oily on top of it.

name: Skye
review: As much as this product advertises for combo/oily skin this product was ridiculous. In Louisiana it is very humid everyday and you sweat like crazy and as soon as I walked out the door this makeup was C A K E Y. It basically made every little pore stand out like crazy and this is with a good primer. As many good reviews as this has gotten, apparently it wasnt for me.

name: Becca
review: I had high hopes for this as my skin is very oily, but within a few hours it migrated into dots of foundation all over my face. I will be returning this.

name: rose
review: I've been using this foundation for about 3 years whenever I try out another foundation or try it out I always come back to this one I'm a teen so I occasionally break out with cystic acne and it covers very well and I love how it sets.

name: Nikki
review: This foundation can be used all year long. I live in Texas and it gets super hot....and this foundation stays in place. I have really oily skin and this foundation works amazing. I have tried everything and this is my favorite!

name: JJ
review: Usually I buy luxury brand products and I tried this on a whim, I must say I am impressed overall with this product. The coverage is amazing and it doesn't sit in my pores. Price point is obviously nice as well.

name: Doriedoo
review: It covers great and lasts all day. It's a bit thick for my skin, which I have deep pores, and the makeup glides over my pores, leaving ugly pits. But that's my skin and not fault of makeup.

name: Arienna
review: I really enjoyed this product - blended very easily and worked well with the rest of my makeup process.

name: Gladys
review: I had to return it because it wasn't full coverage. My mistake. Idk if it said so in the packaging. The foundation is too watery for my liking.

name: Jenny from the woods
review: Great all day coverage that doesnt slide off. Paired with the matching powder, it only requires minimal blotting compared to many other brands I've used.

name: Nahhan
review: I'm not a big spender on makeup so drugstore makeup is for me! I've had bad acne since I was 17 and could never find a foundation that wouldn't make me break out even more. Even the foundations that claimed to help treat acne just made it so much worse. Then I started using this product. The coverage is great and it doesn't cause new acne throughout the day. I even wake up after napping and my makeup still looks great!

name: Jess
review: have tried a lot of foundations and always find my way back to this one. Stays on forever. doesn't clog pores and coverage is awesome

name: Minneapple123
review: I've been using this product for years. It's great for mature skin and really does a great job of covering blemishes. Would highly recommend this product.

name: Devon
review: Very nice foundation.  It covers my face evenly.  It's good for combination skin, and is not too expensive.

name: Debbie
review: Apply it in am

name: Lindsey
review: I love this foundation because it goes on well and stays on all day! The only thing I would say would be to make sure you get the right formula for your skin. I got the combination/oily formula just before the winter not realizing that my skin would get dry in the coming months, but it still works well for me! If possible, get both formulas just to test out which works better at certain times of the year or depending on how your skin feels.

name: Jennie
review: I have been using this product for about 6 months or longer now and I love it. It's easy to apply and covers well. It works very well with my skin type as well. It does not make me break out and it lasts a good while.

name: Freckles
review: Have been using Revlon Colorstay foundation for 10+ years. It covered my freckles completely and stayed on for forever! But this new 24 hour formula gives my skin a horrible texture. It breaks down on my face within 5 hours of wear (begins to sink into pores noticeably)  and turns an orange color at about the 2nd hour of wear mark. Its so horrible. Now the hunt for a new foundation begins

name: Germica
review: It's good drug store quality. I wore it and it stays on all day.

name: Rose
review: Produce cove ups great stays  on for hours love it

name: PBro
review: This is my new favorite every day foundation. I have very oily skin and I can wear this all day with no issues.

name: Emilie
review: I have gotten two different shades of this foundation, the two lightest shades. The very lightest shades was too white, and the second lightest shade was too dark and oxidizes too much. The color starts off natural, but as the day goes on the color oxidizes and turns a bit orangey and patchy. Even using the combination/oily skin foundation, it doesn't stay so well on oily skin.

name: Hillary
review: Blends nicely with a brush, easy to add concealer and highlight over it. Wish it was a little more full coverage.

name: Chrid
review: Been using it for the past fee days to test it against my skin to see if I'm allergic to it and if it oxidizes. Cause I watched a reviews on this product on YouTube before purchasing. Many warned about possible oxidizing with the skin and caution to get a fee shades that you believe are close to skin type, and to make sure the place where you are buying will take returns on open makeup. I have a combination skin type, because i normally get dry during winter and get super oily during the spring/summer. I love how it can easily built on in layers and the matte finish it gives. I will say if you have strong oily skin during seasons. Then, just add a setting powder for extra insurance on the safe side. Overall I love this product a lot, and I would definitely purchase again with the price being in a good range for someone starting out in a great liquid foundation. It does cover up problem areas and it helps to tone down any dark spots or circles.

name: Taylor
review: I've been having a hard time finding a color to match my skintone. I strayed away from Maybelline because theirs didn't have a color with yellow undertones. This foundation matched perfectly (I bought Buff). The only issue is the coverage. I felt like I had to use a lot more foundation than normal to cover my face. I will keep using it because it matches my skin tone and lasts all day - but I wish it was higher coverage.

name: jaynetrain
review: The coverage from his foundation is super. I have fallen in love with it. I like to apply it with a real techniques blending sponge and it is just beautiful. I have oily, acne prone skin and large pores and this does the job. I prefer to start with primer also. I use the smashbox photo finish pore minimizing primer and the finished look and just gorgeous.

name: Ladybug
review: Wow I picked the best color for my skin tone. With this foundation you don't really need to highlight can be worn only with a finish powder and that's it I love this foundation!!

name: Makeup Mommy
review: I returned this product because I could not find a shade to match my tan skin tone and was not happy with the Revlon loose powder I had purchased to go with it. I ended up with Maybelline True Fit which is also for oily/combo skin and had more choices for tan skin.

name: Tea
review: I get they had to make the foundation more watery, due to the newly added pump, but it doesn't even compare to the old formula. It definitely doesn't last as long or even blend as easily. I will be looking for a new foundation seeing as this one doesn't even last a few hours.

name: exyucca
review: This makeup works great on my oily skin and is incredibly long lasting with great coverage.

name: Chelle
review: Since they updated the formula and added a pump this is the worst foundation. I have used this for years since I was 12 years old. Never found anything that compared and I got always got complements. This new formula is the worst!!! Does not stay on at all. Poor coverage, NOT full coverage at all!! It's more like a lightweight BB cream. I am very sad to say I will be changing my foundation after years of use. No longer a fan Revlon!!!

name: Caroline
review: I use it on a daily basis. It gives great natural coverage with a nice smooth finish

name: KayMcx
review: I hav been trying this foundation from recommendations from a friend. I've been told that this product is noncomodigenic; however, since using this product, my skin has sortof been breaking out a little more than normal. The coverage is medium (which I need), but I feel that halfway through the day it fades.

name: crazy J
review: Did not like smell of product, felt very heavy so would not like in summer.

name: Marianna
review: Awesome product!

name: Cici
review: The pump bottle has a different formula than the original. The coverage is NOT the same! I thought it was all in my head at first. I made sure to shake the bottle well, and tried it out a few times. It just isn't what the original use to be. I would call this foundation a light coverage (no longer medium to full). I think you could reach medium coverage, but would require a lot of product. It also gets cakey very easily if you try to build up coverage. I also noticed it transferred more than the original version as well. I am so very sad about this change. This was my favorite foundation, and I had been using it for years. I will have to search for another foundation, but I don't know if any will ever be able to compare to the original colorstay (drugstore at least).

name: Crisel
review: I don't have any problems with this product, I'm Asian and blends well on my skin. I don't break out and doesn't feel heavy on my skin. I always receive good compliments from my co-workers how nice my skin looks. Very natural looking!

name: Always on the Go
review: I've used this product for a few years.  I love the new pump that makes the application process much quicker.  It wears well with a matte, natural finish that lasts all day.  Plus it's SPF 15, which is always important.

name: Ana
review: They totally changed the formula when the pump was added! I used this foundation for so long and now I am shopping for another brand! I am so upset. The original used to be thick and this one is so runny and doesn't stay on. I can't stand IT!

name: Jam
review: What I was looking for all along

name: Nikki
review: Lasts all day. Great coverage

name: Jen
review: I love the coverage and it lasts all day I am a cook so I needed to find a foundation that wouldn't look oily after a 8-16 hour shift I went through ALOT of different foundations and this is by far the best one I get to work at 8 am and when I leave at 10 pm it still looks like I just applied it absolutely love it !!!

name: sbk01
review: LOVE this product.  I have been using it for more than 20 years.  I would be lost if it was ever taken off the market!!  Great long lasting coverage.  I have received complements for years on my makeup.

name: Becca
review: I didn't like this foundation at all. It never feels dry on the skin. Wears off and leaves my skin looking oily after a few hours and looks very patchy/blotchy. I can only imagine how bad it would be in the summer. Might be a little better with a setting powder but didn't like it enough to even try. Caused acne on my cheeks.

name: Kristen
review: While the pump is a great addition, I'm now having to look for a new foundation for the first time in 5 years. My skin is ever so slightly combination, mostly normal, and this foundation lasts maybe an hour or two and it feels greasy all day. The old formula did not do this.

name: Lainz
review: Product was too thick and was not easy to apply. I have oily skin so this wasn't a good idea.

name: MakeupQueen
review: The coverage was great in this foundation, however, I feel as though it doesn't blend well. Also, none of the color options match my skin tone. Lastly, it feels awful if you sweat with this on your face. It turns into a nasty goopy mess.

name: DreamCatcher
review: I love this foundation.  I recently purchased foundations from Makeup Forever and BECCA...But after trying this product I find myself reaching for it every time I apply my makeup.  Make sure you have a skin care regimen though, I noticed a blemish tried to appear, but overall this is a winner!

name: dancingdany
review:
I'm starting to have constant acne because of taking plan b last week . so I decided to look for foundation to cover up these blemishes and all and I always had flawless skin so this depresses me . So I got this foundation and I didn't get the right shade but I still tried it out and it's good coverage and took off the oilyness, but after taking it
off it made me breakout even more , I don't know if its the foundation or just my skin being stupid .

name: Jessi
review: I love this product. I have no problem buying $40-$60 foundations, but I always have this on hand as it works great and is an awesome price. I have bad acne scars and I use a stippling brush to apply this and nyx blotting powder and it gives me long lasting full coverage with no oily residue, and I have relatively oily skin. My other foundations are clinice acne solutions, and make up forever brand foundation. I used to use Mac Studio Fix, but it breaks my neck out.

name: Melodi12r
review: smooth application and stays well

name: Bonn
review: Excellent product.

name: chicka1311
review: I have used this foundation for years and have loved it. I always tried other foundations but always came back to this one. Unfortunately, I can no longer use it because they recently added spf to it. It's makes me break out with little bumps ALL OVER my face!!! Please take out the spf!!

name: Steph
review:
This was one of the first liquid foundations I tried out when I began wearing makeup 6 years ago. It has not let me down ever since! I recently went into ulta to purchase this and to my surprise, they are now carrying the version with a pump! If you've purchased this foundation before you'd know it is just a glass container with an opening and your pour it out onto fingers, hand, etc. Now with the new pump. It is much more sanitary.

The quality of the foundation is perfection. I have oily, acne-prone skin. This foundation foes not break me out and provides enough coverage to conceal my red spots.I've strayed away onto high end foundations but always come running back to my revlon colorstay foundation, there's nothing better than it!

name: KC
review:
This product is great for oily skin. Lasts all day, sets well, and doesn't get shiny.
However, it can settle into wrinkles if you don't set it with some powder (especially depending on your under-eye concealer)

name: Sus
review:
I have been using ColorStay for a least 5 years, probably longer. I love that it lasts all day and comes off with a face towel, soap and water. Does not cause me any breakouts and the added SPF is a plus.
This is the first time it has had the pump design, so I am not sure if I will like that better or not.

name: MUA Michelle
review: I really loved it the minute I put it on but I immediately started to feel an itch around my cheeks but decided to leave it on. Later at night I took it off and noticed red bumps on my face that itched like crazy. This is the second colorstay product I try and the same has happend both time. It sucks because the coverage is BEAUTIFUL. Ill still give it all stars because I think it works perfect for most people.

name: Lex
review:
I have tried SEVERAL foundations from high end brands and even other drugstore brands. But lately when I've been doing my makeup, I've been reaching for this foundation. Excellent coverage for my badly scarred face and perfect oily skin! I actually had this foundation on this past Friday, I did my makeup around 11am, went to work until 9pm and then went for drinks and dancing until 1am. When I got home my makeup was still in tact and I didn't use any oil blotting sheets or powders to touch up throughout the day. Trust and believe I'm typically always reaching for oil blotting sheets! So if you are looking for a great foundation that lasts all day, I would definitely recommend this one.

Oh yea! The "only issue" with this foundation is that is does run off, but no matter I do with my foundation it always has color transfer in my clothes, so I'm just careful.

name: KW
review: Perfect Fondation

name: kss
review: This is my go to foundation when I feel like throwing on a lot of makeup. For reference I'm a nc15 and use the shade 150 buff (it's pretty neutral however). Smells a little like paint, also does feel somewhat heavy, but it does provide a decent amount of coverage, medium to medium full. You could probably go light medium with a dampened sponge/beauty blender. The main gripe I have about this foundation is its blendability, it's not bad, but it's not super easy as say hourglass' immaculate. It will slightly cling to dry spots. I have dry skin and have tried the dry/normal? Skin version and actually did not like it as much. It lasts pretty long on the skin for me, enough to get through a day of work/school, but won't take me through a whole day and night. I've repurchased tens of times, and now they're finally coming out with a pump for it!

name: MONZ
review: This stuff is amazing, i used to buy name brand products but couldn't find something with full coverage, or that would last all day and wouldnt make my face a greasy mess until i found this! it's amazing for oily skin, i use it with a beauty blender and it applies sooo smoothly i love it. I wouldn't recommend it for dry skin, it might make you look a little chalky, it happens to me when my face is a little dry but overall a GREAT BUY.

name: Bella s
review: I bought this as an everyday foundation so I won't have to use my expensive one all the time. I wasn't expecting much when I got it but I have been wearing it for about a week and I gotta say I love it. I was pleasantly surised of how smoothly it went on, the pigmentation was pretty good, the coverage was medium not full but nonetheless I really liked that it lasted me a whole day given that I blotted my face every few hours. All in all I am very impressed

name: Nychelle
review: Daily use

name: enrichingryker
review: I have skin shinier than an oil slick and this foundation has worked wonders! I'm usually reapplying powder or blotting my face as soon as an hour after apply my makeup but I've gone all day without needing to blot! It also provided even coverage to my acne scarred face. I've found my forever foundation!

name: Shay
review: I didn't like it. My skin is oily and it didn't work for me.

name: MelTells
review:
Let me just say that I initially bought the formula for dry skin. I absolutely HATED it. It flaked all over my face and settled into fine lines. It also left my face looking ashy and malnourished. It was a no-go.I hated it so much that I tried using it for about two weeks and ended up throwing it in the trash.

One of my favorite youtube users recently mentioned that she mixes the Colorstay for oily skin with a high end foundation in order to get a decent shade match. Realizing that I had previously purchased the dry formula, I decided to go out and get the foundation for oily skin. What a difference! I mix this foundation with one of my expensive foundations, and the result lasts all day. I don't even need to powder! If you like a super matte finish, then this foundation is for you. I personally prefer a slight "glow" and therefore mix it with EL Double Wear Light. This product is worth a shot considering it ranges from $8-$12. Can't go wrong with that price!

name: JDizzle
review: The best makeup by far!! It is usually difficult to find the right makeup with long lasting coverage, and at same time won't cause breakout. Was hesitant to use it at first, because of fearing it might break me out, but was impressed with the results. I will continue to use this affordable product.

name: beautygirl
review: The only foundation I will ever use! I have tried numerous drugstore and high end foundations and this is the only one that actually lasts on my oily skin.

name: Tea
review: This foundation has been my staple for so long, until recently. About a week ago I purchased this foundation and noticed Revlon added a pump. I thought this would be beneficial until I realized that product was no longer staying on my face like it use to. I compared the ingredients to my old bottle (the one without the pump) and noticed they added more ingredients to the newer bottles. The formula isn't as thick as before which is noticeable on how the foundation only last a few hours, even with primer and powder.

name: MakeupByElana
review: I have baught this foundation over and over. I fact I compare most foundations to this one. I love the coverage, it's long lasting, and it doesn't stick to my dry spots. I have normal to dry skin and sometimes foundations cling to dry spots. This one didn't for me at least. It also had my perfect shade of foundation which is very hard for me. Everything turns too yellow or pink for me. This is also long lasting and covered my few problem spots.

name: Sandy
review: I bought many high end foundations, but always go back to Revlon Color Stay.  I am 67 years young.

name: Key
review: Love this foundation

name: Madi
review: I've tried high end foundations that were $40+ and none of them compare to this. I've been using this product for the last two years and it gives me such flawless coverage and it doesn't oxydize or separate on my skin like other foundations. I would recommend this to anyone with acne or acne prone skin because it covers beautifully and doesn't cake at all!

name: Sally
review: I have very oily and acne prone skin. I think think foundation applies very easily and beautifully. It definitely doesn't last 16 hours... I'd say it lasts around 4 hours without needing some powder touch ups for me, but I do have a very oily t-zone. Definitely one of the better drugstore foundations I've tried although I think the Covergirl 3 in 1 stays longer on my face (although that's not perfect either)

name: Candace
review: I was matched to this foundation at Ulta and thought it was the perfect match. While it is when I put it on initially, I find that during the day and throughout, it turns darker than what the pigment originally was. The lady who grabbed it for me also got the Oily/Combination type when I have Norma/Dry skin, so it makes my skin peely and flaky. When I wear it to school, the coverage slowly goes away and my red areas become apparent. But, when initially put on, it's got decent coverage for all of those red areas.

name: RDH
review: First off, I am extremely picky on my foundations. I will find one that i love and will use it religiously for months/years until i feel adventurous to try something new out. With that being said, i absolutely love this product and have repurchased several times. I use to use Benefits's Hello Flawless Oxygen WOW foundation but have switched to this. Both are great, but Revlon's price tag is nicer for continuous use. The only issue i really have with this foundation is that sometimes it sticks to my dry patches when i have them. Other than that, This product is amazing and i Would recommend it to anyone. It lasts all day for me but i do use a face primer so without it, it lasts almost as long but not quite.

name: Gatochicka
review: This product ended up as too matte the first time I wore it. I had to apply a thinner layer the second time and found great coverage, but the same problem as the first wear: doesn't let me undertone shine through. Another way of saying it was that my color looked too uniform across my face and it lost all dimension, even with just a thin layer of the product. I would recommend investing in blush if you don't have any.

name: Amani A.
review:
I absolutely love this foundation, I have been on the look out for something new but I always come back to this foundation. If you apply with a brush it will be a lighter coverage than if you apply with a sponge but both give a nice flawless finish.

Only con is that I have to mix the 150 and 180 to get the perfect shade for myself. The 180 is too much of a pink undertone while the 150 is very light, wish there was an in-between shade! Other than that, I love the product, and the finish is flawless and last forever. I get wonderful compliment on my skin with this foundation! LOVE!

name: ThugPug182
review: I love this foundation! It is a great product. I love the formula and it's got good pigmentation. I find that if I set this foundation it easily lasts a full day.

name: Danni
review: This is a good light weight foundation I will be buying it again after I get done with my first one!

name: kk
review: Great product for price

name: K. Brinks
review: I have honestly never found another foundation that could compete! I tried Loreal True Match and HATED IT. It was patchy, wore off, and horrible for oily skin. As with most foundations, it slid off as my face is a never ending oil slick. This foundation I can wear for 10+ hours with absolutely no touch ups!!  The shade is a perfect match!! As I have brown/red hair, green eyes and medium skin, I could never find a shade that looked quite right until now! I use the 220 Natural Beige and it is perfect!!! This is my holy grail and will probably never use anything different!!

name: Jess
review: This has been my go to foundation for years. I have mixed oily to dry skin with occasional breakouts and thus foundation covers well, dark spots, scars, etc. the only cons is no matter what shade I get, it's always a little orange-y and rubs off easily into clothes. Not enough for me to stop buying because of the great price, value and coverage.

name: Lisa
review: I've tried many foundations and I always come back to this one. It works so well that you don't even need to set it with a powder. I have very oily skin during the summer and boy this really did its job. I used a matte foundation by Boots and I still got oily throughout the day but not with this one! The finish look of this is great and if you do want to finish it off with a powder it looks great still. I have acne, acne marks and a very uneven complexion and this product covers all of that. It's definitely full coverage. For me, it doesn't cake up at all. I would say the only down part is finding your perfect shade. Since it is a drug store foundation you can't have someone personally help you match your skin tone but it's really all about knowing your under tones and your skin tone. Definitely will continue to use this as always, I always try different foundations, but this is definitely one of my top 5.

name: Be-You-Tiful
review: This is a great foundation for the price.  The coverage is excellent, and it does not wear off.

name: Celisse
review: This is the first foundation that I have found that lasts all day and allows me to blot off oil and it still stays. It is cost efficient and works great. I like the light weight feel much better than even MAC

name: Olive oil
review: The product works and looks well, my skin is just too oily for this foundation. The foundation seperates on my skin, it just didn't work for me. Coverage is good and blend ability is good as well.

name: Lele
review: Love my recent purchases i always find something i like at the ulta store

name: Mimi89
review: I want to try this foundation because I use brand name foundations that Don't do the job and are pricey.  I am very impressed with the foundation it does it's job  and it's very inexpensive.  However it does not last the full 12 hours but considering that I only put it on just to wear for a couple hours that does not bother me. I have combination skin and this worked very well for me I will continue to buy this product

name: laziiimew
review: Full coverage, and stay fresh all day. However, it is easy to cake up your face if you use too much. Need to use cleansing oil / make up wipe in order to take it off completely. I would not use it everyday, but it is the first one I will think of if I go to a big event.

name: ,Sunshinedazee
review: This is the 3rd time i buy this product and it never fails me. A go to good coverage- all day wear foundation.

name: justenemariexo
review: Doesn't make my skin breakout, which is hard for me to come by a product that doesn't!

name: undertaker83
review: great item

name: Love it
review: This is just as lightweight and long lasting as my mac foundation when applied with a beauty blender... Or my fingers haha. It is a little less coverage though.

name: Didi
review: I've been using this make up for about 15 years now and wouldn't change it!

name: Justine
review: I'm a make up hoarder this is my FAVORITE foundation. From MAC to too faced Kat Von d my go to long wear foundation

name: Ray
review: I never write reviews for products, but I had to share how awesome this foundation is. I've spent hundreds of dollars on just about every high end foundation on the market with no success. I have combination oily skin large pores and foundation will either cling to my dry patches or slide right off my oily t-zone and show my large pores - but not this foundation. It keeps my face look it flawless all day! I would highly recommend to anyone with combo/oily skin!

name: JM
review: Great coverage!! I have very un even skin tone and it is absolutely wonderful!!

name: Krista
review: This is something I'll always go to the budget brand section to buy.  I've tried various brand name foundations and I find I like this one just as much.  Make sure you get the oily/combination skin if that's your type as one time I accidentally bought the normal whatever one and I didn't find it covered as well.

name: Tea
review: I'll be honest, my favorite foundation is UD Naked liquid foundation, however, $40 is ridiculous to spend on something that you wash off your face daily. I really like this Revlon foundation. It covers my uneven skin tone and stays on all day! I use a beauty blender to apply.

name: Jillian
review: I was skeptical about trying this even though the reviews and videos on YouTube all said it was great. I used it once and went to work came home and could not believe how well my makeup still looked. I'm in love so far! Ps. I'm a waitress so it's hard for me to find a foundation that will stay on through a crazy shift! Thanks revlon. Happy girl.

name: Natalie
review: I love the finish of this foundation.  I am confident that my tone is a finished glow and stays on even after working out.  It is light on my skin and I will purchase this again.

name: judyanne
review: like it for everday use

name: Liz
review: I have been looking everywhere for a foundation that would help cover my acne scarring. this foundation is great.I would say it is light to medium coverage but you can go over it twice and still not feel cakey. I have tried all kinds of foundation and hate the cakey feeling of those thicker full coverage foundations.Other foundations had me looking like an oil slick byu the end of the day. this foundation keeps me oil free for about 8/9 hrs. When I finally get a little oil start to show up its so minimal that a little powder takes care of it and Im good to go. This foundation keeps all day and will not rubb off on my clothes.

name: Alyssa
review: My skin is very fair so I chose the lightest shade. The shade matched very well. My skin is oily in my t zone but I get dry patches other places. The coverage was good with this foundation and covered much of my acne scarring, but accentuated my dry areas. It isn't as easy to blend as some other foundations I've used. It had a nice matte finish though. It didn't work with my skin type but I think it's a good product that may work better for someone else.

name: Makeup Lover
review: I love this product because its control the oil on my face. it blends well and provides full coverage without feeling heavy. I have purchased this foundation several times and haven't found another foundation that I like more.

name: Heather Feather
review: Great alternative to MAC PRO LONGWEAR.

name: Airforcewife
review: It doesn't take a lot of this product and I think that's what makes it even a better buy for me. It blends well and truly is a find for me.

name: Stanlee
review: Never use foundation, this was my first experience. I typically use Bare Minerals, but have switched  up my routine a bit. Decided to start using a small amount of foundation for better coverage in addition to powder. Pleasantly surprised at how light this felt. I have oily skin, and usually halfway through the day I am "glistening". Of course it is cooling off, and not as humid. The true test will be next summer.

name: Make Up Junkie
review: I applied this with a blending sponge and goes on like a dream. The foundation is long lasting and has great coverage. I used a setting powder as well. I have sensitive acne prone skin and this did not break me out. I also have combination skin so I did buy the one that would best work for my skin. This is not a foundation I wore every day, I did wear it every other week.

name: Gabrielle
review: My skin is not extremely oily but it does get shiny in the "t zone", so I always have to carry a compact in my purse and haven't really found any products that prevent it from happening... until I discovered this foundation. I applied my makeup at 8:30 this morning, went to school and realized I forgot a compact at home. I went all day with no touch ups and came home and 4:30 to find that my face looked the same as it did when I first applied my make up in the morning!

name: Star
review: The drugstore has really been stepping up their game when it comes to cosmetics. I have heard rave reviews for this foundation and I was not disappointed. I will re purchase this foundation when I run out.

name: Casey
review: Love this makeup. Great coverage and doesn't break me out

name: Morgan
review: I have been using this foundation for over a year now. This foundation beats the high end brands. It stays put and doesn't make my face shiny. I have a really pink/red undertone and it covers it really well.

name: Risha
review: I usually buy IT foundation or other Prestige brands but lost my job so had to go Budget. A friend recommended Colorstay and she looked great with it. I was skeptical because I have very oily skin. Not only do I NOT have to wear primer, it actually does not work for this product. So, I'm switching to Colorstay foundation and saving my money for primer for a new lipstick. Love it!

name: JoJo
review: Okay, so when it comes to foundation i am really picky, drugstore products just never works for me because i get irritated or i get breakouts, my skin is so sensitive so i only buy those high end products, I get curious about this one, i been hearing about this foundation all over youtube and i thought i must have it and give it a try. I bought it and put em on before work for 12hrs and it works amazing into my face, at first it seems just like BB cream, and i thought it will not last long into my face since i have a few acne dark spots. but after i buffed it and used a sponge oh my it worked so good. Since i picked the right color ( you need to pick the lighter color from your shade because this one gets a little darker when it dry just like MAC) I never thought i would like a foundation from the drugstore. I did not itch or anything, It stays in your face. Its matte and smooth finish. It finishes like those high end products. I highly recommend this one tho. btw try to use it with flat buffer. :) i used mine with morphe flat buffer G6

name: tandhforever
review: This is my fave drug store foundation. It always goes on, and blends super easy. It keeps my oily skin matte for my whole work day, I can honestly say I yet to find another foundation that can do that.

name: LayLay
review: It really does last for a good 8 hours! :D

name: SC Girl
review: I am 48 with hormonal acne and normal to oily skin.  I usually wear mineral powder over primer but wanted to go back to liquid foundation to try to make it through the hot humid southern day without the powder "melting" into the fine facial lines.  This product did the same as mineral powder with less coverage.  It will be good for those whom only want light coverage but I'm not sure it will stand to test in the heat.

name: Tiana Del Rey
review: Okay so I had a photoshoot to do a few days after i bought this foundation and i needed a foundation that was matte and had little spf so i got this one and i do have normal to dry skin but i thought it would be okay if i moisterized before hand bc my skin is not that dry. This foundation clung to any little dry patch (some that i didn't even know i had) so maybe this would be better for oily skin instead. However, the color i picked up was very pink-based and my face already has redness so it looked horrible on me, i ended up picking up a different foundation the next day and returned this one.

name: Jasmin
review: I have oily skin it was great but after 4-6 hours it starts to show and my makeup is coming off. I just feel my skin is difficult. I love this but again I get to oily fast. I got combination but I heard if you get normal/dry it will help with oily skin.

name: Beautiful_leo
review: This is my favorite foundation for oily skin.

name: Apsara11
review: It's an amazing product in general when it comes to covering acne scar and blemishes. It blends so well with amazing coverage. This is the first foundation to have full coverage yet leave my skin to natural look. It doesn't fade or easily wipe off. The only down side is when washing it off because the foundation attached to the skin pretty good.

name: Stallion
review: I bought this foundation a couple of months ago and at first I didn't like it but I eventually found myself reaching for this more over my HG Loreal True Match. I love the matte finish of this foundation and I really love how light weight it feels on the skin considering how thick the formula is. This is a full coverage foundation and a little goes a long way. The fact that it worked to well at keeping my oil at bay is why I love it. The fact that you literally have to scrub your face off to get this foundation off is why I hate it but would recommended to anyone.

name: D. Britt
review: Excellent wear with is product

name: K. Pressley
review: The first thing I noticed about this foundation is how thick it is.  It is somewhat difficult to coax out of the bottle.  Thankfully it does have good coverage so a little goes a long way.  It is a little tacky, though, so I find a damp blending sponge works best to get it blended right.  The color is a perfect match for me.  My only other critique is that even with powder and a mattifying setting spray, my face still ends up shiny at the end of my 8 hour work day.

name: Esse
review: This by far my favorite foundation. I usually get oily after about two hours. This foundation keeps me oil free for at least 9 hours. Even at the 9th hour it still looks fantastic. I wore it for about 12 hours, but didn't look like a grease ball. It cost me less than $15 too. Love it!

name: Obsessed with Ulta
review: I like this product and it has a lot of great reviews on YouTube. You only need one coat. (Two looked really cakey on my skin.)

name: averagegirl123
review: This great LASTED all day!

name: LMc
review: Love it

name: Janelle
review: I love this product! It's a light weight and long lasting foundation with build able coverage. Only problem I had was my with my oily combination skin the foundation left my face greasy looking right after, but My second attempt at this foundation worked so much better after I paired it with a matte primer and translucent setting powder. <3

name: Lissy
review: I use this product every single day. It manages to even out my skin tone and cover my blemishes without looking cakey or orange on my very fair skin tone. I have tried many foundations but this is the one that works the best for me and my budget.

name: Fernanda
review: I needed a new foundation, and I'm so happy that I chose this.

name: TGirl
review:
I only used the product once. My intention was to find a drugstore comparable foundation for when I couldn't afford my higher-end fav at the moment.
I wish there was a way to color match drugstore brands. I got what I thought was the closest to my complexion. When I got home, it was darker. Now, that would be okay if I had a tan from being in the sun on an extended basis, but like my title says, "Nah."

name: Chelsie
review: It's great, lasts all day. Applies great. It's just a really great product for us oily/combinations people.

name: KM
review: This foundation is amazing. I don't hesitate to invest in high end make up, and I spent lots of time researching what would be the perfect foundation for me. I tend to continue buying make up on a never ending search for perfection. I have fair skin with redness and freckles, and it can get quite oily and shiney. I was searching for a heavy for coverage foundation with matte finish that would last for my whole day- I leave the house at 8 and don't get home until 9 or so. I have tried high end (Estée lauder, tarte, bare minerals, urban decay etc) to drug store- and this foundation is it. I kept checking it throughout the day and was just blown away. It it good coverage and buildable but feels lightweight and silky. I loved my Estée lauder for its coverage and staying power but it felt like a mask. This feels natural and applies like a dream with my beauty blender. Just a midday blot and I was perfectly refreshed. I especially liked how it seemed to help my other make up stay- my blush was perfect for my entire work day. With other foundations it tended to fade.  I even went for a run after work and after heavy sweating it still looked surprisingly decent. I am returning my high end foundation purchases and won't be without this again.

name: jobro
review: What a disappointment. I've only ever heard great things about this foundation, but this was seriously such a letdown. I don't usually buy drugstore foundation since it's difficult to find the right color for my skintone, but after getting a recommendation for it from another fair-skinned woman, I figured I'd give it a shot. I tried the shade Buff, since I knew Ivory would be too pink for me, but Buff is EXTREMELY yellow. I have a very neutral undertone, but in the summer I tend to get slightly more yellow. This almost made me orange. It did not blend easily and the marketing on the store shelf said this had a matte finish? Absolutely not. I would describe the finish as "dewy in the wrong way." It did cover all redness (with a second layer in a couple spots) and it does last. However, I am used to my foundation setting slightly without a powder, and this does not do that. Until you use a powder, your face will feel heavy and slightly tacky. I will likely be returning this.

name: Julie
review: I've tried many different brands and always go back to this one. A great product for the money.

name: ultimatebeautyjunkie
review:
I wish all girls spending $$$ on department stores would give this a try!
I am mostly a bargain buyer for beauty but I do have some higher end products, however I do not see a point in spending $40,$50,$60 on foundation... No thanks... This stuff works just as good if not better, this stuff is literally BETTER than Mac prolongwer foundation, I would say this compares to that BUT is much easier to blend, and doesn't get cakey, I love that there are 2 formulas as well, it's so hard to find a long lasting foundation aimed for dry skin. Bottom line is every girl needs this!!!

name: Amanda
review: I had heard nothing but great things about this foundation. I still had (and still have) not found my "holy grail" foundation and I thought this would be the one. After all, it is full coverage and long lasting. However I hate the way it sits on my skin. It is too cakey and it settles into my fine lines in these weird white lines. I hate this foundation. It oxidizes awfully and just looks so unnatural. Thought this would be the one for my oily skin but:( it was not.

name: Taylor
review: Best drugstore foundation!

name: none
review: I've tried several different types of foundation in the past year and this was the first one of all. I loved it but after I tried different products I realized that this foundation feels heavy.

name: Chels
review: I'm in the middle of the road on Revlon products. I've tried this product on and off for years hoping that my skin might mature enough to make it work. I have very oily acne prone skin. I use this foundation over primer and moisturizer, applying it with a beauty blender sponge. It is decently pigmented and for the first 2-4 hours looks fantastic but it is very drying for my skin. I tend to look like a cracked porcelain doll after about 5 hours. Not cute.

name: Maggie
review: I have been buying this product for years now it's so amazing and is great for back to school covers imperfections and stays on forever not to mention the great shade selection and the 2 different formulas to adjust to your skin type

name: Hannah
review: I tried this foundation many times, and in different ways and I just couldn't get it to look good.  As soon as I put it on it looked super cakey.  Maybe I was doing something wrong, but it was awful on me.  Returning as soon as I can get to an ULTA.

name: PC
review: I've heard and read so many great reviews about this foundation. While the color is almost a perfect match for me, and it looks good for the first hour or so after application, it's just not working well. It makes any tiny dry patch stand out and look flaky after about 2 hours. Once it's on it does look like I'm wearing foundation - kinda powdery and fake. Will not be buying again.

name: sheepguts68
review: Very good.

name: hi there
review: ivory is a little too dark for me and i'm not that pale. There should be more lighter shade options. i love that it doesn't make me look like an oily mess but needs lighter shades!

name: Wildfire
review: Best foundation for the price!!!!!

name: Mafia Gal
review: Foundation is very lightweight. Doesn't rub off easily. I have combo/oily skin, and this has minimized my oil. However, I did have a little irritability in my temple area. I was looking for a long lasting foundation with good coverage, and this exceeded my expectations!

name: Cindy
review: Love this product  its the only one that holds up with my oily skin

name: none
review: I love the fact that it doesn't rub off easily because I'm a greeter at church and I hate to hug people and pray that my make-up doesn't get on their clothes.  No worries with Super stay!

name: Brittany
review: Best matte finish ever!

name: Jojo
review: I would think this would be great for oily skin.  Just not for me.  Good color range.  I ended up purchasing urban decay naked skin foundation instead of using this.

name: thekaitlynbrooke
review: Compared to MAC foundations but at a fraction of the cost.

name: mina
review: the best foundation ever...really revlon is a awesome brand just love and love everything about it. I use my real technique buffing brush.

name: Sis
review: Great for covering blemishes

name: Ali
review: I love this brand. I try to use other foundations and none ever work as well as this one for me. It's light so your skin doesn't feel oily at all. It blends nicely and leaves a beautiful coverage on the skin. Definitely recommend.

name: Runner Girl
review: Great coverage and a matte finish that lasts all day.  If you have oily skin you'll love this

name: Nicole Adair
review: Been using this stuff for years now.. Does end up a little greasy at the end of the day but it has great coverage.. Good color.. And lasts long:)

name: sarah
review: I really like this foundation if I'm looking for full coverage and staying all day! If thats what you're looking for that buy this! Stays all day and looks really good!

name: candtforever
review: I know everyone says this, but in my case its 100% true. I have tried pretty much all of the drugstore foundations and this is my number one, it stays looking perfect for the whole 14 hours i keep it on. Mind you, i have oily skin and everyother foundation ive ever tried will blotch off my face. Plus the coverage is amazing. I recommend using this with some sort of beauty blender/ face sponge to get the best results.

name: Rose
review: I have used this liquid foundation for years. I'm oily and have cystic acne. This doesn't break me out and it stays matte for about eight hours and even when that happens I just need a  small touch-up of powder.

name: Robin
review: Lasts all day

name: Motox Mama
review: I love the pigmentation in this product. I have a lot of facial expressions throughout the day, and I do feel that it starts to 'crack' after a few hours, and touch-ups are definitely necessary. REALLY looking forward to trying the new FLEX colorstay foundation. I think it will be PERFECT for ME!

name: Beth
review: Do not use this if you are super pale! I use the shade Bone in Estee Lauder products and this was far too dark for me. However, its performance was great. The coverage was really good and it did stay on. It made me a bit more oily than most other foundations I've used, but nothing too terrible. Overall I give it a 3 because I don't like that it has parabens, I don't like the oily factor, but it lived up to most of the hype.

name: Patty
review: I use it every day I hate retouching my make up and I don't with this product

name: Trish the Dish
review: I bought some foundation that cost me 40 dollars and it was not even close to being as good as this. I apply my moisturizer first and than elf face primer and my face looks great all day with no touch ups.

name: marie
review: I have sensitive skin and no reactions here

name: Kailee
review: There's a great color selection and this foundation is buildable as well as extremely long wearing.

name: Rebecca
review: I have been using this product for years. It provides just enough coverage without being looking cakey on the skin. I can layer it very easily, and it still looks natural. I do apply this product with my fingers and I definitely recommend setting it with a good matte powder.

name: Emily
review: This is a thick foundation which works for me since I have an uneven skin tone.  It goes on nice and my face didn't get oily until hours later so it works well.

name: Nita
review:
Love the color
Easy to apply
Must reapply if having plans after work

name: CHang07
review: I apply this product with a flat top brush and it's amazing at soaking up oils. I have combo skin and this stuff is a no no for combo skin girls. For me, it absorbed all my oils that my skin felt soo dry and I could see dry patches on my skin. I think this would be best for very oily skin. I wished this foundation would only set matte, but not absorb all the oil on my skin.

name: Phyl Phyl
review: I match my skin tone very well

name: Christy
review: Really lasts a long time

name: S
review:
I purchased this product because I heard great reviews about it, and it really did live up to the hype. This foundation definitely provides full coverage, and lasts all day long. It also matched my skin perfectly! It did not make my face shiny or oily at any part of the day.
However, this stuff made my face break out like crazy. It definitely clogged my pores. Also, the bottle it comes in is very annoying to deal with as it does not have a pump and requires you to CAREFULLY pore the foundation out, which did cause it to be messy.

name: Laney
review: Love this product! This is my third time using this brand and I don't think i'll ever use anything else!

name: Beauty By Rose
review: Easy application but it is way too cakey. I bought the one for combo skin and it made my skin look ten times oily and shiny. I have many revlon products that I love which was why i figured I'd try this.

name: soccerchick
review: This product does not cut it for me. It looks good when I apply it, but after 2 hours it already looks like it's gone. My face is oily and this makeup doesn't help. After a few hours I have to blot and I still feel like it does not look great. I would recommend looking for something that will actually stay on and not look like you've tried to wipe it off only 2 hours in.

name: jenb
review: This makeup is amazing. I usually use mineral power, this just impressed me! It last all day with out touch up. I put this foundation on with Revlon translucent powder to set it and all I have to do is use blotting paper to remove a little oil during the day. I love that I do not have to touch up and look flawless for at least 12-15 hours!

name: DayDee
review: I'm a makeup powder user but I wanted to try a liquid foundation just for the heck of it and I had heard good things about this one so I decided to try it out. The first one I ordered was completely the wrong shade but that was obviously a mistake on my part. When I finally got the correct shade I realized I liked this foundation better for a night out. I tried it on and went to class in it and it just felt like it looked too drastic for me. It was good just too much for a simple day of classes.

name: Solin
review:
Luxurious preoduct
Very similar to high end

name: Meredith
review:
I am obsessed with trying different liquid foundations, from cheap to high end. I didn't think I would find one I liked as much as the Chanel Mat Lumiere, especially at the drugstore, but I did. The colorstay goes on really easily and sets quickly. It's pretty heavy coverage, but I like that. I have very oily skin so throughout the day, most foundations tend to separate on my skin. I'm not sure how to describe it, but I'll find little patches of oil where the make up has kind of congealed.

Regardless, this is one of the first foundations that stays on with little need to touch up all day. I love it. I have my Chanel and this at home and can say that I reach for this one more often than the other.

I wish it came in a pump, though, as I don't like having to work hard to get the product out. But for the price, totally worth it.

name: Alyssa
review: Was looking for a temporary drugstore foundation until my Nars shade was back in stock. I wasn't expecting to love it but i thought i would like it enough. i read a lot of reviews about this being one of the best drugstore foundations. This was NOT the case. I have the lightest shade and it basically makes my face pink. Along with that it is soooo cakey it is unbelievable. I goes on very patchy (I've tried a flat top brush & beauty blender with it) and it just doesn't work. This is not good for combo skin either. It WILL cling to every single dry patch and make it 100x worse. I am very picky about my foundations but this was very disappointing.

name: VioletFire
review: I try different foundations every now and then, but I always end up going back to this one.  I have combo skin, so I'm shiny within a couple hours of application with most makeup, but that's not the case here.  You must use a light hand and work quickly.  It's full coverage and matte, so a little goes a long way.  It also sets very quickly. I recommend a primer and not using fingers to blend - if I use a primer and beauty blender, I don't see oxidation later in the day. I don't need much concealer.  It gives me a great canvas for the rest of my makeup.

name: SCGal
review: This is the only 'drugstore' foundation I use. I have very oily skin and this keeps most of the oil away (I maybe blot about 2 times a day). The coverage is great and it lasts all day for me (this is really 24 hour makeup). I have used this for about 2 years now and I don't want to try anything else. Before, I was switching all the time or trying to find added ways to reduce shine. I love this stuff and will continue to purchase. Price is great and normally will last about 3-4 months for me.

name: Dandie Andie
review:
The color matches my medium/olive/yellow undertone more than any other foundation. With 1 even application you get an all day natural medium coverage and you can definitely build on if needed. I usually lean towards BB cream but this is a great for the days I want a bit more coverage.

Make sure you choose the correct product for your skin oily/combination skin or dry. I combine with Rimmel Stay Matte powder and can go for up to 5 hours or more without shine! Amazing!

name: Renay6925
review: I've used every kind of foundation, but once I tried this one, it became my favorite!  It is long-lasting and for an active person, when I put my make-up on in the morning, this has been the only foundation that will stay on my face throughout the day..  I recommend it to everyone..

name: Luna
review: The foundation has amazing coverage, probably the best coverage you can get at the drugstore. You don't even really need a concealer, even on acne. There's a good color selection- I'm really fair and yellow-ish toned, and Buff is a great match. The only con is that this causes MAJOR breakouts on me. I have skin that breaks out very easily, but this causes major cystic breakouts for me, so I can't use it very much. If you don't have very sensitive skin, this is an awesome product!

name: Emily
review: I have combination oily/dry skin, as well as acne-prone skin. I thought this would be a good drugstore foundation, being that I have terrible acne blemishes and scarring, but I was wrong. This foundation is beyond cakey. If I use a decent amount, it's barely there. If I add another layer, I look like a Hershey's Cookies and Creme candy bar. Another con to this foundation is that I can't find my color. I'm a little bit paler than the lightest shade, which makes me look a little orange and fake. Maybe it's just me, but I wouldn't recommend it.

name: Moni
review: I like this foundation. Evens out my skin and I find it easy to blend. I would recommned the is product.

name: Cristy
review: This is by far the best makeup I have ever used!!!!! I completely love this product, I would totally recommend anyone looking for a foundation that covers but doesn't feel heavy this is the one for you. In love with it!!!!!!!!! Will totally buy again and again.

name: Kat
review: I love this drugstore foundation because it is equivalent to the make up forever HD foundation. But with an even better price. It has great buildable coverage. Be careful to not be so heavy with your hands when applying or you'll end up having cake face (unless if thats your go to look). I like to use it with buffer brush, spraying my brush with fix+ and buff it all over..it gives it more sheer natural finish. I have combination skin & it works great with it too.

name: Raye
review: After reading so many reviews before ever trying this foundation, I got the vibe that this was a great drugstore makeup. I went ahead and wore this for months, it was fine, I didn't love it but didn't hate it until I started getting comments from people saying "you have a makeup lines on your face". I'd look in the mirror and the makeup would turn bright orange and get blotchy on my fair skin regardless of the shade I used. I gave it a for more shots before I gave up and switched to Revlon Photoready foundation which worked a lot better for my skin as far as drugstore foundations are concerned.

name: Sandy
review: I like this even out my skin tone so made my skin look flawless.

name: Fefe
review: I have tried many brands of foundation and so far this is the best. For me, its matte at first but once it settles in its slightly sheer. Very pretty. I will continue to try other brands but so far this is my go to foundation.

name: 906mama
review:
I can't tell you how many foundations I have bought only to find they turn my face into a oil spill after a few hours of wear. Drugstore fails: loriel lumini, true match(liked ok), loriel liquid to powder (showed every line in my face). High end: tarte, urban decay, it cosmetics,....all oily within a few hours. Turned to youtube to find out what others are using and came across a blogger who fell in love with Revlon colorstay 1.) because she isn't oily in 2 hours 2.) a flawless finish for hours. I ordered 180 Sand and the color matches my skin PERFECT!

I have applied with fingers, brush and beauty blender, and found I love the finish of the beauty blender best.(although it does waste product) I have had so many compliments on how flawless my skin is. I have very uneven skin tone with red blotches around my cheeks and chin....this stuff covers them right up with one layer. I KNEW I found the right foundation after first use. I do use a finishing powder (cheapie from elf cosmetics) on top to seal the deal....do not touch up all day, ALL DAY!!!!! Now that is awesome!

name: Sabrina the cosmetologist
review: I have used this product for the past 5 years. I have probably bought about 15 bottles. I think this foundation smooths out your skin, it gives medium coverage with about 2 thin layers, but it is most definitely build-able enough to give full coverage. I would say it lasts a solid 8 hours on oily skin. Its not that the makeup fades a lot, it just starts to break up and look like a splotchy, runny mess if you dont powder yourself down every couple of hours. Even though it gets messy on me sometimes, I still stick by this product. It is the best drugstore foundation I have ever used and I will repurchase this again and again.

name: MakeupSavvy
review: I absolutely LOVE this foundation! I was using the L'Oreal Lumi foundation but I began to notice that only after having it on not even an hour I would just look like my face was DRENCHED in oil! (YUCK!) So after a lot of review reading, YouTube watching, blog searching I was lead to this foundation. I was worried about reviews saying it was hard to blend. I disagree! This foundation is SO easy to blend out, and it is buildable for those who like their foundation thick. It keeps my face COMPLETELY matte YES for 24 HOURS! The first night I wore it I got nothing but compliments and I even fell asleep wearing it (DO NOT RECCOMEND) and it was still on! The only things negative I would have to say is that it doesn't come with a pump but it's really not that hard to get the product out. And if you have oily acne prone skin like myself you absolutely HAVE to remove this make-up off at night!! Other than that is foundation is absolutely fabulous. Recommend it to all my friends now!

name: MakeupFreakTyler
review: Great founation. My number 1 now. I am a makeup artist and Im going to be adding this to my kit. Looks flawless and smooth. Last foreverrr! Looks amazing in flash Photography. The price is great for what you get!

name: J
review: This product is great applied with your fingers, or with a kabuki brush. It goes on smoothly, it makes my skin look amazing, and I must say, if you are getting photographs taken, this is the best (as long as you get NO SPF). I got some pictures back and OH MY... It gives you the look of glowing within, just absolutely amazing. The two things I do not like, is that I can find my perfect shade, but when it dries, it deoxidizes, and leaves me with an entirely different color. The other thing is that there isn't a pump. I really hate that. It is a great product though. It also does fade after awhile, but just comparing this to the Urban Decay foundation, this one lasts twice as long, easily.

name: EllenL
review: What a great product! It doesn't break me out, make me orange, or wear off throughout the day like all other products I've used. I use an Ulta Color Correcting Foundation & Primer Stick before applying this foundation so that my skin tone is more even. This foundation goes on smooth and does not require a lot. My only concern is that it is rather messy. I'd much rather have it in a pump bottle format. However, I'm willing to deal with that considering how well it's worked for me.

name: DevanEve
review:
This is my favorite drugstore foundation. Very easy to use with a Beauty Blender that is damp with warm water. I don't know if warm water is key here but it's what I've been sticking to. It goes on like a dream but you have to work quickly with it - work in sections.

My skin tone is a light medium with yellow undertones and my colors are MAC NC 20-25, Light 48 in Kat Von D's Lock-it Foundation. My color is Sand Beige in this and it matches perfectly!

name: KallieFuller
review: My first bottle was great, i had found the perfect foundation. My second bottle that i bought a few days ago was just too thick and doesn't do anything for me anymore. Now i have to find a new foundation :(

name: Danielle
review: I've used this for about 3 years now and it's the only foundation that keeps me matte and gives me full coverage. I have combo skin, very oily forehead but everything else is dry, and it doesn't show my dryness or oil.

name: Lori the Paralegal
review: I use it all over my face.  I may get it too close to my eyes, but the sunscreen in it makes my eyes begin to water after about 12 hours.

name: alimcnew
review: Word to the wise: it goes on lighter and you'll think "oh know I'm a ghost" it does dry a bit darker so don't panic! I am in love. It absorbs oils and lately I've had extremely oily skin. It's a heaven sent. I'm so happy I bought this. It covers my acne marks which is what I was looking for!

name: T
review: I absolutely love this foundation. I have tried so many expensive foundations and never thought about Revlon. I use a primer before use and of course apply with a foundation brush. I have oily skin and it last all day and provides smooth even coverage and I don't have to worry about shine like I experienced with Bobbi Brown & MAC. I live in the South with harsh hot summers and it last even with me sweating really bad. I even went swimming at a pool party and it stayed on!! The caveat is that it is difficult to remove hence the name "colorstay" so just make sure you use a good facial cleanser to remove it. The week I started wearing it several of my co-workers asked what was I doing different to my face because it looked so good. I told them it was just a foundation change. I will keep using this foundation. I use Cappuccino.

name: schwaa
review: I have this foundation in caramel and it's a good color match. It actually lasts all day and a good texture (not too matte or satiny).

name: fantasia
review: I am allergic to the actual ingredients, but not the ones listed on this site.  They should change it to the actual ingredients because these ingredients are of the older formula.
