I ordered 3 bottles and had to return because they were the new formula.  Looking at these ingredients I thought it was the older formula.

name: Paola
review: It has a very good coverage. It lasts a long time, but it does take a good face wash to remove.

name: Bad acne girl
review: I decided to try this product after all the good reviews I read. I suffer from mild acne but after trying this product I had a bad breakout! I'm so embarrassed now by my skin ! Don't use :(

name: Shonny
review: I have oily skin and usually have to use blotting sheets throughout the day when I use other makeup. I did not have to use the sheets with this on. My only complaint is that I had to mix 2 shades to match my skin tone.

name: Lellie17
review: Great foundation for the money

name: TessJac
review: Best foundation I've found for my acne prone, sensitive, oily skin. It controls oil and doesn't break me out. Sometimes it can make your skin look ghostly in pics taken with a flash which is annoying.

name: Amanda
review:
I was looking for a good cheap foundation. The last thing I had was a mousse foundation and an Olay/Covergirl that wore off pretty badly.

I saw a lot of people recommend this so I picked up a bottle in Nude.
I love it! When I first put it on I despaired because it was a little tacky and I've had bad experience with American BB cream. But it set wonderfully and was indeed matte, but not in the chalky way that mousse or powder can be.

My biggest love is the lasting power and the color. I have pale skin with a lot of red all over so even if a makeup fixes the red in my face, suddenly my face looks nothing like the rest of me. This makeup reduces the redness wonderfully but matches the underlying skin tone and doesn't "white out" the redness of my cheeks so my face doesn't look unnaturally different than the rest of me. And it lasts all day! I teach and I put it on an hour before work and when I take it off before bed it's still there. It does last longer where my face isn't oily but places like my forehead easily make it through the evening.

I couldn't be happier and I will purchase this for a very long time!

name: Missy
review: This is great foundation for the price! This is the second bottle I have bought of this.  I love how it lasts, it replaced a clinique brand so I was thrilled with how much I like it since it is a fraction of the price.

name: VeroHdz624
review: This doesn't leave my face oily and has great coverage. It's long lasting so I don't have to worry about making touch ups. Best so far I've ever used at a low price.

name: oliveoil
review: Great drugstore foundation with full coverage. I would recommend using your fingers to apply, it was difficult with a beauty blender. For the most part my VERY oily skins gets only slightly shiny, but with a mid-day touch up, it is fine. I would like to try a different primer to see if I can perfect this as an all day matte foundation. This is a great product for Monday through Friday when I just need something to get the job done! I found a color that matches me well, still want to keep using to see how this works out.

name: Rockin'Robin
review: I have oily skin in the T-zone and sensitive skin.  This foundation seemed like a win with all of the positive reviews.  It does cover well and looks great.  However, after only 3 or 4 days, I started to develop huge acne "volcanoes".  Stopped using it for 1 week and skin is back to normal.  I wish I could find a product with the same look minus the acne.

name: Jessica
review: I have been using this foundation for 10 years and I have tried a few others in between but ALWAYS come back to this right away. I honestly could not live without this foundation. I prefer the combo/oily formula over the normal/dry formula which is too thin and watery and doesn't provide as much coverage. The one thing revlon could improve on with this product is the color selection. I would like to see more cool toned options.

name: Emmy
review: I didn't really like this product that much. It does a decent job but my face feels heavy with makeup and I think it actually provides too much coverage. I look a little cakey when using this product. Also it may just be my face but this product feels greasy to me and makes me not want to touch my face or have anything near my face for fear of it rubbing off. Overall, would rather spend a bit more money and get a higher quality foundation that provides a lighter look and feels better on my skin.

name: YYaWannaNO
review: Since my skin is dry, I originaly bought the Colorstay for Normal to Dry skin.  I guess my skin isn't "dry" enough for that because it just made me look kinda greasy.  So I tried this.  I was worried since the only real oily part of skin is my T-Zone and my cheeks and forehead are dry.  Come to find out that the Colorstay for Combo/Oily skin is perfect!  Easy to apply, easy to sheer out if you want lighter coverage, very blendable, non-cakey, matte but not dry AND stays on all day.  What more can I ask for!  If you have combo oily/dry skin, definately give this one a try.  It's perfect and doesn't cost a lot of $$$

name: Kristie
review: I only used this product twice, but I liked it. It provides nice coverage, but is a bit heavy. I felt like my face was wet for hours and it looked a little shiny. Perhaps using less would work. I'd consider trying it again in the future, so give this one a shot.

name: KaitMarie
review: This is my favorite foundation from the drugstore. I have a hard time finding a foundation that I love, lasts all day, and doesn't make my skin look dull. This is it. I have rare breakouts now that i'm out of my teens but i do have some hyper-pigmentation issues and this covers them perfectly I use a damp sponge to apply it to keep it looking natural and I get compliments on my skin when im wearing this.

name: UmmLiz
review: I've bought this foundation after hearing so much great things about this on youtube. I have the Estee Lauder which I absolutely love! But its $40 ! So I needed something much more cheaper for an everyday look. It's greasy. Also doesn't give enough coverage and doesn't last long. I've tried a blending blush, a beauty blender and using my own hands to apply it. It's not even worth buying.

name: Mare 90
review:
I was in the market for a less expensive foundation and I chose this one based on all its amazing reviews. I thought it was good until I ran a half marathon in the dead of summer heat and humidity....and then I was IMPRESSED! I ran 13.1 miles (in record heat temps) wearing this foundation and it did not budge! I even wore a hat and there was no funky demarcation line where the hat sat on my forehead. One of the female race volunteers even did a double take at my face and was impressed that my makeup was still intact.

The foundation provides medium to full coverage. It can be difficult to blend, so I dab the foundation on to one section of my face at a time and blend it in with a stippling brush and that does the trick. My only complaint is that it takes a little bit of effort wiping it off at night with a makeup wipe (my only reason for giving it 4 loves instead of 5).

I'm generally a "brand snob" and was hesitant to try this foundation, but I'm glad I took the chance. It makes my skin look natural, but still provides the amount of coverage I like.

name: bre
review: i love this foundation so much! i have incredible oily skin with an oil slick for a nose, and i find this foundation works wonders with my skin. By that, i mean, it keeps my entire face mostly matte throughout the day. I occasionally have to touch up my nose,but other than that i'm pretty much set! by color STAY, they mean it really stays! it doesn't budge. i love this more than the kat von d, which is suposed to have amazing lasting power, but this is WAY better in terms of staying on my face. I find myself touching up when i wear any foundation other than this one. i wish the pigmentation wasn't so pink or i just need to mix two shades to get one that suits my undertone. other than that, im in love and ill alwasy go back to this product! try it out. its great for oily or acne prone skin

name: Shannon k
review: At first I thought I wouldn't like this product, but after using it I love it! I have extremely oily skin. It's also sensitive and acne prone. This hasn't broken me out at all and lasts long! I wouldn't say this product lasts 24 hours but maybe about 10/11 which is pretty long. It's also not cakey and a little goes a long way! Love this product!

name: Kelli
review:
I bought this in hopes that it would be a good, long-wear foundation for my wedding. I specifically bought this because the ingredients on the bottle said it MAY CONTAIN Titanium Dioxide and other flashback-causing ingredients.
I wore this foundation for a while - coverage is good but you have to be careful to not apply too much (I found using a damp sponge helped a lot). I bought it in Ivory and it matched my skin tone perfectly. It held up well after very long shifts in a vet clinic and helped control my oily skin.
However, I just recently wore it out to dinner where pictures with flash were used - I GOT SO WASHED OUT. You could very clearly see where my makeup was and where it wasn't. I was VERY frustrated with the fact that the bottle itself says it MAY contain TDO, when obviously it does contain it, and in large enough quantities to make me look like a ghost.
As long as you're not planning on having your picture taken with flash, I think this is a good foundation.

name: K Max
review: Alot of drug store brands dont cater to brown skin/dark skin females but Ulta is the only store that carries Revlon is all the shades. Other stores stop at caramel but im a cappuccino shade & it blended in so perfect. It lasted me from 2pm-12am at a wedding with lots of dancing.

name: 313bhargavi
review:
Since I'd heard such great things about this foundation, I was so excited when I finally got myself a bottle. When I first applied it, it felt great - really light on my face, and almost completely matched my skin tone (I got it in Toast, and I'm an NC44 in MAC).I was well impressed with its wearing capacity: stayed on for nearly 12 hours without budging and when I travelled with it, I noticed that it looked better when I got off the plane that when I was boarding it !

But I think all these initial successes made me blind to its other more fallible faults. After a few days, I noticed my pores were looking quite large and I was starting to break out really badly. I have sensitive skin and am prone to acne sometimes, but have never broken out to this extent. I think it was because the makeup was clogging my pores. It's really unfortunate, because for the price, this was a really good buy.

name: Sequoia
review: I absolutely love this foundation because it does everything that I want it to do. I originally got mine in Toast in the Normal/Dry skin formula, which works for me in Spring, Fall, and Winter because I am more dry skin during those times. I decided to purchase the combination/oily skin one in 360 golden caramel because in the summertime I am really oily. I like this one a little better than the normal/dry skin because it lasts on my face a little longer. Overall, this is a good foundation, but if you do not like the heavy feel it has I do not recommend buying this.

name: kays
review: i use this foundation just about everyday and it covers up what i need! doesnt settle into my dry skin, lasts all day, and evens my skin tone. I use what would be like half a pump (if it had a pump) to cover my whole face and its perfect.

name: Techie78
review: This is easy to apply and you don't need a lot but it made my large pores more visible. It didn't really control the oil on my nose but didn't make it worse. Looks like I'm still on the hunt for foundation.

name: Megan
review: I love this foundation. I have used MAC, Dior, make up forever, loreal, and more. This was the only foundation that both didn't have an orange tint & truly long wearing. I was sick of paying a ton for foundations that wouldn't last on my face all day, the only one that had was MACs pro long wear but a lot of their foundations leave people with an orange tint in the medium skin tones. This gave spectacular results, even matte finish without looking caked on. I use a duo fibre brush to apply and that helps keep the foundation a bit less cakey (it's a VERY thick fluid). So if you're looking for all day wear and willing to battle the bottle to get the foundation out, you'll be pleased!

name: browni4life
review: Its a really good foundation. I wouldn't recommend it for everyday use based on the heaviness.Gotta let your skin breath a little, u know..:). It has fantastic coverage even without a concealer or primer. Liquid consistency.

name: Mia - Tonya
review: Amazing for oily skin my hg ! The twenty four hour one is nothing compared to og with softflex!

name: Kenzie
review: Unless you have very oily skin I would not recommend this foundation. Yes, it comes in a great range of shades and stays on for a long period of time, but, I find it looks cakey and does not cover much on my combination/dry skin. Very disappointed.

name: maddie
review: I tried this loved it, bought another bottle and hated it! Decided to buy it again to try and I love it! Seems I got a bad bottle before. Medium coverage, full once concealer and powder are applied on top. Applied with a beauty blender my pores disappeared and it looks flawless! I'm on accutane so my skin is normal btw but I have a lot to cover.

name: AmandaaaYG
review: I don't understand the hype about this product. I've been using it for about two months and I'm not impressed. I will say that it keeps me matte for a fairly long time (I have extremely oily skin), and it matches my fair skin tone better than any other drugstore foundation. Otherwise, the finish looks very cakey, it always comes out streaky, it makes your pores stand out and its extremely difficult to apply. Definitely won't be repurchasing.

name: MorganMichelle
review: I have used this foundation for seven or eight years now and I ALWAYS come back to it. It's a bargain and a staple in my makeup bag. I feel bad when women say it breaks them out, because I could not live without this product. Even after the reformulation, which was unfortunate, it is still amazing. It is buildable, giving medium to full coverage, depending on the look you wish to achieve. I prefer to pat it into my skin with a Beauty Blender, but I can also make it work with a brush or just my fingers. It dries to a semi-matte finish, and I top it off with Rimmel Stay Matte pressed powder. Stays ALL DAY long, and I work 12 hour shifts in a hospital. I also own MAC Studio Fix fluid foundation but prefer to save it for more special occasions as it is pricier, so Revlon ColorStay is my everday HG foundation. I could not say enough about this product.

name: your.beauty.bestie
review: love this foundation! the coverage is excellent,though occasionally my dark spots don't seem to get covered.. i love the finish of this stuff! its not really matte but its not dewy either. it's like satin skin! my face doesn't get very oily when i wear this stuff, which is why I love it! my only issue is that the pigmentation is a little too pink for me.. i wear an nc37 in mac and the 310 warm golden should've been perfecct, but when it oxidizes, it looks way to pink for my skin. i mix it with another shade and i'm okay. overall, with the prcice ad quality of this foundation, i highly recommend!

name: SILLY2014
review: I HAVE BEEN USING NAME BRAND FOUNDATION FOR MANY YEARS MY SISTER RECOMMENDED THIS PRODUCT I WAS VERY WORRIED IT WOULD NOT WORK ON MY SKIN BUT I WAS SO EXCITED WHEN IT STAYED ON ALL DAY AND IS TWENTY DOLLARS CHEAPER THAN MY ORIGINAL FOUNDATION!!

name: Miss Fritz
review: Best for oily skin. No more oil slick!

name: Yannah
review: This is the best foundation I've tried.  It stays on all day and is very easy to apply with a brush.  I use it as a sort of widespread concealer, just a bit over my face.  I used to work at a summer camp and spent a good bit of my time outdoors in the heat, and this foundation stayed on really well.  I do wear lotion underneath in the winter as it's rather drying, but in the summer it does great by itself - doesn't make my face an oil slick.

name: Evon
review:
This foundation is great if you're on a budget and want something quick and easy. It has, in my opinion, a light to medium coverage. I don't really need much coverage, just enough to even out my skin and I'll double it up on my breakout spots when needed and it's great. I use the Real Techniques sponge to apply this foundation and it blends like a dream.

The only con about this foundation is that it isn't long lasting and oxidizes weird-ly. I work a full time schedule, and keep in mind I have oily skin, and by the end of the day, my face looks a bit blotchy and cakey; only at the end of the day. Not quite sure if it's the powder I use to set it, but I have tested it with two different powders and the same results come from both.

Overall, a definite 4 out of 5 stars.

name: Meg
review: This foundation is great! I have VERY oily skin, makeup never stayed on my face until I found this. I can work out in the yard, sweat my butt off and my makeup still looks great! It's so cheap, there's no reason not to try it. I do set mine with a mineral powder because I like a very matte look. I've also notice that my face feels smoother and softer since I started using this product. Plus I have ance prone skin and have not had any issues with breakouts, which I was worried about when it recommended you use a makeup remover when washing it off.

name: Josie
review: I use this with a damp beauty blender, first I put a a little bit on my sponge then dab it on my cheeks, forehead, nose, & chin then blend it out. I have been using this since 2011 I believe & just a month or two ago I bought Macs studio fix & I only used that for about 2 weeks. It had good coverage but the smell was bad & the lady at the counter must have color matched me wrong bc when I actually applied it myself it looked waaaaay to orange toned. So I went back to this & this is some really good stuff!!!! I can't live without it! I always get compliments at work on how my skin looks great! Definitely recommend this to ladies with oily skin!

name: Rory72
review: I use a brush to apply tho u don't have to. I sweat a lot so this foundation is perfect for me.  I also use the color stay powder. My skin is very oily and it works pretty well but I still have to blot a little thru out the day. What's important to me is the make up not looking streaky because of me sweating.

name: Esmeralda
review: Great stuff! I was stuck between buying this or the Loreal True Match but I needed full coverage foundation (due to acne scarring). I had never tried drugstore foundations but now I reach for this over my MAC studio fix. Not to mention it's 1/3 of the price of MAC.

name: cooks
review: I love ,love this foundation. I use this foundation on an damp beauty blender. I get so many compliments on my skin all the time.I combine caramel and cappuccino sometimes or I just wear one of the other depending on how I am feeling for that day. You can make this light by blending it with an moisturizer, medium, or full coverage depending on your liking. I love this foundation so much that I bought about 6 of them just for backups. Trust me, You will love this foundation.

name: Tab
review: Love it but made me breakout.  Great coverage

name: blackberry's mom
review: I have EXTREMELY oily skin.  I am an oil slick by 10 am!! I've been searching for a good full coverage foundation for over a year.  Been spending TOO much money on high-end.  I finally did a Google and YouTube search and found out about Revelon Color Stay.  Anything is worth a try at this point. I tried Color Stay 400 Caramel.  I did not blot all day!!!  My co-workers noticed I didn't have a shine.  I cannot believe I spent less thank $15 and it works!!!! Thank Goodness!

name: With A C
review: The ColorStay line has been out for a while, and after some researching, I decided it was my turn. This seems to be everyones favorite foundation, and I'd have to say I'm converted. This is my first foundation where my skintone matches 100 percent! I was wearing it today with moisturizure and powder. Though the powder was sweated mostly off, the foundation lasted all day with no trouble. I've heard you have to work quickly with it, but I didn't experience anything. I've never really cared for Revlon, but this is a definite repurchase. My only issue is that I'm not used to bottled foundation, so it may be difficult to dispense once I begin to run out.

name: Mandymia
review: This is the foundation I used before being converted to IT Cosmetics and Tarte.  If I ever find myself unable to afford IT and Tarte, I will go back to Revlon Colorstay.  I used shade 150 BUFF in Revlon and that shade matched me perfectly.  I have had issues with finding this perfect shade with other brands, but in Tarte I use the Fair Sand shade or the Light Sand shade.  The Revlon foundation provided a great matte finish for my oily skin and I used to use Clinique's loose powder in the invisible blend.  Now I use either IT Finishing Powder or Laura Geller's powder in the compact.  If you are looking for a budget friendly makeup that is great for oily skin and stays on all day, then Revlon Colorstay is the perfect product.

name: JD423
review: I got the shade 150 and it's a little too light for my skin, but that's what I wanted because I like to mix. If it helps, I'm a 2.0 in UD Naked. Nice coverage; as a result, it's rather thick, which I prefer!

name: Sheri
review: I like the matte finish.

name: ash
review: I have a love hate relationship with this foundation. It matches my skin tone really well, has awesome coverage, and keeps me shine free for hours. BUT I break out a little when I wear it. I am giving it another try because the first time I broke out it was that time of the month and I always break out then and the next I slept in my makeup so I'm hoping it's not the foundation! Another thing is I used my mac powder to set it and my face looked soooo powdery and cakey. I used my loreal pressed powder and that seemed to work better with it. Overall a great product though!

name: Ashley
review:
I'm a budget buyer, but I'll splurge on pricey products if they work well. Fortunately, I have been able to avoid buying high-end foundation because of this stuff. I have pretty oily skin, and I deal with some minor acne every so often. I struggle to stay matte during the day, and this foundation is the best I've tried! It is full coverage, and I pair it with a mattifying primer, and it is perfect. I use a flat top buffing brush to really buff this stuff into my skin, and it looks great. I have never broken out while using this. The only con to this product is the fact that it is a little heavy, but that is to be expected from a full-coverage foundation, so it's hard for me to even say that's a con.
This is my "go to" foundation, I will buy this over and over again. If you struggle with oil & acne, and want more coverage, definitely try this stuff before you try more expensive alternatives.

name: Mardi
review:
I've been using this for about 3 weeks now but I'm a bit unsure about this product. I want so badly to love this. It truely is a full coverage and budget friendly foundation. However I'm struggling with it but it may just the way I apply it.

I use dr. brandt pores no more primer then apply this with a damp beauty blender. I use mac studio fix concealer then set my under eye with dermablend powder.

The finished look however is just odd. It's pretty facelike around my nose and chin and really inhances my pores. On the other hand I really love how smooth it feels and that I don't need to set my whole face. I am a long time lover of loreal's true match but wanted a little better matte coverage than that provides. I'm going to try applying with a brush and without primer maybe those are the issue.

name: Liz
review: I use this product a lot. no problems

name: Russianwhitefox
review:
With the light coverage of this product I found that using concealer underneath a the foundation and using a Beauty blender gave the best look - I would not recommend using a brush to apply it.
Stays on all day best drugstore foundation - you can set it with a powder to keep it lasting longer

name: Weagle
review: It's been a difficult challenge to find a higher coverage, non-greasy formula for my oily and acne-scarred skin.  Any full-coverage foundation had immediatly been way too heavy and creased easily.  But not this foundation! It has done wonders in terms of coverage and staying-power, and that's in the hot, humid Georgia summers.  Also matches my fair skin tone perfectly, which is very difficult to do. Think I may have found THE ONE...

name: shower
review: Blends well covers my dark circle and dont have to apply much to cover them

name: KERI
review: I ALWAYS GET FOUNDATION FOR COMBINATION/OILY SKIN BECAUSE MY FACE DOES GET OILY, BUT THIS ONE DIDN'T WORK FOR ME (MAYBE FOR PEOPLE WITH SUPER DUPER OILY SKIN). THE FIRST DAY IT WAS FINE, IT GAVE ME A SMOOTH FINISH AND A NICE COVERAGE BUT DIDN'T LAST FOR MORE THAN FIVE HOURS. THE SECOND DAY IT ACTUALLY DRIED MY FACE AND IT LOOKED CAKEY EVEN MY BOYFRIEND AND DAD NOTICED!!! THIS FOUNDATION IS GOING BACK AND EXCHANGING IT FOR THE COLORSTAY MAKEUP FOR NORMAL SKIN (MAYBE MY SKIN CHANGED?). I'M CROSSING MY FINGERS SINCE IT HAS A LOT OF GOOD REVIEWS.

name: CeeBiz1990
review:
This is the best drugstore foundation on the market, comparable to (and sometimes exceeding) higher end brands. It's full-coverage without being cakey, lasts all day (won't rub off if you tried), goes on smooth, is buildable, and looks natural. You can't ask for more, especially for the price.

My only complaint: the shades aren't consistent. I got the "buff" shade in the "dry skin" type, and it was perfect for me. When that ran out, I accidentally got the same shade in the "combo/oily" type, and they are not the same shade. The "dry" colorstay foundation is quite a lot lighter than the "combo/oily" one. At the drugstore, I looked at all the colorstay foundations and saw that the shades varied quite a lot, even though they were supposed to be the same shade. So be careful when picking out your match, and don't assume that the same shade will work next time you buy it.

Other than that oversight, this foundation is perfection. Not too heavy for summer, and you won't sweat it off, which is great.

name: Grandma
review: I've been using this foundation since it first came out years ago and have tried pricier foundations without the same success.I have very fair, very oily skin, sensitive skin and people always comment on how great my skin and make-up looks but my foundation doesn't look heavy.I always use a light translucent powder to set my make-up and it doesn't cause caking.This formula lasts for 12-18 hours without "sliding", but washes off easily.

name: Nikki C.
review: Great product from the drugstore. Nice aray of color selection, great price, and the best part it actually works. Has a nice full coverage, easy to blend and stays on for hours ! One of my holy grail foundations from the drugstore.

name: Eli
review: I have been using Maybelline Fit Me for years but decided to try this because a friend told me it worked great. She is right! I love this foundation, feels light and gives me amazing coverage. & best of all it has not made me break out

name: Steph
review: Incredible coverage! Lasts all day! I have acne pro skin and this does not break me out! A must have in your collection for a full coverage look!

name: Robin
review: Great foundation! Stays put all day. My only complaint wound be that once it dries you can't touch up very easily

name: KellllyP
review: I've never had a foundation that I could wear throughout the day without it getting oily and cakes. This foundation is what I've been looking for! I first used it while at a wedding. I danced all night and looked like I had just applied the makeup. I have extremely oily skin and this foundation works great to keep me shine free all day. Great matte finish too.

name: Mighty Mouse
review: It lives up to it's name. Last all day!

name: mimi
review: I use this color and product because not a fake orange color. It blends very well on the skin and covers well.I use this product once a day and it stays on all day. I do wish other colors were not so orange.

name: Jenn-e
review: This foundation has been one my go-to foundations! I have used a few drugstore foundations but none of them have been able to match up to this one. It is very easy to use and blends so nicely onto my skin. A couple of things that I need my foundation to do is to have good coverage (I have a lot of redness and tend to breakout), not get cakey when I apply a second layer of foundation, doesn't transfer (i.e. getting it all over a white t-shirt), and to keep my oily skin in check. For the most part, this foundation has been able to do that. I'm not a fan of full coverage makeup but this foundation covers my redness so well while still making it look very natural. It's very buildable and won't get cakey or make your face look dry when applying a second layer. It doesn't transfer onto clothes which is good! No one wants your foundation rubbing off onto their clothes.  Not so much in keeping my oily skin in control but it does a lot better job than most foundations I've used. The only thing I don't like is that it doesn't have a pump, so it's kind of hard getting the product out of the bottle. Other than that, I love this foundation!

name: KC
review: Once set with a dusting of powder, it stays fresh on my super oily skin for hours.  Does not accentuate my wrinkles, either.

name: Maggie
review: This is a great foundation, I was surprised considering it is an over the counter product. Last all day no need for touch ups.

name: Miss teach
review: I used to wear nothing but this in high school then switched to a variety of others in college when I developed adult acne. I used everything from Clinique to Mary Kay and was never satisfied until I recently switched back to revlon. I should've never switched in the first place. I'm experiencing less break outs and the ones I do have, or signs of hyper pigmentation are mostly covered by this foundation. I then go over with some concealor and translucent powder. This stays on all day and is full coverage. It helps keep my oil at bay. I apply this with my kabuki flat top brush for a airbrush finish. Why spend unnecessary amounts of money when you can always find this on sale! Even full price isn't bad.

name: Kai
review:
I got the combo to oily kind, but probably should gone with the dry kind. It creates random blots on my face and gets into my laughlines and under eye lines. Another problem I had with this product is that it transfers to my shirts even after a setting powder and spray. The tint is more on the yellow side too so make sure you get the most accurate shade for your skin.

Otherwise, this is a full coverage foundation that blends easily.

name: Gayle A.
review: this product is great at covering my brown spots

name: NudeLook
review: This was not full coverage plus didn't like the way it looked .

name: Jacki
review: I use this as my daily foundation in the winter. It's medium to full coverage so using too much can get cakey on my skin. It looks natural and perfect with my skin tone :)

name: Cassie B.
review: I heard a lot about this product, so I decided to try it out for myself! I bought it a week ago, and I already love it! I'm still in high school, so I was looking for a good foundation that gave light/medium coverage, but didn't have the cakey, foundation look to it. In fact, you can't even tell that I'm wearing any foundation on my face! I apply it and set with light powder, and it lasts all day. I have dry skin with some oily spots, and it does not keep my face totally matte, but does not make my skin oily at all. I would definitely recommend!

name: Princess Em
review: I recently bought this and was so shocked! I love it. Works great. Stays on throughout the day. Feels light. Comes off great in the shower. ONLY bad thing is that it can be oily. It has low-mid coverage. TIP: You may want to get a shade or two lighter than you normally get.

name: Kel
review: I bought this looking for something that could be better for my oily skin than what I was using. This is better, I still need to use oil blot sheets or powder but not as often as I used to. Shades are tricky for me, one is too light and the next is slightly too dark. It is a thick liquid, so you have to shake the bottle to get the foundation out. Overall I like this and will continue using it!

name: Indiana May
review: I have been in love with beauty balms lately but just needed something with more coverage and matte finish for my acne/combo skin. This has great coverage and the perfect finish- not chalky but not oily! I still need concealer for my darkest scars and blemishes but I expected that. If you look at the ingredient list it actually has alot of natural components but I wish it didn't include parabens...overall though it's a natural-looking, fuller coverage (medium to full I would say)foundation that is quick and easy for everyday use.

name: Melissa
review: I started looking for a new foundation (previously used cover girl Outlast Stay Fabulous 3 in 1 foundation) because I recently started working 12 hour shifts and my foundation I was using was leaving my face shiny(I have combination skin) around 5 hours into my shift. I needed one that would last a minimum of 14 hours. One of the sales people directed me to this foundation. I LOVE IT! It controls my shine even after 12 hours! And it matches my skin tone way more than my old one ever did! I will definitely be buying again!

name: Trisha
review: I was looking for something that blends easy, covers nicely and doesn't make my oil skin shine through after 8 hrs of wear. So far so good!

name: Mary
review: I bought this foundation and it ended up getting shoved in the back of all my makeup. When I realized I had this, I gave it a try. I love it! First, it's not too bad of a price for a drugstore foundation. Second, the application is really easy to apply for me and it lasts all day. I have combination/oily skin, and no other foundation has kept my skin looking as matte as this one. I use E.L.F's powder brush to blend it out (only three dollars; you should buy it) and gives me a flawless finish. I also use this on my eyelids as a primer and it covers the discoloration/veins and keeps my eyeshadow crease-free. Keep in mind that you may need to purchase two shades and mix them together to get the perfect match for your skin. Another thing is that it can end up being a little patchy/cakey by the end of the day. Other than that, it's a great foundation and I highly recommend it!

name: tayler
review: Full coverage, love this will continue to buy only foundation I have and committed to. Great for oily skin. Matte finish

name: Keela
review: I love this foundation! I have combination oily skin and by the end of the day my makeup is usually dripping off my face. With this foundation I definitely have noticed a difference. This foundation really does have some staying power to it, but sometimes by the end of the day I'll touch my t zone areas and some makeup will come off. With that being said, what I love most about this foundation is it does NOT LOOK like my makeup is dripping off even though it might be! It has a nice matte finish and is definitely buildable. Again, with that said, it does tend to look a little cachey as you layer it, but I find that a little goes a long way. I really do find that just a couple drops provides strong medium coverage and gives you a nice natural looking finish! LOVE LOVE LOVE. With a good primer and possibly some setting pray, this foundation will for sure last you all day!

name: pamela landsbury
review: I REALLY like this! I'm young, so this is really good for people my age with acne.  It gives the coverage I look for and isn't very heavy.  Unfortunately, it can look cakey by the end of the school day, which isn't a very good look...on anyone...but overall, I think it is great and TONS of beauty gurus use this.  So, I highly recommend it!

name: Productholic
review: I got this product because I saw that it was a dupe for Mac Pro long wear. It had lots of great reviews. Sadly, I cannot give it the same review. It's is runny and doesn't blend that well. It also makes me greasy in my t zone and I noticed a few little breakouts. I think it's a waste of money. The only good thing is that the color matched my skin very well.

name: caroline
review: the foundation for combination/oily skin is my favorite foundation. It works and matches my skin perfectly. The coverage is great and it feels like I'm not even wearing makeup!

name: Makeup Addict
review: I bought this foudation about a year and finished it in about December.I thought it would be a nice foudation because it said for combination/oily skin and it claimed that it wears up to 16 hours.When I tried it for the first time I disappointed.Within an hour of applying my foundation and the rest of my makeup,I was already dripping in oil as if I was sweating.I ended up using the whole bottle only because I didn't enough money and needed a foundation quick.I will never buy this again.I know everyone's skin is different so I won't say it sucks because it might work for someone else.It just sucked for me lol.

name: Dominique
review: This is, by far, one of the best foundations on the market for the price. It's very easy to apply, has great pigmentation, and covers very well. I love the wide range of shades as well as the formulation for different skin types. I will probably continue using this product as long as I do makeup. Love it!

name: Riley
review: I have naturally very oily skin, but am on skin mediaction that makes my skin incredibly dry. I trouble with acne, and at first I tried the Dry Skin version of this foundation- not impressed. I found that even if you have dry skin the oliy skin combo works MUCH better. I LOVE this foundation I think it has buildable but light coverage, stays on fairly well despite the fact my cracking dry skin becomes oily later on in the day. It is medium coverage, stays on well on multiple skin types, and has a nice natural looking finish.

name: sami
review: i love this foundation! the color i picked matched my skin tone exactly. it makes my face look flawless and i love the matte finish. its just perfect.

name: Pretty Black
review: The color was too dark and the finish was to matte.

name: LSP
review:
This is the first and only liquid foundation I have tried. I did a lot of research based on product reviews for various products accessible in drugstores since I can't afford anything expensive. As I sifted through reviews via product website and blogs, I realized that Revlon has modified the ingredients of this particular foundation to this current 24 hrs one. The mixture is quite thick, but a little goes a long way. I applied it with a brush at first, but it left streak marks and I found that just using my fingers to blend gave me better coverage. It covers my blemishes and neutralizes uneven skin tone and I always feel confident using it when my skin isn't being cooperative.

After my first bottle I bought another one but the weight was so much lighter, and the color tint was darker and it dried my skin out. It appeared to be the exact same shade, and I kept comparing the two bottles...but then I realized, there's an *SPF one and one without for combination/oily skin. The SPF one was the one that went on smoothly, and maintained the oiliness of my skin. It gives a great matte finish that appears as natural as liquid foundation can give. The other one without SPF seems fit for those that have oily skin because it applies very very thinly compared to the SPF one and it dries my skin out a little too much since I deal with combination skin.

name: Cate
review: Get coverage!

name: Makeup junkie
review: This product provides amazing coverage at such a great price! This is by far the best drugstore foundation out there if you're looking for full coverage. The product is very thick, but it dries on your skin very quickly and doesn't feel heavy at all. It leaves you with a great matte finish that doesn't cake up. It's super long lasting, the only downside is that it is somewhat difficult to wash off.

name: gp
review: After reading the glowing reviews and hearing about this foundation non-stop on Youtube and beauty blogs, I was super excited to try it. However, I was extremely disappointed. Although the formula is supposed to be for combo/oily skin, I found it extremely greasy and the consistency extremely thin and watery. I will say the coverage was good, but it was very hard to blend and sort of just sat on my skin. The color match was also very strange. I am a MAC NC15, and bought the color 150 Buff. It seemed like a good match at first, but after a few minutes on my skin, it turned into a grayish-green color. The biggest con of all was the longevity. Even with primer and setting spray, it barely lasted three hours on my skin before totally fading off. For a foundation that claims to wear 16 hours, I was very disappointed. Will not repurchase.

name: Cait
review: This is literally the only foundation I use. I have tried many foundations from many different brands, but this is by far my favorite. I have very oily skin, and this foundation does not slip off, even if I forget to powder my face. I rarely use a primer because they break me out, and it doesn't really set into my fine lines. I love this stuff. It can be very light coverage if used with a damp sponge, but if you layer it, it is great full coverage too. The best part is, is it does not feel heavy on my face at all. It is a light formula, which I love. I never walk out of the house without this foundation on. It evens my skin tone and is the perfect shade for me. The only downside to this is that it does not mattify my very oily face. But with a light dusting of powder, I am perfectly fine. Overall, if you want a great foundation for a good price, I suggest this!

name: Krsaco
review:
I have dry, sensitive skin and a fair complexion. I don't normally ware liquid foundation because of my dry skin but I really like this foundation. It absolutely lasts all day and I would say its a full coverage makeup but others might think it's more medium coverage. My only issue is when I first dot it on my face it kind of itches, but that goes away when I blend it together. I have also never been able to find my exact shade 110 was way too pink and 220 seems slightly too yellow so I might have to find 2 shades to mix.
*I don't ever look dried out or oily and I also do not set it with any powder

name: Lizzypooh27
review: I use the normal/dry in the winter and combo/oily in the summer. It's sooooo much better than Mac. It last sooo long .... All day and all night plus it's half the price of Mac. It will cause you to break out if you wear over night though. I wish Revelon carried powder my color though.

name: Cinnamonie
review: Okay I normally do not do foundation, with that being said I love this stuff! I purchased it in the color caramel and it is a perfect match.  It doesn't leave ur face with that cakey feeling.  I honestly forgot I had on makeup.  I'm have a warm undertone with hints of yellow.  It literally stays on all day.  I do wish it had a pump though which is why I gave it 4 lippies

name: RaisingMonkeys
review: I frequently get break outs and have trouble covering my red spots. This covers my irritated areas and I haven't had any issues with breaking out from it. It blends well with my maybelline fit me concealer.

name: Nathalie
review:
After my skin began to act up my junior year in high school, I thought it would be wise to switch to something that all the youtube gurus rave about for its coverage: Revlon Colorstay. I was satisfied with this for about a year, before I realized that it was creating all the acne it was covering up. This stuff is really thick and difficult to apply and it also has a rancid, chemical-like scent which becomes more bearable once it dries. Despite the fact that this is made for "combination/oily skin" it made my skin incredibly oily. I never really considered my skin to be oily until using this product. It caked up around my nose and highlighted the clogged pores on top of my nose. One positive thing I have to say is that it is full coverage, which I preferred at the time, and it also very long lasting. It is so long lasting and powerful that it is practically impossible to take off. When I would wear this, I would basically have to scrub my skin off with a cleanser, exfoliant, AND a toner. This totally stripped my skin. Not to mention the long list of ingredients, some of which are phthalates....which is basically a type of plastic....I don't want to put that on my face....

My skin has improved greatly since I've stopped using this product. Though I may have given this a bad review, this is just my personal experience using it. I know some people really love this product. I, however, do not. Now that I'm in college, I don't have time to apply a full face of makeup, so I stick to cruelty-free BB and CC creams.

name: Swells
review: Wear it daily.

name: Lori
review: I have very oily skin. This foundation kept me shine free all day!

name: Kaylabreallen
review: I've always loved this foundation. I've tried many different kinds, high end and drug store, but I always go back to this one. It keeps my skin from getting oily throughout the day, and it's full coverage so it conceals most of my acne scars and hyper pigmentation. This product is definitely worth every penny!

name: IrishEyes66
review: This is a very good foundation. I checked the full coverage option because it is very buildable and is easily a full coverage, natural finish foundation. It can be matte w/a light setting powder. I don't care for the smell but it does go away shortly after you apply. It lasts all day, no matter what and that is not easy to come by in a foundation of any price. Very affordable. Love it.

name: Shawna
review: I've tried SO many base products for full coverage, finding that most of them are heavy and don't stay on all day.  ColorStay stays on all day and is so light-weight!!

name: mosakillz
review: very pigmented great color payoff. feels a little too heavy this is deff FULL coverage works just as good as cargo  without the price good price too

name: Kailea
review: I am totally in love with this foundation!!! I was using MAC for the longest time but the cost was getting out of control so I began looking for a different less expensive brand. I'm so glad I chose this one! I have been wearing it for about a month and I have gotten so many compliments on my make up since Day 1. I am encouraging everyone to at least try it and save some money!

name: Bev
review: I use it every day and love how it covers. However, I would love to see the price come down a little.

name: ud obsessed
review: I really enjoy this product in comparison to other higher end products that I have purchased. It blends well with my blender and leaves a nice air brushed look. The only thing I don't like is the initial application feels heavier then other products. Overall worth the money.

name: Noel Day
review: I use this foundation everyday.  I like that my face does't get oily when I use it.  I usually get pretty oily too.  I don't like that it kind of dries my cheeks out because my cheeks don't normally get oily.  The good out weighs the bad and for the price, its great stuff.

name: Casandra
review: If you aren't sure, get it! It is hot and very humid where I live and this foundation is bulletproof.  Even with me sweating literally every time I walk outside, it stays on perfectly.  I have normal/oily skin and use the sand beige color.  It matches my skin exactly and at the end of the day I don't look oily at all! DEFINITELY worth the money, which is extremely cheap for a good foundation anyways.  I also follow up with the revlon colorstay concealer in the same shade as my foundation and I love that as well...

name: Long Hair Don't Care
review: I really like this foundation. I have acne prone skin and my t-zone can get very oily throughout the day. With this foundation, I don't have to constantly touch up with powder, the coverage remains all day. I will say that the 24 hour coverage (not sure if its sold at Ulta) is a significantly better buy. I've tried both the 16 and 24 hour coverage and can say that the latter lasts much longer.

name: Kaylin
review: Revlon Colorstay is a fantastic product. I finished a whole bottle. I have very oily and acne prone skin, and with this product I feel like it makes my personal flaws disappear. Which is impressive because living in Florida the heat really does damage to most foundations. It isn't totally matte but I don't think there is a foundation that stays matte all day. I touch up once or twice and feel beautiful throughout the day. I will repurchase this for sure and recommend it to everyone.

name: KatieKakezzz
review: I was really looking forward to trying this foundation.. But sadly it didn't work out. Although, This foundation DID stay on all day through me sweating and being in extreme humidity. It made my face look flawless with no concealer.. BUT, it broke me out HORRIBLY. My entire face was COVERED in ugly zits and bumps. It's been 2 weeks and my skin is still broken out. If you have sensitive skin like me, be EXTREMELY careful when trying this. There are much better foundations out there

name: sarah j.
review:
This foundation is very versatile.. if you have acne scars etc it's buildable, or if you want a lighter coverage, apply less & sheer it out with a flat-top brush (I use E.L.F's flat-top powder brush) Either way, it will stay PUT
especially considering the affordable cost, A+

name: BeautyBug16
review: I bought this item becuase it's supposed to be a dupe for makeup forever HD foundation. Unfortunately I ordered a shade too light for me, but other than that I LOVE IT! It really helps eliminate the shiny-ness and oily look. It makes your face matte while lasting all day and night!

name: Cj
review: I used a store item for years and when I found this product I found something that worked better at a cheaper price!

name: Outdoor Girl
review: I have been using this product for a year and half now and I love it. I use the carmel color/oily to combo formula and it matches my skin perfectly. I have used higher priced department store foundation that matches but doesn't cover well. I feel this product is light, and covers well. Make sure you get the formula that is right for your skin. The normal/dry formula does not work for me and does not match my skin, so when I purchase this product i don't just grab the caramel off of the shelf, i make sure i get the correct formula as well for the perfect match. Hope this helps!

name: MarieLove
review:
I use this product to create my everyday looks.

Something not so great about this product is that is is really hard to find a match for deeper skin tones. For example: I first tried mocha & mahogany and those color look like mud after the settle. Cappuccino looks great on me because of the warm tones

name: AnaI
review:
I love this foundation, love the formula. I use the oily-combo foundation. I was really happy with it, until i had to buy another bottle of the same shade and formula. I used the 310 Warm Golden.

I loved it because it was one of the few with a yellow warm undertone. Most of them have cool or neutral undertone. I purchased two bottles of that same shade at ulta because i couldnt find it at my local drugstore.

When I applied it i noticed it had a cool tone. I checked again with the first bottle i ever bought and they were so different. almost the same color, but different undertone. the two bottles i bought were cool tone!!!! Im really sad because for me it is reeeeally hard to find drugstore foundation for oily skin with a yellow or warm.

name: Jenny
review: I just started using it because my shade in Maybelline Fit Me was discontinued, but I had wanted to try someting different for a while since the Fit Me was sooooo oily. I like this product so far. I can't complain

name: Mosie Posie
review: I used colorstay for about 3 weeks, and couldn't figure out why my recently cleared up skin was breaking out again! In cysts, no less! Once I stopped using it, within a couple days the cysts that were under my skin practically disappeared, and that confirmed to me that it was the makeup. It looks amazing, my skin looks practically flawless when I put it on (even with the cysts), but I guess it just didn't agree with my skin. :(

name: Mimeex3
review: i bought this foundation after hearing great reviews on it as well as the revlon photo ready foundation and i must say i prefer this one more than the photo ready. the photo ready one barely lasted a couple hours on my face and was not medium to full coverage, more of a light covereage foundation. this color stay one stayed on longer and i was able to build it up to my liking. i would recommend this if you're looking for a drugstore brand foundation.

name: Yazlin Marie
review: I was in a rush when I bought this foundation and was surprised that I actually got the right color to match my skin. I've been using it for about a week now and it has AMAZING coverage! I use a beauty blender to apply the foundation, sometimes I don't even have to use a moisturizer. Yesterday I went to an amusement park with my good friend and it was super hot, although i did sweat a bit the foundation still looked pretty decent. You do need to set it with a powder or else you will get oily faster, but other than that i will continue to buy this product.

name: Jess
review: I have struggled with hormonal cystic acne since I was 14. My terrible skin is why I became an esthetician/makeup artist. Being someone who cannot take hormonal replacement therapy or antibiotic drugs to treat my breakouts, I've had to turn solely to topical products to help me. I have tried multiple foundations over the years, but this one is my tried and true. It controls my oil levels, gives the fullest coverage I've ever had, and doesn't break me out like other foundations have. Only complaint about this is that I wish their SPF level was higher than just 6.

name: Ashley
review: I have oily skin and have always been afraid of full coverage. I saw this recommended on a blog, so I thought I'd give it a try. I absolutely love it!! It goes on smooth and blends easily. I don't think it feels heavy and it gives full coverage. I like how it gives a subtle dewy look and not cakey. I would highly recommend this foundation!!!

name: Jessica
review: Best foundation I have ever used including highend brands like MAC and urban decay.

name: Babycakes
review: I have been experimenting with foundations to find the right coverage for my adult acne and oily skin. I've tried Makeup Forever Velvet Matte (good, but expensive and heavy), Studio Gear Matte (okay coverage, but get oily after a few hours), Bareminerals Matte foundation powder (poor coverage), and read a review about this product so I gave it a try. I've been using it for a week now, and I can't believe the quality for the price. I would definitely give it a shot. There's so many colors to choose from, so you're likely to find the right shade. This product holds up to my very oily skin...literally all day long without having to blot...miracle!!

name: MaggieMae
review:
Revlon Colorstay surpasses most high end department store foundations.

I'm 50 years old, and need a foundation that doesn't settle into my face lines and gives me natural coverage over blemishes, redness, and age spots.

I dip a q-tip in the bottle to remove a small amount of foundation. I put it on the back of my hand, sometimes blending two shades. Then I work quickly to apply a thin layer of foundation using a damp foundation brush.

In my experience, using a good damp foundation brush and using a very small amount of foundation will give the best results. Finger application or make-up sponge application looked too heavy. The foundation brush was a great investment and made all the difference.

This foundation sets quickly, so work fast, and blend. You can then go back and add another thin layer, or just build up the coverage where needed using a damp concealer brush. Set with powder and forget about it. This is not ready to slide off my nose and chin by the end of the day.

A big challenge for me, always, is getting a good skin tone match. I'm very fair in the winter, but brown up quickly and darkly in the summer. With the affordable price, I'm not hesitant to buy several shades. A good color match & applying lightly will result in a great look.

name: grey with highlighs
review: it blends really well if you add a little lotion to it.

name: mizzjess
review: Normally after 4 hours or so my nose is oily. This is day one for me trying this product. I did use a moisturizer and a foundation primer before applying. But little to no oil on my nose I love love love this foundation. I want to see what the heat does to this make up.

name: Retail Therapy
review: I bought this based on an online review & a friend's recommendation.  I was disappointed because I expected it to stay matte & control shine. It did neither. Perhaps it works better on someone with normal or combo skin. It didn't work well for my oily skin. I prefer Almay TLC. In Addition, even though I tired my best to get a good match, I got Golden Caramel, which is too dark for me. I have to exchange it & try to go through it quickly, in order to get my money's worth. Ugh!

name: EllieB
review:
This is the best foundation you will ever own. You can sheer it out with primer or moisturizer for light coverage, or apply two coats for super heavy duty coverage. You can use it as concealer. It will not oxidize and change color on oily/combination skin. It will not break you out. It will last ALL DAY.

This is better than any high end foundation I own, absolutely love it.

name: mikki the mua
review: I love this foundation, only downfall was that it took me forever to find a match for my skin.

name: Raelynn
review: i Love this foundation when i need a full coverage, flawless finish, it does leave me a little oily BUT nothing some blotting paper cant Fix !

name: Cookiee17
review: This foundation is for the most part very good and pretty easy to use.  One thing that I don't like about it is that it feels really heavy on my face by the middle of the day.  The coverage on this is amazing.  I will totally buy this again! :)

name: Tina
review: I use this product everyday. It never breaks out my skin or makes it look oily.

name: momonabudget
review: Another recommended budget product for oily skin, especially if adult acne is an issue. I cannot believe the color I bought on the first try was a perfect match! It is not heavy or oily and at this price, I can rest my wallet and my skin from MAC!

name: cynharris75
review: I was looking for a foundation that would cover dark spots around my chin. I was referred to this product by a review online and I'm very disappointed that it did not cover as mentioned. Also, it stung my face when applied. I have discontinued using this product.

name: Eevee
review: This is such a cult product and everyone raves about it. I seriously feel like I'm the only one that this product didn't work for. I really wanted to love it! I really did, but 1st the color selections are horrible most or all are pink and red undertoned and I have a yellow undertone in my skin. When I would wear this foundation it would just turn ashy red on my face and I've tried a lot of the color selections. I will say it is full coverage though! Although it is very heavy

name: Carol
review: Been using this product since it first came on the market. Very good coverage and lasts alls day.

name: Amanda
review: This used to be my favorite foundation until I found the Colorstay Whipped Creme Foundation by Revlon. This liquid does have great coverage and i slong lasting but it can look a little cakey up close if it is not blended RIGHT AWAY as it sets very quickly. It needs to be worked into the skin as soon as it is applied or it will not budge. I still managed to get pretty oily (I do have very oily skin) after a few hours using this, but not as badly as I would have without it. I think a primer under it is a must or it can settle into pores.

name: LilLadd
review: I will never by high end foundation again.  This product provides as much coverage as you want (light to medium depending how much you layer) and stays on ALL day. It was a little tricky for me to find just the right shade at first, but I'm not going to complain.  How many other foundations come in such a wide range of colors? Add that to the pro list.

name: Didi
review: I have been use this product for years and I love it. Tried a couple of other brands before but nothing compares to the covarage from this one!

name: Smashley
review: I love this foundation! I recently purchased this on a whim during the 40% off Revlon sale. Boy am I glad I did! I normally purchase more expensive foundations that are color matched for me but this was easier to match than previously thought. The only downside to this is the fact that it sets quite quickly! Don't try to blend your whole face in one fail swoop! Go in sections! OVERALL: HIGHLY Recommend!!

name: Alli$on
review: I have heard all the hype about this foundation but was hesitant to buy it since it's significantly higher than other drugstore foundations. I am so glad I finally bought it! I'm super fair complected so drugstore foundations usually don't match me. I feel that the 110 Ivory matches me perfectly. I have oily skin and this makeup stays put all day for me. I use my Real Techniques buffing brush with this and I literally get an airbrushed finish. I only apply one layer of this makeup and as soon as I apply it, it evens my skin tone out amazingly. I do occasionally have some blemishes and one layer does not cover them so I try to concentrate a little more foundation in that area. I don't feel that it looks cakey when I apply more to a specific area. The only con I can think of is you will definitely need concealer if you need serious coverage. Also, it transfers so be careful and make sure you set it with powder! I am pleased with the way the foundation applies, looks, and wears for me so I will definitely continue to buy this foundation!!

name: cooks
review: This product is great for oily skin plus it gives me a good coverage and even though I have to blott my makeup it stays matte for a long time about 6 hours'

name: LadyWarrior3
review: I returned the this shade because it was a little to dark for my medium skin color...but the shade lighter then this one works great.

name: Nancy
review: I use this product every day. It stays on in humid Florida weather. I'm 52 and it doesn't highlight wrinkles.

name: casionne
review: It blended well, wasn't too heavy. Also had a nice matte finish

name: NYmomof2
review: After trying it one day it made me break out.  Coverage was ok, but I'm going back to my Maybelline FIT makeup.

name: Jane D
review:
I have loyally used Estee Lauder Double Wear and MAC Studio Fix for years until I discovered this affordable alternative! I have been hooked on this for about a year. Good selection of shades, although I still end up mixing two to get my exact match. The coverage is really good, medium to full coverage, long lasting too. I hate the smell, it reminds me of paint, but that's my only complaint!

You HAVE TO try this if you are looking for a medium-full coverage, affordable foundation!

name: Kris
review: If you're looking for an everyday foundation and you don't want to spend so much money, then this product is perfect for you.

name: Jen
review: I have acne and I was looking for something that would not break me out and was affordable. It hasnt broken me out yet and it is very smooth. It covers pretty well the redness of my acne. I was using Cargo before and I love it but was so expensive to buy all the time so I believe this will work! It has a nice coverage and is very light! I dont feel like it is as clean looking as Cargo but there is not a big difference!! I do recommend this product!

name: sasha
review: I've been using this for a few years now and haven't felt the need to stray. The trick to getting the best coverage is to use a brush to apply. It goes on very easily with even coverage and lasts all day.

name: Amarie the ballerina
review: I was looking for an everyday full coverage foundation that helps control oily is easy to apply. I'm trying to hide my enlarged pores and acne. This did absolutely nothing despite the rave reviews. It also looked very grey not that I want to look orange but the grey look made people ask if I was tired sick or dying. Not the look I was going for. I will never buy this again!

name: Mel
review: I used the color matcher wheel near this brand which indicated that this was my color due to my "pink" undertone. I tried this foundation on over primer and besides a smooth application, there was a stronger pink tint than I wanted. I have light/medium complexion with pink undertones (as I was told in the Ulta store), mostly in cheeks, but it seems it made me pinker in all the areas of my skin. I had to return. I was really hoping it would be for me.

name: rugby80
review: Stays very well and the coverage is great!

name: Krisevens
review: Provider full coverage that stays all day and keeps me from looking greasy and shining!

name: Katelyn
review: I applied this product over Hard Candy sheer skin perfecter face primer, which worked wonders. I had flawless skin. The only thing wrong with it, was that it had no pump and the coverage is sheer/medium.

name: Beauty Queen
review:
I have tried every foundation for oily skin and this one wins. This foundation is better than others I have used that cost two to three times more.
I have oily skin and with a decent primer I am able to stay shine free for 4-6 hours. A quick powder touch up or blot from oil absorbing sheets gets me right back to my morning face because the foundation does not fade!

name: Britt
review: Love this foundation because it is specifically for oily skin and it provides full coverage. Would love for the container to have a pump because I feel like I waste a lot of product when i spill it out.

To apply this foundation, I use a makeup brush. I think it gives it a fuller coverage when applied with a brush, and its just easier. This foundation definetly is full coverage, without the weight and heaviness. Throughout the day my makeup is still in place..& i have oily skin so that says a lot for me. I would definetly recommend! It's great for summer weather, Plus it has SPF 6..which is great it has something better than nothing.. This foundation stays and looks great by the end of the day. I do wish it was in a bottle with a pump, but i do see why its not because even though its a liquid foundation, it is really thick. Ive held the bottle upside down and it wont come out. lol Overall I love this foundation and would purchase again.!

name: Chaps
review: Compares to Mac studio fix foundation but is less than half the price. I hate to cut corners on makeup but this one is well worth it:)

name: on the run
review: I have oily skin no matter what I use but it blends well with my skin color and doesn't make me break out.  I have a cool undertone to my skin and this product doesn't have the fake orange tone that tends to be in fair skin makeup. The coverage is nice. It isn't a very heavy makeup which I love because it doesn't have that cakey look.

name: Lipstick and Lace
review: I am normally a high end foundation wearer, but I really liked this one! Great coverage, but my skin is a bit oily.

name: always searching
review: I have been looking for a long time for a long lasting product. I have tried powder and liquid. And I must say I think Iam in love with this product.It does exactly what I was looking for. A smooth no shine finish. And the color match was perfect.

name: Sabah
review: I think this foundation is too heavy for everyday wear but I love to use this on special occasions during the summer while I am more tanned. The color I have just doesn't match me during the other seasons. It provides medium to full coverage and I apply it with my fingers or buff it on with a flat top kabuki and it gives me a flawless look. BEST DRUGSTORE FIUNDATION.

name: Mrs. Nyds
review: I have been using this makeup for about 6 years and I still love it!! I have tried many brand names throughout the years but it doesnt compare to Colorstay.  I have really oily skin and im so impressed that it stays on, all I have to do is blott my T-Zone throughout the day and sometimes powder if necessarry.  You should really try this product.

name: Boog's Wifey
review: I'm normally a total "Brand Buyer" just was getting annoyed spending so much money on foundation. I read tons of good reviews and decided to give it a try. I got the "fresh beige" which is perfect match to my skin. There is a lot of people that say it feels "heavy" however I don't find its any heavier than liquid foundation. If your comparing it to a loose mineral powder then yes, it will seem heavier but that's not a "con" it's the type of foundation. I put a lightweight moisturizer on first. Apply foundation with a stippling brush, let it dry for a minute then blot any excessive off so it's less "dewy" looking. I apply a finishing powder and go or some bronzer. By the evening it still looks great! I have an oily nose so I have to blot that once or twice in the day but other than that it's great!

name: Nikki
review: My new favorite makeup. I spent so much on Department store brands that were good but cost sooo much. So happy I found this makeup. It is long lasting and my skin looks flawless. No breakouts yet and my skin looks great all day. No touch ups. I just use the PhotoReady powder here and there for shine. Yay! Thanks Revlon.

name: Malinda Jane
review:
I wish that I loved this foundation more than I do. I know some people swear by it, but I just can't get behind it. Firstly, it made me break out, so I just can't wear it. Aside from that it's SO easy to put on too much and you're left with a mask of foundation. Even when you don't think you've got much on your foundation brush it can quickly become very heavy-handed.
That said, it really does last all day. But this makes it a pain to wash off your face and makeup brushes.

name: FoundationSearchContinues
review: I don't see what the hype is at all!! This foundation has such great reviews and I don't see why... It made my oily skin worse! I have applied it every way (fingers, sponge, brush) and have used without primer, with primer, with good powder, ect... I could not get it to work for me. And to make matters worse, EVERY time I use this, it gets SO SO cakey! (I know that I have not used too much either!) Awful!!!!

name: Was not compensated
review: Overall coverage. Smooth to the touch. Does not come off on clothing

name: momluvnlife
review: It works!

name: Kali
review:
I LOVE IT!!!!! I ALWAYS USED TO BUY THE HIGH END BRANDS... BUT THIS FOUNDATION WORKS THE SAME OR BETTER THAN THE EXPENSIVE OPTIONS.
IT DOESNT BRAKE ME OUT AND IT LEAVES MY SKIN WITH A MATTE FINISH. YOU MUST GET IT!

name: Linda
review: I use the foundation almost daily. I know if I apply in the morning I will still feel clean and prepared for an evening out without reapplying.

name: minusthesugar
review: I have been searching and searching for some kind of products, whether a primer or foundation, to keep my oil at bay.  This actually lived up to the hype, and I am very impressed.  I had been given a sample of a very expensive mattifying primer from Sephora and it did not even come close to the power of this foundation. Excellent!

name: Noble One
review: N/A

name: Jan
review: I use this product everyday, great coverage amd last all day.

name: LD
review: I get all day coverage with this foundation, way better than some expensive brands I have used.

name: Diana
review: I am a full time student so I needed something that would last all day but at the same time not look heavy. This foundation works perfectly! I apply it early in the morning and finish with a light powder and I am good to go for the whole day. I have extremely oily skin so throughout the day sometimes I may add some powder but only out of habit, I could go on perfectly without any touch ups!

name: MaryDee773
review: I use this product with my make up forever hd foundation and love the mixture together - stays on great and use it for full coverage...i hate that it pours out, sometimes i waste, if this came with a pump it would be perfect...I have a very oily nose and t zone and this product really helps control the oil!

name: The cool cat
review: Literally I've had horrible acne since 5th grade. Horrible. I never thought that I would ever have "normal" skin ever again. This is honestly a life saver and I can't believe this makeup has helped so much. The price is absolutely affordable considering I was paying way more for what I thought would be better considering they were expensive. The coverage is wonderful and for a person who has oily skin after 1 hour after I apply makeup, I get absolutely no oil whatsoever, and I've had it on for over 10 hours. Thank you revlon! I recommend this to ANYONE! Thank you thank you thank you. This is honestly a life saver.

name: Swt.Denise
review: This is a good product for people with normal combo/oily skin. Since I have the oiliest skin known to man I didn't expect too much from it. It stayed put and looked flawless for about an hour or two. In a way it worked well because it did keep the oil away the entire night but I looked liked never applied a thick layer of foundation, which I have to do to cover my scars. I will probably still use it to control some of my shine but not as a stand alone foundation.

name: StudentOnABudget
review: I love this product! It does a good job of controlling my oily face, even after six hours (though my skin starts to look dewy after 4 hours). I apply very little but I still get good covrage. I like that I can build it up to full coverage or sheer it out for every day. It has a scent like markers in the bottle but when applied to the face, I don't smell anything. It has low SPF which is okay for flash photography.

name: Emily S.
review: I have been consistently buying this foundation for over a year or so, and I truly feel that it is THE BEST for girls with combo/oily skin!  Due to the thickness of the product, it can take a little getting used to in order to get the finish just right.   This foundation is very buildable to full coverage, and I sometimes will mix in a little bit of a BB cream before applying if I want a lighter, more dewey finish.  I recommend using a stippling brush for a super flawless face.  I have a rather oily T-zone, and I rarely have to blot throughout the day, and it stays put for well beyond 8 hours!  Love it, would highly recommmend to anyone!

name: uspprincess
review: Wonderful coverage!  I always get compliments when wearing it.

name: Holly
review: Great makeup for lasting all day. I have used this for years.

name: momuser
review: The only bad thing I can say about this product is that its very hard to completely take off! I used to think that with two washes of make up remover would suffice but thats not the case! I haven't found any good make up removers that can completely take it off with just 2 washes. And I learned the hard way when I started breaking out. I thought it was the product itself but after research online with other users, it was because that there was still traces of the foundation left on my skin. Once I've learned it was because of that, my skin hasn't broke out. And my skin is prone to that. If you purchase this, I highly recommend the best remover, toilettes, and or brush to completely remove the foundation. I live by this product! I've used really expensive products from Chanel, HD, etc and not even that compared to its coverage or price combination of the product. I have acne scar skin and this has been the best cover up foundation I've found. I'm done looking for any other types of foundation.

name: csl
review: The only thing that would make this foundation better would be a pump. I've seen complaints of it not blending well, but I apply mine with a flat top buffing brush and it works great. It really does last all day, and I've never had it "break down" even on the oiliest parts of my face. I love the full coverage, it really hides all the redness across my nose and cheeks.

name: Anna
review: It blends very well into my skin. The only problem is my skin starts to get dry patches from it

name: C Stef
review: I apply this liquid foundation with a foundation brush then I sponge over it all to blend it in with a wet makeup sponge and I found that this works the best with my skin. My one problem with it is that I have oily skin and I expected at least 10 hours out of it but by the 4th or 5th hour I start getting extremely shiny but it's been the best foundation I've tried thus far for oily skin so I can't complain.

name: Dana
review: I'm really pleased with this! It blends well, it lasts a long time and leaves a matte finish while controlling oil but not feeling too dry. And it's affordable. The only thing I dislike is that it smells like acrylic paint. I overlook it because of how well it works, but if smell is an issue for you, you may dislike this. I do wish it came in a pump bottle though instead of a screw off lid. Not a big deal since you can buy your own to reuse, but it'd be nice if it already came that way. It's just a preference. Overall, I think I'll continue buying this over all the other ones I've tried. THIS is MY foundation for as long as they keep making it!

name: JB
review: Best make up I have used for my extremely oily skin.  great coverage and does not cause breakouts.  I apply with foundation brush, it would be difficult to apply with fingers.  Last longer on my skin than any other foundation I have tried.

name: halogurl21
review: Long lasting. Does not clog pores. Super blendable.

name: Jazzy2894
review: This product is on the thicker side and covers alot with little product. I like that I can build coverage in certain areas. It never looks cakey. My only real issue is that packaging does not have a pump. So alot of the product is wasted while trying to pour it out.

name: Lilburrito
review: At first I was skeptical because it was a cheap product but I absolutely love it. The best Ive ever used.

name: Sarah
review: The foundation doesn't break me out at all, I have trouble-some acne, and it's coverage seems to last me all day! I do have oily skin so when I blot my makeup, some does come off (but that's just life). It stays on much longer than the L'oreal True Match foundation, and it's coverage is much better too. I recommend this for girls (or boys) with acne and have oily/combination skin. It really blends seamlessly and doesn't look like it is caked on. I use my hands to apply the foundation which seems to work just fine because I don't want to waste product with a brush.
