If you're having trouble finding a good match, I actually used the new Revlon Nearly Naked foundation matcher because they use similar shades to find it, as well as Temptalia by using it's foundation matrix. (It's an online makeup blog, check it out!). Overall this has been my favorite liquid foundation, and truly isn't heavy or cakey like others have said.

name: Coastalburton
review: I use this product just about everyday as my regular foundation.  It gives very good coverage, that can easily be adjusted depending on how much you apply.  This product is best applied with hands or a damp sponge, it dries a little too quickly for use with a brush unless you work very quickly.  I love this product because it wears very well and lasts throughout the day without looking heavy, greasy, or unnatural.  This is at a great price point and in my opinion it wears and looks much better than many very pricey foundations.

name: KMM
review: I like it so far. It needs a pump.  The days of tilting the bottle are long gone.

name: Karlene the busy mom
review: I have used Revlon makeup as long as I can remember.  Even when I was going through a skin breakout; which I thought was the makeup causing it but it wasn't.  I kept true to Revlon and it is still going strong.  Please don't change this formula.  It is so frustrating when you find something that works and then the company decides to change the product! They need to realize change isn't always the best way to go.  Revlon makeup is a great product! Don't change anything.

name: Lorisboys
review: This foundation has many great shades to choose from, but it's best to go to the store and see them in person than try to choose online.  Great coverage and lasts all day!

name: diane
review: I love love this foudation! I used to use expensive foundation such as estee lauder, mac, channel, bobbi brown, laura mercier lancome..etc..And all of them are around $40 to $50 and it is very expensive. I tried this and I was sooo amazed! I use with BeautyBlender sponge which works really great for this foundations. This foundation gives full coverage so it covers my blemish, acene scars and big porse. It stays all day long with quater price of that i used to pay. And I do agree that sometimes it feel heavy, if that happens I switch to revlon color stay whipped foundation. I love them so much so I bought them for my mom and my sister. they didn't wanna try this but I was keep pushing them to try this. Finally they did it and THEY ALSO LOVE THEM!! Lot of people complimenting our skin and we say "It's genetic!" LOL

name: munursekat21
review: I'm a nurse, so when I put my makeup on I'm expecting it to look good at the end of my shift. I have tried numerous foundations and none work as good as this. I don't look a mess at the end of the day! =) It really is amazing. I had watched a makeup blog that the artist recommended this foundation several times and thought I'd give it a try. It's definitely worthy of the rave reviews.

name: miruchuu
review: My skin is extremely light, so much that I always have had issues finding a tone that will match, but the Ivory shade fits me perfectly! And, as I have some acne scarring and occasional breakouts, I'm really grateful for how buildable this foundation is. It can be light if you want it to be, though. I highly recommend this foundation to anyone and everyone!

name: Mimi
review: I heard a lot of good reviews from various youtube beauty gurus and I thought it was time to try it. I have always been skeptical of foundations because of the heaviness of feeling like you have caked makeup on your face but this product is definitely worth trying. I have very oily skin so I use a primer and this foundation and I'm good to go for the entire day. So glad I found this product.

name: MC
review: After hearing so many good things about this foundation I finally decided to give it a try. Finding my right Colorado has never been an easy thing for me and I feel like with this foundation it was even worse! The medium tan colors always come out with pink undertones and leave my face a little white. And the deeper colors all make you look orange. Maybe it's just my skin or everyone else settles for either. Overall,  I think revlon focused too much on getting their foundation for the right skin types and totally forgot about undertones and colors.

name: MissMakeup
review: I heard a lot of reviews about this foundation, and it lives up to the hype of all of them! I was looking for something that would give me a flawless, airbrushed finish without feeling heavy or greasy, and this foundation is it! It is highly pigmented and offers full coverage with a solid range of colors to choose from. It took me a couple tries to find the right one for me, but luckily Ulta has a great return/exchange policy to make the color selection process hassle-free. My only con is that as the foundation is drying, it can feel a little tacky, so I have to get used to not touching my face while it's setting, otherwise it messes up the finish of the foundation. Also, I am used to using loose mineral powder foundations, and I was not aware that this liquid foundation would take the color of bronzers and blushes MUCH more easily, so I have to have a lighter hand with that. Otherwise, I love this foundation and will continue to repurchase it.

name: kram
review:
The Revlon Colorstay foundation for oily/combo skin is an amazing drugstore foundation. The coverage for this product is light-medium, but it is buildable. I mix a small amount with my Neutrogena Oil Free Moisture for Combo skin to make my own tinted moisturizer for oily skin. I then use my Urban Decay De Slick S.S and Mac Blot Powder. This minimizes the oil production and my makeup oxidizes less. I do see my foundation oxidize a little around the eyebrows, but not as bad as my MAC Studio Fix Powder Foundation or Too Faced BB Cream. The only downsides to this product is that when you take it off, I feel like it's still on my face. (I use my Clarisonic to clean my face, and there is a small amount left) and it might be causing acne for me. Im not sure if it's this or my diet, but I have been getting small (but not noticable) pimples on my cheeks, which I never get. It may be my diet though, i've gotten a little carried away with junk food :)

5/5

name: jamie
review: I'm so glad this was recommended to me. I'll use this for the rest of my life...

name: K
review: Good quality and inexpensive.

name: Kathy stanton
review: Used it with wet sponge and blends easily and its long lasting.. I didnt have any breakouts..i have a combo skin..best buy!

name: Christina M
review: Good coverage but due to being difficult to wash off, I believe this is what caused me to breakout.

name: Kekalek
review: This product is great!!!! I always wanted to try foundation but I was always was turned off by it rubbing off onto my clothes, other people's clothes and i could also never find a color that suited me. Well I tried this foundation and it is great! It stays on so well and it comes in an array of colors. The only thing is I have to get the foundation for normal/oily skin when I acutally have dry skin because the shade Mocha does not come in the dry skin formula. Other than that I love it!

name: Emilie
review: This is the nicest foundation I have ever used.  Previously I avoided wearing a full face of foundation because it always felt heavy.  But this is weightless.  There are 20 colors so you should have no trouble finding one that suits you.  It is probably not the best for dry skin since it dries pretty quickly.  But for normal or combo skin, it's wonderful.

name: Teens
review: great product. I buy it all the time

name: Chris
review: After reading all the reviews on this product I decided to give it a try. I tend to have a hard time finding a foundation for my oily skin that will match and won't cause break outs. Trust me forget the expensive department brands. This is a keeper. My husband loved the way my skin looked after my first use. Great coverage without the heavy makeup feeling.

name: Franny
review: WOW. I love this product. I used to use MAC Studio Finish dry compact since I was 18 years old -1996. Now I am 34 and the studio fix was settling into those happy little expression lines and I was on a hunt to find something else besides a powder (I do not like the liquid Studio Fix at all). I researched numerous websites for great foundations and brand vs. budget Dupes, and they all came back to this. I used the sand beige and it blends in perfectly with my skin tone. You can layer it for a sheer coverage or a heavy coverage if you are going out at night. It leaves my skin luminous. No breakouts. Covers. 1 coat covers red but still leaves a bit of my freckles through, perfect for weekend. For work or going out at night, I obviously use a few more swipes. I tell you, I have never liked drugstore foundations or makeup and have always bought dept. store brands, but this, my friends, is amazing.

name: lasouthernbelle
review: I've tried several shades in this product.  The foundation itself if truly comparable to a department store brand.  It lasts all day, doesn't leave skin feeling (or looking) greasy.  The biggest problem I have with this foundation is the lack of colors to pick from.  I have warm undertones, and EVERY shade of Revlon's Colorstay Foundation has pink (cool) undertones.  It clashes with my skin and makes it look like I'm wearing a mask.  Overall the product is good, IF you have the right skin tone to fit Revlon's limited range.  Revlon, PLEASE make more shades of this great product!

name: Sweetsz
review: I hate this foundation to start off it smells i hate the way it felt on my skin and it dries way to quick you have to blend it in super quick or you'll be stuck it a blotch on your face

name: Dana Bug
review: I use this product every day for my foundation. I have rosacea and this product covers the redness really well.

name: CosmeticsCrusader
review:
Great full coverage foundation for a decent price. Foundation has a matte finish and dried quite quickly so application can be a bit tricky. Only 4 stars here, though. Although the foundation seems to dry quickly, it does feel a bit heavy and tacky on the skin although it's been set for some time. Setting it with a powder takes care of the "tacky" issues but can make the foundation look cakey so use a light hand.

Overall, good value for money. Just make sure to get the right color/undertone and find an application process that works for you.

name: Just a Girl
review: This goes on very easily with great coverage for being so lightweight. Does not feel like i have on make up. Doesn't really look like it either. Dries to a matte finish. Been using for about 20 years.

name: Diva
review: I have been wearing this product since it has came out. I continue to try different brands or styles but for my oily skin, this has always been my favorite!! It stays on even in the heat, I get compliments on how great my makeup looks even in the heat and with my oily skin!!

name: MommyShopper
review: Provides good coverage.  Doesn't need to be touched up after work for evening.  Good shine control as long as moisturizer isn't too oily.

name: EMDz
review: I loved that it covered great, stayed on all day and din't look cakey. One of my new favorite products!

name: Chrissie
review: Careful not to use too much! Just a little stays on all day, even in the hot humid summers we have down here.

name: deepikamakeup
review: I am makeup blogger on youtube(deepikamakeup).I recommend this to my subscribers

name: AKay
review: I love the product, I use mac foundation and this is sort of a dupe. If you can not afford to buy high end foundations, I would recommend this.

name: Jazberry
review: This product, for the price, is a good buy. I have acne-prone skin and it hasn't caused more breakouts . It doesn't cover all of the acne, but it is less noticeable. Also, since I do have an oilier face, it does mattify the shine for some of the day, but not all. Although it is still hot here, so it's holding up well considering how warm it has been. My only issues are that it doesn't cover all my imperfections and there are parabens in the ingredients. But like I said, for the price and many choices on color, it's a good buy.

name: Mysti
review: I used this foundation when I was in high school. I applied it in the morning before school and after marching band or tennis, it was still on. Why did I switch!! I live in South Texas by the coast and my old foundation was melting like crazy. I decided to switch back to Revlon and boy do I miss this foundation! I went to play tennis and it was still on after practice. It covers my acne scars and blends great. I usually have trouble finding the right shade, but it was easy to find it this time. Never will I switch brands again!

name: Jazz
review: I wish it had worked for me, heard great things, going back to department store foundation

name: DNB
review:
I am honestly floored at how amazing this foundation is..words cannot even describe. I was trying to break away from bare minerals because I really wanted to find something that would last ALL day especially when I get up for classes at 6am and dont get home until after 3. I literally do not have to reapply this one single time throughout an entire day...through classes, work, or just hanging out. it covers my scarring wonderfully, I barely use ANY concealer. another thing I was shocked by was how lightweight it feels after it dries...like nothing at all. and it keeps my extremely oily T zone 100% matte the entire day (bare minerals would leave me an oil slick). another awesome thing is how it doesnt settle into any lines...anywhere! I dont know what else to say, I'm just so amazed that a drug store product could be better than any high end stuff Ive tried...AMAZED, thats it.
PS I apply with my fingers for best results. foundation starts looking best after it settles down and completely dries, which does not take long :D

name: makeup junkie
review:
-Product has a wide variety of color shades & is easy to find an exact match.
-I use photofinish primer, then apply this foundation with a Mac 187
-Its best to use a damp brush or sponge and work in small areas at a time because product dries fast.
I love this foundation!

name: Som
review: I would say this foundation provides a medium to full coverage, leaning more on the medium side. This is the best drugstore foundation for oily skin that I've found.

name: Yad
review: Blends well, good coverage

name: Budget lady
review: Color selection is great, they have all from pale to dark skin tones. But, the medium skin tones tend to have a orange undertone and it makes you look like a gweedo. It dries matte but, it does not control oil throughout the day...not even for an hour. I find myself oily within an hour and find myself having to blot my face. You definitely need a powder on top of this. Apply with a brush also!

name: Yanna loves beauty
review: I use this product with the E.L.F. powder brush and setting spray. It blend great and last all day! If they added a little more yellow pigment it would be a perfect match for me. But it is the closest match I've found.

name: BamaNat
review: Love this one!  It actually does what it says.  It's a perfect medium coverage foundation.

name: Clarissa1993
review: Absolutely love this. Only foundation that covers up all my acne scars and blemishes. Best foundation I've ever used. I always have a few backups of this in my makeup collection. Excellent coverage and stays on all day. You do not even need a primer with this. Stays on all day going to college classes and then working at Subway.Would recommend to anybody who is looking for a good long lasting foundation. It doesn't break my face out either. I have very acne prone skin.

name: karen
review: I put it on in the morning and my face is without oil all day!

name: medic
review: Very satisfied with this product

name: SabineV23
review: I love this product it has great coverage and lasts long!

name: soul sister
review: I love this product, it made my night of prom perfect! got so many compliment of how my skin looked flawless! for everyday use i just put it on my problem spots, but for big events i put it all over. This is a light and full coverage. doesnt make you look orange! love this product. last ALL day! i went to bed, whoops, and the makeup still looked perfect. LOVE this product.

name: cheysbeauty
review: This product was really cakey on my skin. It didnt have a very good finish at all and really wasnt a good coverage. I will continue to use it but im not going to repurchase!

name: Nikki
review: I was very impressed with this foundation. I did research before buying it and the reviews were all positive. I like the staying power and coverage. I do have very oily skin and it doesn't keep the shine away like some other foundations do, even with the oily/combo one. But all in all I would repurchase.

name: soontobmomma
review: Great foundation. I dont normally wear foundation but latley I have wanted a more smooth finished look. My sister uses Clarins and I tired that but it is a little pricey so I bought this one off of reviews and I like it alot. Lasts a long time and gives you a smooth dewy look. I also have oily skin and have had problems with foundations in the past because they would make me look more oily or they wouldn't last long at all. For [$] you can't beat it!

name: AnnaBanana
review: I love this stuff. After years of trying what seems like a hundred different foundations, I think I finally found one that I am happy with. My skin is prone to break outs and gets oily, so it's been a challenge to find a foundation that give good coverage, doesn't cause break outs, and doesn't dry me out. I will be buying another bottle of this once my current one runs out. The price is great too! My ONLY complaint is the bottle is not user friendly.

name: OKC Princess
review: This product does not last all day and is very cake!! Not good for oily skin as it causes breakouts and left me feeling very oily mid day.

name: candace
review:
I have acne prone / oily skin and this product works VERY well with it! I have used Neutrogena + Almay in the past but I decided to try something new. It gives you a lot of coverage for a good price!

It has a weird odor , not gross, but an odd smell. FYI! Overall, great product!

name: MID 40s MOM
review: Do not discontinue the product please.

name: Jen
review: I love this foundation! It goes on easily and provides great coverage. I have oily/combination skin and have found that this definitely evens things out, as well as keeps my break-outs at bay. It can feel a little heavy, but the pros outweigh the cons when it comes to this makeup.

name: Lexanne
review: I can apply this product and it stays on all day.  I don't powder during the day with this product.

name: HoneyBee
review:
I love this foundation! My skin is a little darker, I have golden brown skin so it's very hard for me to find brands that match well. I've used Clinique, Mac, Make Up Forever, and now finally Revlon. In terms of coverage I would say this foundation is comparable to Clinique. The coverage is just enough to give you an even complexion without feeling caked on like Mac and Make Up Forever.

It also stays on well throughout the day, which is a plus because I hate layering my make up. For those who said it didn't stay on, or was too thick - I think it might have been misapplied I use a foundation brush to apply, and I use very little. I actually use a q-tip to get the right amount on my face, that's how little I need.

Now that I've foud a cheap alternative to the expensive brands, I'm never going back.

name: GirlyFace
review: I can't say enough good things about this. It lasts all day, once it's on it won't go anywhere until I take it off. It definitely helps with oil. I have mild acne and some scarring, and this covers it without concealer. I *might* need to use concealer if I have a really bad pimple, but most days, this is fine alone. The one thing though - it dries extremely fast, so you have to work in very small sections and blend it quickly. If you try to apply all over your face all at once, you will not be able to blend it at all. I love this, I'm going to keep buying it.

name: JessD
review:
There's no need to spend a lot of money on a great foundation now that Revlon came up with this stuff. I's a great price. It looks natural and the medium beige blends with my skin flawlessly. I came back from a 3 day weekend with this on and my male coworker said my skin looked great. Which meant a lot considering he's a "man's man" and doesn't notice these things.
I also live in the California desert, were lately it's reached 118 and the heat doesn't phase my foundatoin (I don't wear primer). I don't normally buy drugs store makeup unless it is revlon. This is the only foundation I will use.

name: B loves D
review: love this foundation! Its my baby, i dont even consider switching. I wish it didnt show how oily my forehead and nose are after about 3-4 hours, i have to re apply powder but not a big deal!

name: Christina
review: Color was perfect. Paired it with a primer and it has held all day in the hot Phoenix sun with 50% humdidity. I love the Revlon Color Stay Line!

name: Fatima
review: Oh my gosh! I can not stop singing praises for this product! I was a firm bare minerals user since college (now in my late 20s) and this is the kind of product I had been waiting for all those years. This foundation will maintain its look even through a hot California day and look the way it did when apply in the wee hours of the morning. I apply early in the morning, blot as needed and it stays until I wash it off at night. LOVE!!!

name: lovernothater
review: This is actually the best foundation i bought so far. It's matte and great for oily skin, but the only problem is that it's too PINK! I'm a true golden, and this is just too pink. I want to return this.

name: Almost Albino Fair
review: I tried this product after Revlon discontinued New Complexion liquid foundation.  It's too heavy and doesn't blend into my skin.  I also have been breaking out like I'm 13 again since I started wearing it a week ago.  Back to the drawing board.

name: Sy
review: Perhaps have a sample kit so that you would initally choose the correct shade. The shade that I purchased was too dark and had a orange tint. I am not sure if to buy a shade lighter or darker to calm down the orange tint. It's unfair for me to rate this product effectively b/c I do not have the correct shade.

name: Kari
review: The finish and coverage of this foundation are acceptable but throughout the day this felt heavy on my skin and after several days my skin started to break out.  For me the coverage was only light to medium as the formula was too thick and cakey to build up.

name: livinggeekchic
review: I've been using this foundation for years. Out of all the drugstore brands, it is my favorite. It does not really last 16 or 24 hours. But, it has good full coverage, and goes on smooth. I have acne scars and this does a good job of covering. Is it as nice as some of the brands, like HD Forever or Tarte? No, but it's pretty close. And for the price, it's worth it, until I find a brand name that will last longer. That is the biggest flaw of this makeup. I feel like I go through it quickly.

name: Kirsten
review: I use a damp applicator spunge and blend it out, creates an airbrushed look.

name: Mel
review:
Great product! I have oily and acne-prone skin and I love this foundation. It goes on smoothly and lasts for the entire day! Only cons is that it feels a little heavy on my face-- that might just be me though. Another thing is that you have to be VERY careful about choosing the right shade; this foundation has medium to full coverage, so any mistake with the shade will show.

I highly recommend this foundation!

name: Andrettisky
review: Love it...use it daily and it washes off well at night

name: MediocreSole
review: I brought this product after several recommendation from friends and I love it thus far. I use a stippling brush (from real techniques) and it blends like a dream. I can go on and on about how great this product is however I am going to call it one word GREAT. I have very SENSATIVE oily skin and I haven't had break out yet.... The only negative this a could say about tho product is a wish it had a pump.. However the product is so amazing its not that bothersome

name: Blondsungoddessh
review: I have been looking for a foundation that actually COVERS the skin. I am in my late 30's and hate the sheer make-up (why bother?) This is the first foundation that has covered my skin evenly and has enough warth in the color that I look like I have glowing skin. The only 'issue' is if you want to touch up or reapply it can almost 'build' color on top of what you have so you have to be careful with that, but for the price the best inexpensive foundation around. I bought the one for oily/combination skin although my skin is dry and it seems to work better than any of the one's for "dry" skin.? Hmmm worth a try.

name: Tamerz
review: Good product

name: Jas
review: When using this foundation you have to blend quickly so that the product doesn't set on your skin in blotches. I love using a flat top kabuki to buff this in. It applies very evenly and covers up nearly anything on the skin. This foundation can feel quite heavy, but if you apply it correctly it will feel much lighter.

name: Jax
review: I went in knowing I wanted a liquid foundation with all day coverage and this was recommended to me. The coverage is great, I have normal skin with the occasional break out here or there and this is superb. I've been using it for almost two weeks and haven't noticed any additional breakouts which was a big problem before with liquids. It feels light on my skin and since I don't have time for touch ups much through the day I am pleased to find this has good wear. I would definetly recommend. Also, they have a ton of shades.

name: Mandirae
review: What I have loved about this product is that even at the end of the day, it's still there. Even after wiping my face, sweating, etc. Also, I have very oily skin and I find it takes a bit longer for oil to really show through. But after a quick swipe with a tissue or oil-blotting paper, my skin looks just the same as it did in the morning right after I put on my makeup. I'm super glasd I gave this foundation a chance. Love it!

name: Sdu215
review:
After noticing my FitMe foundation was causing too much oil on my face I decided to do some research. I came across this foundation and decided to try it. I have combination skin and will become incredibly oily as the day progresses. This foundation controls that for 8-10 hours of my work day. I noticed less oil on my chin and forehead and if I am going out later in the evening I notice all I need is to conceal under my eyes and a bit around my mouth.

It does add a bit of shine depending on how much you put on your skin but some translucent powder helps that in the morning.

It is smooth, does not clog my pores and fills in my acne scarring very well.

I look forward to trying other Colorstay products!

name: shopaholic
review: I really like this foundation for when I'm gonna be out somewhere for a long time. I don'd need to use a concealer when I use this because it covers everything. It also stays on FOREVER. After a 8 hour shift at work, I'll use a make up removing wipe and there will still be a good amount on my face. The only think I dislike is the smell. To me, it smells like roses and I hate the smell of any flower. If it was non-scented then I'd give it the 5 stars.

name: Pastamania
review: I apply this every morning with a stippling brush. It never looks cakey, even though other foundations that promised perfection- cough FitME and Loreal True Match- failed to do the same. It always looks smooth, matte without being "fake" looking, and glides onto my skin like a dream. And my skin isn't dreamy- I'm a teenager, with skin that is the definition of "combination". I find that it lasts very long, I don't have to carry makeup with me to school or anything- and I don't even use powder! I don't even have to use concealer anymore, this stuff conceals so well. I get many compliments on my skin, for once!

name: Melba
review: I've always had trouble finding a foundation that would work for my skin.  I have oily skin, and within an hour of using my previous products, I'd be shiny and feel gross. I've heard amazing reviews on YouTube for this foundation, and I had to try it.  I've used it a couple of days, and I love how easy it is to apply.  It's not heavy, but it hides my blemishes well.  I didn't get shiny, even after 8 hours of wearing it.  I'm not sure if it was this product, the use of the stippling brush to blend it, or both, but I definitely found a new foundation!  If you have oily skin and are looking for full coverage foundation, try it out!

name: Amanda
review: I use this product with a stippling brush and it works wonderfully! I do have to mix number 110 Ivory and 180 Sand Beige because when I bought number 150 buff wasn't available, but it gives me the perfect color. I have a lot of acne scaring along my jaw line and my right cheek. For the most part it does cover it, but I do have one mark that it won't cover up. I used to use the Neutrogena Healthy Skin foundations and the Almay skin Clearing one, but when I switched to this product my skin started clearing up right away! I love this product :)

name: Haley
review: I only put that it broke me out because I broke out the day after I used it the first time, but every time after that, it's worked beautifully. I put it on at six in the morning and it seems to mostly be there by 3 o'clock when I get home. It even helps my concealer stay a little longer. But, a powder is needed.

name: Dee
review: I have used a lot of expensive brands but this foundation is the best.  I have acne prone skin and it doesn't clog my pores.  It goes on smoothly, has full coverage, and stays on all day.

name: beans
review: a wonderful product

name: Hayley
review: I have tried sososo many foundations and this is one of my two absolute favorites (tied with Clinique's Double Face Makeup) of all time!! You can get light to full coverage. Because of this I can do double duty and apply it lightly with a sponge as foundation and then use the sponge tip to apply it to blemishes as a concealer. It keeps my EXTREMELY oily skin looking matte all day and it DOES NOT BUDGE. I go to a lot of concerts where I'm dancing and sweating for hours but if I wear this my face will still look completely fresh by the end of the night. I can also rub my face, get caught in the rain, or make out with my boyfriend (haha) and this stuff sticks to my face like glue. My only warning is that you want to apply this kind of quickly because it tends to dry fast.

name: Mademoiselle  Leon
review: I stock up a on Revlon Colorstay every time I see it. It is an excellent product and is similar to   M-A-C's prolong wear liquid foundation. I know because I bought both  products and compared them. Same job, but a better price.

name: Nikki
review: Great coverage to cover up my freckles

name: Deedee
review: This is a great product! Covers well and stays put for hours. Been using this makeup for years.

name: Oily with acne
review: I was using some covergirl products and clinique before. But, I wasn't 100% happy with the covergirl and clinique is hard to get ahold of in Stillwater Oklahoma. I saw that Revlon was a highly purchased foundation and decided to give it a go. The coverage is really buildable so you can apply a lot to problem areas and leave others a little lighter. It covers fairly well, my acne scars are significantly less noticeable. I use smashbox primer under this foundation and it lasts for hours. I normally get greasy on my nose, but it's significantly less with this foundation.

name: Beauty Brains Bites
review: This product can be a little difficult to blend, so it is best to apply the product on the face in sections if you are using a sponge or brush, but if you use your fingers, it isn't too bad. I find that if I put just a few drops of moisturizer in it, it makes is so much easier to blend.

name: Jane
review: I have used this product for years because of its excellent coverage and the fact that it stays on all day and does not rub off.  I sometimes try new foundation but always go back.  The only drawback is that it can be hard to wash off at the end of the day.

name: anonymous
review: loved this foundation. better than foundation that I am currently using that is $40+. I left this foundation only because their lightest shade got too dark for me =( I need to tan ASAP so I can come back to this miracle foundation!!

name: Shopsalot
review: This makeup got great reviews so I was so excited for it... right up until my skin started to break out... A LOT. Its thick enough for good coverage but on the same beat it causes REALLY bad breakouts. I have super sensitive skin, and this makeup worked fine on it- no irritation that is. I would recommend for oily skin or normal skin but if you are prone to breakouts- DON'T BUY.

name: makeup lover
review: i absolutely love this produect, i just changed from another one product that is not nearly as good as this one. for me this provides a full coverage, does not clog my pores, stays on all day, doesnt make my dry skin spots stand out, and its not too heavy on the skin. for me it works the best if i apply with a foundation brush then just blend it in a little with my hands to make sure it doesnt streak. all in all i absolutely love this product and would recomend it to people with oily or combination skin.

name: Belinda
review:
After using many foundations, this is the only kind I ever buy now.

I use a round sponge to apply it and it goes on and blends flawlessly, covering up ALL my blemishes (I have sensitive, acne-prone skin so this is essential to me). It's light so I don't feel it throughout the day. And it's difficult to mess it up if you need to touch your face for some reason.

I will say, I have really oily skin. Using this foundation by itself will appear greasy just an hour after applying it. Using it with bareMinerals Oil Control primer keeps the shine down longer but I still find myself using oil absorbing sheets after about four hours, otherwise it would get a higher rating from me.

name: KRose
review: Well I love it because it works as good as my mac one did. My problem with this and many others is half way through the day my rosaca shows through under my nose..booooooo but other than that ..love

name: StudioNC42
review: Love this foundation! Keeps my skin matte for hours. Great full coverage foundation.

name: MariGras
review: I have tried many department store liquid foundations and i have found this one to be the longest lasting.  I am done buying department store liquids and will just have to find something else to purchase to get those free gifts=)

name: lilu
review:
I have used this product as a part of an experiment along with True Match liquid foundation by l'oreal and the new Cover Girl liquid silk foundation.
True match dropped out right away. Cover Girl fulled me for two days. Come on who wants to be dewy right away. I got plenty of my own dewiness.
And finally Revlon Colorstay won.
It is very blendable, not greasy. Goes on smoothly and stays on skin. And it actually looked better than my Dior foundation. It has a beautiful matte finish. Looks like my own skin!!!
The only part that makes me not to buy this product again is the horrible chemical SMELL and the fact that it is made with PARABENS! In this day and age such a progressive company like Revlon should reformulate their products so they are not harmful.

name: Fla.Grl
review: I normally use Mac brand foundation, but wanted to try something different and definitely cheaper, if at all possible. A friend suggested Revlon. I was hesitant but what the heck. The Ulta sales associate was very helpful in finding a color that would match me. I am fair/light but its somewhat difficult to find a matching color due to my skin tones. The "Nude" is a perfect match. I must say, I was surprised with the coverage. I definitely found a money saver. One tip to share... I found its much easier to apply with a foundation brush. Although I do use the sponge around nose to blend evenly what the brush misses.

name: Amanda
review: This low-cost foundation is generally wonderful. It covered my acne and scars very well. I blended it with fingers on my face in sections (because it does dry fast) and it looked great. It also stays on a long time! When I pair it with Bare Minerals my skin looks flawless...which is rare with any makeup!!

name: claucampos
review: Couldn't find the perfect shade for my medium olive skin tone. Colors jump from too light to too dark. Mostly with pink undertows.

name: mom
review: easy to use, does what it says

name: Kate the Great
review: This is my favorite out of all the foundations I have ever tried, drugstore and department store! I have super oily skin and this works wonders on my skin! It can be just a little heavy but I found that when I apply with a stippling brush it is just fine! Overall, this stuff is amazing and I will for sure purchase again!

name: Budget babe
review: pretty good for budget brand, especially since it's hard to find a good color to match Asian skin tone without making me break out.

name: CJ
review: Lasts much longer than most liquid makeup.

name: Meg
review: This is a really nice foundation. It's great for full coverage- covering acne. It is for oily skin, but it did dry my skin just a little bit. Overall I really like it!

name: The Hairstylist
review: Ive tried many foundations and this is the only one that covered up my flaws well, stayed on for a very long time, and is a good price range. It doesnt smell and goes on smoothly. I have loyally used this foundation for 2 years now and I hope its around for another 10 years.

name: Nicolette
review: Too heavy and breaks out skin

name: Disappointed Anna
review: I mainly bought this foundation because I wanted a foundation formulated for combo/oily skin. Once I purchased it, I tried it on right after I got home (I picked the lightest shade ivory I think). It was okay, I looked in the mirror in my bathroom and thought it looked decent. However, I looked in natural light and my face was purely orange. My neck and body were their normal ghostly pale, but my neck looked like I used an entire bottle of bronzer. Every flaw on my face was emphasized. Best for darker skin tones so if you're Irish like me, skip all Revlon products unless you like having the most noticeable makeup line EVER.

name: Steph
review: I like this product very very much. The only thing I dilike about it is that it's so heavy that it'll come off easily, that it'll stick to your phone screen.

name: kds
review: I use this foundation every day after moisterizer.

name: SusRichwood
review: Love having an oil free option that stays on all day, covers wonderfully and the price point is fantastic (especially when Ulta is having a sale!)

name: gracie
review: Great foundation for the price. Long lasting and full coverage. A ton of colors to choose from, as well as what skin type you are.

name: none
review: Love it

name: Munkie
review: I'm a NC 25 in their studio tec foundation, and I got the color Fresh beige and I think it was too dark for me because the foundation oxidized on my face. so, it maybe was that I got a shade too dark for my complexion. OR it could also be that I used other mac cosmetics like their studio finish concealer in NW25 because I have noticed that when I use MAC products with other products like drug store foundation etc. I end up looking orange and dark throughout the day. But overall I LOVE this foundation. I would suggest getting color matched at the store or looking online for websites that help with color matching first!

name: casadaga
review: I was on a foundation hunt..tried Bare Minerals, MAC, Smashbox, etc..and I decided to try this foundation. I use StudioFix powder over it and it looks gorgeous.This blends so well- and for [$]...can it get much better?I def. recommend using a stippling brush opposed to a foundation brush. When I used this foundation with a foundation brush- it looked cakey. Now I use a stippling brush & it looks amazing.LOVE IT

name: Rachel
review:
As a girl who has struggled with acne all the way through my teens, this is the only liquid foundation that I've used that gives me both the heavy coverage I need without adding to the acne problem. I also have excessively oily skin, but this gives me a matte finish all the way through my classes and work.

I use this product on those days that I am breaking out or I just need a bit more coverage. I also use Revlon's Primer along with this product, and the combination virtually eliminates the appearance of my pores and acne, even some of my acne scars.

I would recommend this for anyone looking for more coverage in a foundation, as it is very thick. It also dries rather quickly once applied to the face, so blend it in quickly to prevent streaks. This is definitely a go-to product for me; give it a try if it sounds like what you're looking for!

name: Jen
review: Been using this for years, love it! I tried with the cosmetic sponges but my middle fingers work better for smoothing over my face, using the sponges to blend along the hair line.

name: Principessa
review: Ever since I discovered this foundation I did not use anything else. I have combination/oily skin and it really does stay put all day. The coverage is great and I barely need any concealer.

name: Kayleigh
review: I have very acne-prone skin. I also have a very oily T-Zone, BUT this is the only foundation that hasn't made my skin have flare-ups! :) GO BUY IT

name: FLUB  A DUB
review: LIPSTICK NUMBER 119 IS NOW 222 I LOVE IT! PACKED WITH MOISTURE AND SHINE. .....AND! IT STAYS ON!

name: Shell
review: I really like this foundation, even when compared to the prestige brands.  It's long-lasting, provides medium/full coverage, goes on easily.  I do find that it's best when applied with your fingers and lightly blended with a sponge; it goes on too thick and I get brush strokes when I apply it with a foundation brush.  I have oily skin so this lasts longer when I apply a light layer of pressed powder afterward.  The color and coverage lasts all day.

name: Alicia
review: This is the best cheaper foundation i have ever used. It matches my skin tone perfectly and covers up all of my acne scars. When using this with my elf makeup setting spray it lasts all day even though I have very oily skin. And you dont even have to use that much product to get great coverage!

name: Diva
review: I have used this product since he came out, I have tried other "stay" on foundations, this is the best bar none!

name: Britt
review: I needed a foundation that would stay on my skin and have tried very many ranging from high to low prices and this one has worked the best and is not too pricey!I tend to have oily skin and the weather in Florida causes most make up to come off my face, however this product has stayed on and not made my face look oily!

name: ashes
review: I usually only wear expensive department store foundation, but after hearing so many great things about the colorstay I wanted to try it. I love it! I have been using it for about a year now and still love it. It only costs a small fraction of my other foundations too. It's so easy to apply, I use my mac foundation brush & it looks so natural. People say it dries fast but I feel the opposite, I feel like I have to wait for it to dry! I use a really good moisterizer & primer too. A teenie tiny bit goes a long way so be careful.

name: Kristina
review: Great everyday, long lasting, full coverage foundation

name: Andrea
review: I've used this foundation for about 5 years, and will never use anything else as long as it's available. It's the only thing that stays on my face all day, and prevents shine!

name: Wendy
review: I used to use Loreal Infallible.  The store was out of my color (nude beige), so I bought Revlon Colorstay in Sand Beige.  I love it even more than Loreal!  Doesn't look as cakey, and the color is so close to my natural color that it makes me look younger.  I got lots of complements on my new makeup.

name: Keko
review: I have been using this foundation for two years now and I love it. It gives full coverage. I have to mix two shades. I have yellow undertones I mix buff with sand beiige and is the perfect shade for me. Its worth trying

name: mom
review: does what it says

name: vgcastaneda
review: This is by far, the Best drugstore foundation I have ever tried! Gives amazing, long lasting, Medium To Full Coverage. It does not streak. Not Cakey at all. Love the flawless finish it gives you. Very comparable to MAC foundation, but for less than half the price!!!Awesome product. Would definitely recommend this to anyone.

name: Eye of the beholder
review: I wish it had a little more coverage, but it doesn't irritate my sensitive, oily, acne-prone skin, and the color blends well.  Great for the money!

name: lcgirl
review: This is a great product for oily skin. It's very mattifying. I typically use foundation just to cover blemishes and red areas and it works well for that.  When I use this for full coverage it dries my skin out a bit. And that's with using moisturizer before applying. You also have to be quick to blend or it will dry in place.  I have to use a little cleanser to remove it and reapply.  The color works for me because it's very neutral - not too yellow, pink or orangey.

name: Cassie
review:
This is my daily foundation, and it's the best.
I love the coverage as well as the packaging.
This is my favorite foundation and I recommend it to every one of my friends looking for a new foundation with a great price(:

name: Kim
review: I use it everyday and it's a great price .

name: S.G
review: Goes on nice and smooth

name: M
review: I like this foundation a lot.  I use it to even out my skin tone.  I have it in the lightest color (ivory?), and it matches my skin because it is lighter than the lightest shade that other brands usually have.  The only thing is that I'm not sure if it's oil free, and it doesn't say "Non-comedegenic" anywhere on the packaging.  It hasn't made me break out yet, but I'm nervous about it.  Otherwise it's a great foundation.  If you decide to buy it with the setting powder, I wouldn't get the ivory powder again because it's just a little bit too light (kind of looks like geisha makeup).

name: KelsBells84
review: I love this product...I'm an esthetician and makeup artist and this is something that I find works great for all skin types.  It doesn't cause breakouts in acne prone skin, has a great finish, and looks great on camera.  I've found that I keep one of the lightest, one of the darkest and a few shades in between to customize for clients...this is a great, inexpensive alternative to MAC foundations for event makeup, and you aren't sacrificing quality at all.

name: Krystle
review:
I use this foundation almost everyday. I go to school with it on, and I work with it on. It's longlasting and doesn't break me out.
However, the consistency makes it so that when you apply it, you have to blend it quickly but that's about it. Great color selection too! It's hard for me to find a foundation for yellow undertones!

name: Karen
review: I have purchased many expensive foundations and none have ever stayed on like the Revlon ColorStay.  I was a little bit hesitant to purchase it because I was a brand snob and thought there was no way a foundation costing less than $10 could be any good.  I WAS SO WRONG. I apply this foundation once in the morning and set with the Revlon ColorStay Loose Powder and thats it!  No need to reapply or powder my face.  I loved it so much I went back and bought a second bottle to have on hand when I run out.  LOVE THIS PRODUCT!!

name: Kelly
review: I really needed oil control make-up> this works great and the price is nice! great job, Revlon!

name: Beebz
review: I will not switch foundations EVER AGAIN. This is by far the best liquid foundation I've ever tried. I usualy don't use liquid due to my oily T-zone, but this product seems to absorb or retain any of my oily skin. No need to reapply. My makeup looks fresh all day!

name: nessavirgo82
review: I love this foundation.  I use shade 350.  I was looking for a cheap replacement to my makeup forever foundation since had to begin penny pinching.  Fell in love with it right away. I get complimented a lot and people are surprised when I tell them it is Revlon.  I think I got them like 10 new customers in less than a year.

name: makeupcrazy12
review: This is amazing and my new favorite foundation. I t covers amazingly and it is amazing that it is so good but so cheap. The only thing I would have to say badly about this product is I have supper dry skin and this did not give me much moisture. But my skin is so dry that with allot of moisturizer my face still has scales. But bottom line I love it and I say get it.

name: KristenKatastrophee
review: LOVE IT. Its the best foundation i have found, i have pretty oily skin and this does the job! My face doesn't look like a oil slick anymore! The only downside is the smell, but i've gotten used to it!

name: Kapucca
review: I LOVE this foundation. It's the only non-prestige brand foundation I use. It offers great coverage for my hyper pigmentation. Doesn't cause breakouts (and almost everything causes breakouts on me). It controls my shine, since I have combination skin. I only have two issues with it... #1 The formulation is difficult to get out of the bottle because of the lack of oil. It would really help if it had a pump or something. #2 Not enough colors for those with light skin and yellow / golden undertone. This is a problem with all drugstore brand foundations, though.

name: Sally
review: Useful for what I want, just looks a little caked at first, but then as the day goes on wears well.

name: South Carolina Angel
review: Have been using this product everyday for several years. I have oily skin and this works wonderfully at getting rid of shine.

name: C.B.
review: Great product for everyday use and special occasions. I dont use concealer, and this foundation covered my under eye darkness well. It goes on easily and feels lightweight too.

name: Kai
review: The color truly does stay all day and is so much better than photo ready foundation

name: asweet
review: I really like this product but it just takes a little more effort to blend and spread around but I think that's why it stays on all day!

name: Tiffany Ann
review: This is my new favorite foundation. I have sensitive/oily skin and Revlon ColorStay works wonders! I find that it goes on best when applied with a damp makeup sponge. I purchased an airless pump online for this, because it's easy to waste product when you have to tip it over for each use. You can also mix this with a cheaper, low coverage foundation if you find that it's too thick for you.

name: Tina
review: I like the true color match and how it usually stays on at least 6-8 hrs

name: lori
review: love this foundation

name: Jess the Makeup Addict
review: Ive heard really great things about this foundation and wanted to give it a try. I have acne scars which needed to be covered and this did a fantasic job! Many people have said this dries too quickly but I need to work fast in the morning anyway so this was not a problem for me. I use a brush and i REALLy recommed using a good primer under this. Sadly, this broke me out a little and has an odor (similar to that of tempra paint). I dont know if it was the concealer that I wore that day or what but at the end of my day I noticed orange patches on my skin... im going to give it another try though. it totally lives up to its name of "colorstay".

name: Rachel
review: I love this foundation! I've used some pretty spendy foundations (Born This Way, Naked Skin, Bare Minerals) and I feel that this foundation does just as good of a job as any of those, plus it saves me like 30 bucks. Haha. I have combination skin, but definitely tend to get oily throughout the day. This foundation doesn't slip and slide throughout the day, but may need a little powder if you like a super matte face. Either way, it covers my dark circles, acne and scars without looking too cakey! I almost never wear concealer with this foundation simply because I don't feel that I need it! Definitely give it a try if you haven't already!

name: cassie
review: I don't know if I'm the only one saying this but FINALLY a drugstore foundation line that doesn't have primarily pink undertones in them!! I can't tell you how many times I bought a foundation that looked like it matched me through the bottle, went home and tried it on and was thoroughly disappointed by how pink the foundation came off on my skin. I typically am the second lightest shade in any line of foundation I try as I am with this one, I'm shade 150 buff. This matched me as soon as I started blending it on my face, with no annoying pinkness. This line is definitely made for us girls with cool undertones! I got it in the oily/combo version but let me tell you a few problems I had with it, it doesn't finish matte. Nor will it control your oilyness on it's own without at least adding a matte finishing powder like I had to. The oily/combo version finishes dewy and a bit sticky which I didn't like but as I said, as soon as I applied the matte finish powder it looked perfect! The only reason I didn't throw this stuff away after the annoying finish was because it's the only drugstore foundation that matches me perfectly! Also another thing is that it is quite hard to wash off. Usually I'm able to wash off all of my makeup with a scrubbing face wash and see nothing left on my face. But with this foundation because it is quite heavy and so full coverage I had to wipe off quite a bit of excess with a makeup remover wipe after my shower. I digress though, it is worth the money if you're looking for an amazing line, with tons of beautiful shades, that lasts all day and a nice handy bottle pump!

name: Debrameg
review: I have been using this product for a long time. Good quality and reasonably priced.

name: clau
review: After going through so many foundations I decided to give this one a try in hope it would work with my oily skin and I'm glad I did. I do wish it gave me a little more coverage.

name: Hannah
review: Stays all day, never cakey

name: Monika
review: I bought this foundation on a budget hoping that it would provide good coverage and have a natural look. I have a cool undertone and medium skin. There were not enough medium shades. And the ones that were available looked too similar too each other. Nevertheless, I picked out the shade that looked closest to my skin tone. The next darkest shade looked the same as the one I bought, and the darker one after that was too dark. When I got home and tried it out, it was way too light for me. I also lost the receipt and can't return it. However, I am giving it 3 stars because it applies well, has medium coverage, doesn't look streaky or cakey, and is what I would expect from a foundation for this price. Will work out for you if you can find your shade.

name: raerae
review:
I definitely did not expect to love the foundation this much! I have veryy oily skin, so when it gets hot, I expect to look in the mirror and see a cakey oily mess. I never had that problem with this foundation.
The first day I tried it I ended up going to the gym with it on. Through all the sweat and face-wiping, I got home and it still looked good! I also didn't break out from it (I'm super oily and acne prone). The next day I wore it wasn't a very eventful day, it lasted from the time I applied it up until I removed it and I didn't have to blot at all.
Now, for the ultimate test. I went looking for Pok�mon for a few hours. It was HOT and humid in Michigan (100 degrees that day if I remember correctly). I was so hot and sweaty and constantly wiping my face. I got home and cooled off later, then I looked in the mirror and noticed it BARELY caked around the edges of my nose. I'm super super impressed with this foundation. I expected to return it but I'm definitely keeping :)

I have a lot of acne scarring as well as some active breakouts on my face. I was able to get a full matte coverage using a flat & dense kabuki brush (sigma f80). I apply some dots of the foundation all over my face and then dab it in with the brush. I don't do a lot of "buffing" bc that moves the product around too much.
Highly recommend this foundation :) only downside is the shade selection can be tricky

name: Ali
review: I love this product. I have very sensitive skin and it has been great. I would definitely recommend this.

name: Gill
review: I've had better

name: Mag1997
review: This is the ONLY foundation that worked for my oily skin! I've tried all these name brands and NOTHING worked for me! I will now buy this foundation for the rest of my life! It stays on for hours & hours, which is beneficial for me since I'm a waitress!

name: Stephhh
review: Good cheap brand

name: Judy
review: It's long lasting but stains clothes if you drop a speck on your clothing.

name: Doxiemom4
review: Ive been using this product for 10+ years and have tried other pricey brands and this one is the best for me.  It stays on all day and it covers very well and has a great matte finish. The price is great. I have tried many other brands and could not find one that covered as well and didnt leave my face oily and shiny.  The only suggestion I have, is to make sure you use a makeup primer of some kind to ensure it goes on smoothly and looks beautiful.

name: Hshar
review: Makeup stays on even after rigorous exercise sessions

name: Afs
review: Been using for years and highly recommend.

name: Sarah
review: This is my go to foundation for full coverage. I love this foundation because it really does give a great amount of coverage without looking too cake. I have to say I now prefer the whipped formula better though.

name: Brains on Beauty
review: I have never been able to use a liquid foundation that doesn't make me break out. I seen a lot of good reviews about this product on youtube tutorials and decided to give it a try. I use Two Faced sensitive skin primer first and then apply a lite coat on my face in a circular motion with a foundation brush. I use a lighter shade and it has a medium matte type finish. Through out the day if it's warm the foundation starts to look more dewy, not oily. Liquid foundation always makes me break out, but this product does not. It can be a pain remove. To remove I massage extra virgin olive oil all over my face, no the EVOO doesn't break me out either, and it breaks up any makeup I have on. I wipe off the oil and makeup with a baby wipe, and then I am ready to wash my face. Great product for a great price.

name: Amanda
review: I really have no complaints about this foundation at all. I think I've found a foundation that works for my oily skin. It has a full coverage matte finish, and it lasts all day. It also does an amazing job at reducing any shine and oil that you would normally get with any other foundation after a long wear. I got Early Tan and it blends well with my skin. All in all I really like it.

name: Nyx Boo
review:
I use this foundation with a flat top brush and omg its flawless!
Its matte, longwearing, full coverage,great color pigment, feels highend.
I hate that it doesnt have a pump but I can overlook that! Color matching is a bit tricky though, so you can ask for help or research at home.
Great if Im going to be out all day, or out partying (; Looks nice in photos.

name: DG333
review: I personally did not liked it nor disliked it but I am not a fan so I'll just move on n keep trying foundations but so far I am a loreal girl :-)

name: brand on a budget
review: So far I like this foundation, i do hae oily skin so after some time unless iam wearing a primer my faces looks shiny and oily. But other than that, its very matte and does last, Almost a substitute for the mac! =)

name: ItsBrittanyDarling
review: I use this liquid foundation for everyday makeup in conjunction with Neutrogena healthy skin. Alone this foundation, put on with clean fingers, goes on very smoothly, but you must put it on in sections because it tends to dry quickly. i have combination/slightly oily skin and i noticed with this foundation it looks best when i use a Beauty Blender type sponge and it only looks better as the day goes on. I would Recommend this foundation to anyone who is looking for an affordable drug store foundation and because of its very large color selection it can work for almost anyone. I personally use the shade 250 fresh beige.

name: Kelly
review: I use this product everyday. It long lasting and blends well

name: Diane
review: Dries very quickly, and doesn't blend well. It's impossible to remove completely; you need to use makeup remover and scrub with face wash. I'm not sure why this is so highly rated...

name: Bin Bin
review: Started using this product while having bad acne.  Acne is gone and I wouldn't use anything else.  Easy to apply if you have a clue as to what to do.  Only amateurs can't figure it out!  Best to use fingers.  Do not use a sponge.  Only use a sponge to blend at jawline and neck. Dry with a small fan or hair dryer on "cool" setting for 5 minutes...then use loose power to set.  Flawless!!!

name: cookie
review: I have tried so many high-end foundations and was not happy with the results for the price I was paying.  I did some searching on you tube and heard many good things about Colorstay.  I must say I love it so much!  I will never go back to using my high-end stuff.  It lasts all day.  The finish is not too matte and not too dewy it's just perfect.  My skin looks so creamy.  I have to mix colors though to get the perfect match.  I am fair skinned and mix buff and sand beige....I add a bit more buff to get the color just right.  Hope this helps someone.

name: JLA
review: I do suggest making sure you pick the correct formula. My skin is very dry now due to the weather and the only formula in my shade available that day was the combo/oily. My face looks a bit dry and flakey no matter how much I use. I've been mixing moisturizer so that it balances my skin better.

name: Makenna
review:
I have Combo/Oily skin and all other foundations I have tried are not good at covering my skin. This makeup stay on ALL day long (even through exercise) and keeps me pretty much shine free all day. It has pretty great coverage, enough to cover imperfections without looking cakey. If you blend it with a makeup sponge it looks perfect every time!
I have tried countless other foundations and this is the best, and has a great price!

name: nikkivintagevixon
review: For the price of the Revlon colorstay it was a surprisingly well foundation. If you plan on purchasing this product be sure to find the best match to ur skin because it is a well coverage base and will show lines if not applied well or in matching skin tone. I have oily/combination skin and this really did keep my skin looking great with a matter finish ALLDAY!

name: LPITAL
review: Depending on time of year, I had been using Maybelline's Super Stay and Dream Smooth Mousse which had always worked well for me. I had heard a lot about Revlon's Color Stay, but had hesitated trying it thinking it would be too heavy and mask like, but I find that it is just the opposite. I get good coverage and stays in place without fading away. This has now become my go-to foundation.

name: el
review: For the price point, this foundation is decent. The coverage is medium, and it can sometimes be a little patchy, but builds up well. As someone with oily skin, this lasts about 3 hours before going a little shiny if not set with powder, but will stay on for another five hours at least.

name: alma
review: I have tried others and still prefer this product. Love it.

name: Bear1
review: I have used Estee Lauder for years and decided I needed a foundation on the budget friendly side to use daily. This is the first one I tried and I love it! It is a thinner liquid than Estee Lauder, but it builds well and lasts all day. I have sensitive skin and can get oily by the end of the day and after two weeks of use, I haven't had any problems with this product. Would recommend to anyone!

name: PrettyPalePizzaFace
review: I have oily acne prone skin and I really need something built to last through the day to keep my acne scars covered. It does not have full coverage, as my acne scars peak through, and it clings onto dry patches. It also feels and looks heavy but needs to be set because it has a tacky feel. It does stay fairly well through out the day and doesn't transfer and I also think its fairly light, still a little dark for my vampire complexion though. I do find it to be slightly pricey for being a drugstore foundation and when I first bought it, it was only around 8 dollars.

name: Alicia
review: I wanted to love this foundation but it was not for me. I have combination/oily skin and wanted to try this foundation for a while. I finally bought it after my FitMe foundation ran out and I did not like it. After I put my primer on, I applied it with my fingers then blended with a damp beauty blender, it dried quickly and I didn't like how it looked on me. I love full coverage foundation and this wasn't it. If I applied too much then I was cakey and I don't like to be cakey lol. Even though it wasn't for me, it may work for someone else. On the search for another full coverage foundation.

name: Amanda
review: very light weight. fits my skin nicely

name: Janelle
review:
Having acne prone and combination/oily skin, I did a lot of research before buying this foundation. Seeing all of the positive reviews sold me. However, I found myself disappointed upon using the product myself. While this foundation blended well and covered redness adequately, it cover my acne. When buying a full coverage foundation, I hope that it can really FULLY COVER. I found that it was not buildable and having to use quite a bit of concealer over acne and scars.
I also found how truly necessary it was to use a primer with this foundation. While I normally use a primer anyway, I wanted to see how this foundation held up on its own. It did not. Only after a few hours of wear the foundation had already began to separate from my face. My pores looked huge.
Bottom Line: I think this foundation would be good for someone without acne or bumps on their face, as it blended and evened skin tone just fine. Also for the love of god wear primer with this.

name: Mary
review: For ever

name: Foundation Junky
review: I apply this product with a damp make up sponge (beauty blender,  real techniques,  l'oreal sponge) and find that I prefer it not to be set with a powder.  It lasts a good 8-10 hours,  has great pigment,  doesn't oxidize or look orange on the skin,  holds up to my oily skin and performs probably the best out of any drugstore or high end foundation I've tried.  It will give flashback though because of the spf, so for nights out I switch to revlon colorstay whipped,  which photographs beautifully and does not have flashback (no spf).

name: JEN
review: I HAVE VERY OILY ACNE PRONE SKIN AND THIS FOUNDATION BEATS ALL OF THE HIGH END FOUNDATIONS. IT IS AWESOME FOR US OILY GIRLS. I HAVE A YELLOW UNDERTONE AND GOLDEN BEIGE IS GREAT FOR ME. LOVE THIS

name: Ronnie
review: Great daily basic coverage

name: LP
review:
I thought I had given up on drugstore foundation once I got a big girl job and could afford pricier makeup. After reading a lot of positive reviews I decided to give it a try, why not?

I figured the quality would match the price but I was wrong. I didn't want to love this foundation but I do. My skin is very fair and oily. Not a cute combo. I thought Tarte's full coverage Amazonian clay was my HG but I found myself reaching for this bottle instead more and more.

Excellent staying power (I always set this with powder), doesn't rub off on others, keeps my oily skin at bay until around lunch when I need to blot then it goes back to matte. It even stands up to sweaty runs in the summer!

My only gripe is the bottle, it just doesn't make sense for the formula.

name: Chris
review: Found it easy to apply and it goes well with my skin color.  Best of all, it is significantly cheaper than any "prestige" cosmetics.

name: none
review: I love this make-up because it doesn't rub off when you hug people.  It gives good coverage and doesn't change colors when you've had it on for a while.

name: Nurse B
review: I love the coverage and this is the longest lasting foundation I have found yet! I am a nurse so I work long shifts and stays for most of the day. Color match was great for me and it feels super light weight! I love this foundation.. I will be using this one for a long time!

name: Eboni Collins-Burris
review: Love the smooth texture and the natural finish.  Feels soft like air brush

name: Lilly
review: Works just fills pores in a clogging way

name: Xoxost
review: My daily go to covers everything well with out being too full coverage in the summer. My skin is noticeably less oily looking at the end of the day and it fits my yellow undertones as well. I always go back to it.

name: Mercedes
review: I used to love this foundation mainly because it has the best coverage of any drugstore product I've tried, plus it has a great colour. HOWEVER, it oxidizes terrrriibly! It goes on at the perfect shade and in less than half an hour becomes completely orange

name: Lizzie
review:
I love this foundation better than my last drug-store foundation which was Loreal true match.
I apply this foundation using my It foundation buffing brush and it looks flawless.
I love the coverage and how it blends.
I would recommend it to anyone who wants a new foundation.

name: Sarah Rose
review: I'm someone who wants to be able to use just one base product on my face... not tons of foundation, concealer, powder, etc. This product allows me to have it all at once! It has great coverage without being super heavy, and I'm just bummed I didn't find it sooner.

name: annabelle
review: I have oily skin with large pores. I purchased 2 shades since I've never used revlon foundations before. 180 is slightly darker than my skin and 150 was too pale. oddly 150 ended up being a almost perfect match because it oxidises after an hour or so. no matter what I did 150 always look heavy and broken down at the end of the day. it also dried out portions of my skin and clung horribly to those dry patches. I didn't notice this issue with 180 so it may be an issue with the paler shades. it also tends to feel heavy on my skin regardless of the moisturiser I use.

name: LEONA
review: I have been using this foundation for about 8 years. I loved the coverage, it was easy to apply and blend and I always got compliments on how flawless my face looked. Not to mention, the price was amazing! The last time I purchased a few weeks ago I noticed the bottle had changed but thought nothing of it. Well,  it seems they changed the formula and not for the the better. Coverage is horrible, lasting power is gone,  transfers easy and after a few hours it breaks up.No longer a good choice for my oiky skin. It is similar to their photo ready formula now. So disappointed!!! This truly was a gem for me.

name: Susan
review: Great

name: Maria
review: It's amazing and I mix it with a little bit of powder

name: Bee
review: Tried this since it was BOGO free but did not match my skin well, looked oily as soon as I put on.

name: Rachel
review: This product is super bendable and goes on smoothly. It has a nice neutral undertone and stays on all day.

name: Jules the soccer player
review: This product is part of my everyday makeup routine. It works very well for a foundation that's under 20 dollars. I have fairly bad skin, but when I have this on, you can't really tell (unless I have a big pimple)

name: Purvi
review: I used this product since i was in middle school!! I am 32 years old now!! But I will tell you this new formula is different with the pump!! Its MUCH thinner!! And I and very disappointed in the fact that i will now have switch my favorite drugstore foundation this year!!

name: abbie
review: My face was really dry but made it worse and greasy

name: prissy1232
review: This is an amazing product. I have oily skin and it is hard for me to find the perfect foundation, but This one has left my skin smooth and no oil spots on my skin.

name: sbeachbum
review: This makeup is just awesome.  I have used this for years, and I love it.  It's hard to find good makeup for oily skin that doesn't cause pimples.  I don't have any trouble with this makeup at all.  I won't user anything else.

name: Beach Girl
review: I have to buy the oily/combo to get the color(330 natural tan) that is correct for me. The color 330 natural tan for dry skin is much darker. Compare them side by side and there is a big difference

name: Meli
review: I have tried sooo many foundations, high end and all, and who would've thought Revlon would be the solution. I was actually on the lookout for Revlon PhotoReady foundation but they had none so I decided to go with ColorStay. SOO AMAZING! I really have super oily skin and I work 10 hr shifts and this lasts all day without showing shine. Of course a natural shine will always pop through and I do not touch up but it doesn't look gross or greasy and I am in love! It's very thick and has wonderful coverage. I'm so glad I was able to find such a wonderful foundation for such a good price :-) I use a Neutrogena primer and set it with Rimmel's Stay Matte but really the foundation is they key!

name: Blondesungoddess
review: Colorstay is the ONLY foundation that I can find that has what I consider to be an 'orange' tint. When you use self tanner there is a warmth to the skin and it's hard to find complimentary foundation. Golden Caramel is PERFECT for my medium tanned skin tone. I just wish the Wichita locations would keep it in stock!!!

name: awescared
review: I love this foundation, my skin is oily and this has worked for me fabulous so far, it stays all day and I don't even have to use primer  underneath, some days I do get some oil in my forehead but there is nothing a quick pat dry won't do, overall a total hit for me!

name: estrella
review: i have used a couple of different foundations, and i loved this one. i have to apply it with a wet squeezed makeup sponge to look nice, but it actually stays throughout the day and i think it is not too heavy/cakey looking on skin.

name: Val
review: Long lasting and excellent coverage!

name: Suze
review: I was a user of powdered mineral foundation for YEARS but having more mature skin, decided to try this liquid foundation after seeing it used in a beauty tutorial video.  I have very fair skin with freckles and a little rosacea.  This foundation in Ivory covers well (my freckles show through a little but that's OK), matches my skintone perfectly and lasts all day with no touch-ups except for occasional powder on my nose.  Also, my skin tends to be sensitive, and this foundation caused no breakouts at all.  I am very happy I decided to give it a try.

name: KND
review: Have been on the search for a foundation that is matte and has great coverage and have heard great things about this foundation so i bought it in hopes that I could find a good drugstore foundation to save me some money! Tried it for a couple days and loved how it wore! It lasts forever and keeps you from looking oily all day but after 3 days I was already noticing that my skin was breaking out.  If you have sensitive skin, this is not the foundation for you.

name: Vane
review: To some, this foundation is a bit too heavy, which is understandable because this is NOT a liquidy foundation. This foundation is easy to blend even though it is quite thick, it sets beautifully with powder. Otherwise it stays just as well though I do recommend setting it with powder during these hot summer days. I have oily and acneprone skin and this product has never caused me breakouts and does keep my face flawless throughout the day. Sometimes I don't really even need concealer!

name: Kate
review: I apply this by pouring a little blob onto of my RT expert face brush. Blending out. Then I go over it with a damp beauty blender (bc my RT brush leaves all my foundations a little streaky.) Then I use the colorstay powder and a foam round and press it on top. It gives me all day medium coverage. I do get a little shiny in my t zone after about 8 hrs of wear at work (vigorous, stressful work) if I get a chance to go to the bathroom I can just fan my t zone with to and the shiny is gone.

name: Nichelle
review: I was amazed at the coverage this product came with considering it is a drugstore brand. It actually covered so well that I was able to skip the concealer application,which in my book is a two thumbs up. The price is very affordable for most women on a budget & it stays matte(the oily & combination) pretty much all day. The color selection was a little off for me but I was able to combine two colors and found my perfect hue. Overall, it's a great product but I would have given 5 stars if the bottle had a pump mechanism much like their competitors.

name: jess
review: I'm only giving 2 stars because I really enjoyed my first bottle of this foundation. At the time, I was pregnant and having issues with my skin that I wanted to cover up. After seeing such great reviews of this foundation I decided to give it a try. I LOVED it. It covered everything and lasted all day. After I was out, I decided to repurchase. IDK if I got a bad bottle or what, but it was HORRIBLE. Almost as if not the same formula. Needless to say, I threw it out and bought a new bottle hoping for the original that I had loved in the past. NO, just no :( This foundation is SUPER streaky on me and feels really heavy. I have tried numerous primers, moisturizers and application techniques. I cant get it to apply evenly on my nose and it just accentuates my pores. Keep in mind I used an entire bottle of this stuff and never has these problems. Sadly, I will not be repurchasing.

name: Casey Q
review: It doesn't get any better than this. You can put on one layer with a damp beauty sponge for really natural looking coverage or build it for coverage so good you may not even need a concealer for spots! Doesn't budge on my oily skin all day long or rub off on stuff. I bought a lighter color to use as a concealer (under eyes & on breakouts) & it works perfectly! I'd never used matte finish foundations before this, but it looks so good without being cakey or powdery. I use a shimmery bronzer to still get the glowy look I like but my nose & forehead aren't like an oil slick. I used to have a problem with foundation settling into lines on my face even with a primer but I don't even need a primer for this stuff. If I use it on my eyelids I don't even need a shadow primer either! Seriously amazing. I've made so many of my friends go buy this foundation bc it beats every kind I've tried, even expensive brands.

name: Naija
review: Looks very natural, great for everyday use.

name: fanny
review: Good for oily and dry skin!

name: happy customer
