review: I love this foundation! I was looking for a more affordable summer shade and purchased this in Nude. I have used tarte and Est�e Lauder previously so I was not expecting that type of coverage but I was surprised! Nice medium to full coverage and it's great for days I do have to go outdoors in the Texas heat. Will definitely be buying this more!

name: phunkyphresh
review: LOVEEEEE this foundation. I used to work at MAC and lived off of their Studio Fix Fluid Foundation. After leaving the company, i wanted a comparable product at a lower price point, while delivering the coverage and all day wear i was accustomed to. i tried tons and tons of OTC (over the counter) foundations and this is by far, the best for full coverage and all day wear. Also, great color selection from warm to cool tones. this is a thicker/heavier foundation, so if you are looking for light/sheer/natural, i wouldn't recommend this. however, if you are looking for full coverage/flawless skin/budget friendly, i would recommend this over any other OTC product out now. the colorstay powders are great as well! doesnt leave a cakey look, but still provides a little bit of coverage.

name: Cyndie Lou
review:
Been using this product for over 20 years and have been using Revlon Products since the 70's. I've tried using other high end cosmetics but I still keep coming back to Revlon.

Thanks Revlon...

name: Linders
review: I have been using this product since the mid-90's when it came out and I will not stray! Perfect for when you start getting tan..and throughout the summer. Blends perfect with a flawless finish.

name: Make Up!
review: I use this as my everday foundation and absolutely love it! It has perfect coverage, stays on great and a good price!

name: JK
review: Used Lancome for years and as a single mom going back to school, I was looking for a value.  Ulta rep showed me L'Oreal as a good value in same/similar color.  Great Value!

name: Jenn
review: I was looking for a foundation that matched my fair to medium colored skin tone. I have an oily-combination skine type so finding a foundation that would not clog my pores or give me acne problems was important. One of the ladies suggested me to try this is Warm Beige and the color on the bottle looked too dark but she insisted that it would match my skin tone. I bought it thinking i was going to return it after trying it, but in fact, the color blended PERFECTLY with my skin tone. I put it on in the morning and wear it all day without have to touch up with powder. The weather can get hot and humid but the foundation stays put and does not feel streaky. && Its easy to remove with a make-up remover towlette!

name: Cindykissb
review: The foundation covers flawlessly, very full coverage .

name: FLUB  A DUB
review: finger tips and sponge application. best results.

name: Smiley
review: I have oily skin so finding foundtion the stays in place has been tough. This stuff is awesome.

name: Alli Girl
review: I LOVE this makeup & have worn it for years! I have sensitive skin & have NEVER had itchy,dry,irritated skin with this product. I'm asked frequently "which foundation do you use?" People are shocked when I tell them how affordable Revlon Colorstay is! LOVE it!

name: lorree
review: I really like this foundation. I am normally an NC-20 in the winter but in the summer I get a little tan, however my face usually isn't as tan as the rest of my body due to sunscreen. So I get a little darker than normal foundation (I got this in Early Tan) and it helps give me a healthy glow. The foundation lasts a fair amount of time and I haven't noticed any breakouts since using it.

name: Tattooed Mama
review: I like a foundation with a lot of coverage because my nose tends to be red and I have some old acne red spots that wont go away. I am very pale yellow and its hard to find a color that works without being too pink. This line in Buff worked great for me. You need to apply it fast and in sections because it does dry quickly. It lasts all day and may only need a powder touch up at the end of the day. The the only thing that sucks is trying to take it off! I use a cleanser with a makeup remover in it and a facial brush. I have to wash my face twice for it to come off and it does not come off of my foundation brush unless I use dawn to clean it.

name: Susette
review: I'm not sure about this yet. I mean, it does keep me shine free like I wanted but it flakes on my nose. It makes my nose look like cracked ice. No other foundation does this to me. It also doesn't spread very easily. I feel like I should be applying it with a damp sponge. I want to love it I'm just not sure I do yet.

name: Lily R
review: The price is great, but it's confusing to find your shade. Look at swatches not the names! I'm never a "sand" foundation but I ended up loving Sand Beige. Medium buildable coverage, airbrushed look (I applied w a sponge) and I didn't get oily ALL day! Wearing this for prom!

name: Kaitlin
review: Works well if you like full coverage. Can feel a bit heavy. But it lasts all day and the pigmentation is excellent for a drugstore brand foundation.

name: Sam
review: It blends pretty well & I like the coverage!

name: Emelie
review: Long lasting and covers pimples well. Blends nicely too.

name: Shelli
review:
I have tried almost every foundation that exists and this one is the best on every level. The only one that comes close to this Revlon is Kat Von D tattoo foundation, but it doesn't last very long and it's a little cakey, not to mention $42!

I use this foundation to cover pores, freckles, and uneven skin and it is awesome! I can apply it with my finger, beauty blender, foundation brush.. And it always go on perfectly.

Also, it lasts a looong time. This is the only foundation that I only need a little dab for my whole face, so it lasts me 3 months.

Just for comparison, i've used: Make Up Forever, MAC, Laura Mercier, Kat Von D, it Cosmetics, YSL, Lancôme, Cover Girl, Neutrogena, and many more.

name: Makeup lover
review: I love this product because it stays on throughout the day! my skin looks flawless.

name: Ashley
review: One word... OBSESSED. I searched and searched for a drug-store brand foindation comparable to MAC's studio fix fluid, and I truly believe I have found it! Beyond excellent coverage. Love love love this foundation ♡♡♡

name: alyssa
review: i like the coverage however this foundation lasted for a good 2 hours until it coming off.

name: Minz29
review: I have tried other foundations but always end up coming back to this product.  It is buildable and looks great when applied with a beauty blender or brush and has long lasting coverage.

name: Running with Scissors
review: Great for a full coverage look just be sure to use a good makeup remover or you may breakout.

name: Makeup Junkie
review: After seeing all the hype surrounding this foundation I decided to try it out but I ended up hating it. It's so difficult to blend. After buying my Sigma kabuki brush it blended more easily but it dried way too fast. It was also extremely heavy. Even with my best efforts in trying to put as little as possible it still felt heavy and other people noticed how heavy it looked. I also do not like the smell.

name: AnnaW
review: I used to use Clinique every day, per my mother's taste and I loved the stuff, but once I headed to grad school and had a very limited budget, I discovered this amazing product. I'll never buy another foundation. It out-performs Clinique and many other foundations I've tried. I have normal/oily skin, esp in my t-zone, and this, come summer or winter, keeps it practically matte from 7a.m.-9p.m. I may touch up once if I'm going out at night, but other than that, this is THE staple in my immense collection of makeup, which, for reference, is mostly brand name.

name: The Young Professional
review: I have fair skin, so I bought the light formula. It made me look like a ghost. I like the formula and the price, so I might try grabbing another color, but the options are a little limited cause I am fair but with a yellow undertone and not a pink undertone. Would love to try again.

name: LP
review: Okay so I have been searching and searching and searching for a foundation that would last all day and have great coverage at the same time. I swear I tried everything from cheap to high dollar and this product is amazing and is not super pricey. It last all day long I always get compliments on my makeup it covers everything without wearing off or looking greasy. I researched a lot of different things before I purchased this and I have to say I am super happy with this foundation. I also use the pressed powder from this line and concealer! It is all amazing! I'm telling you try this product it won't let you down!

name: Jen
review: I usually use bare minerals foundation but use this when I need a little more coverage.  Great product.

name: CMG
review: I've been searching for a great foundation without paying a fortune. I have oily skin and need my foundation to stay put thru the school day.  It seemed like every time I found "the one", the brand would "reinvent" the formula or discontinue the color.  I've tried Laura Mercier (lack of colors), Bobbi Brown (broke me out), Lancôme (changed formula and color) and most recently I've been wearing Estee Lauder's Double Wear light (I did wear just the Double Wear but they also changed the formula and color). The Double Wear light has been great and it does last all day but at $39 for 1 oz, it is rather pricey.  I've used it for the last 2 years and now my daughter is using it as well so my cost is double. I started searching and reading reviews and everytime, this foundation, REVLON'S COLORSTAY kept coming up with AMAZING reviews.  I decided to try it and the first time was a winner. The color was PERFECT and it lasted from 6 a.m. until I took it off.  I can get it on here with the BUY ONE get ONE half off and then use the $3.50 off, who can beat it???  My teenage daughter and I are both using it now and my foundation costs have diminished considerably!!  I am thrilled to say the least!  REVLON has been around for years and years!  It may be an oldie and it certainly is a GOODIE!!! I really can't say enough good things about this foundation.  If you don't like it, you can always take it back!!  It is DEFINITELY worth trying!!

name: Charisma
review: I have a really oily T-Zone. In the hotter months I use mineral powder for foundation because everything else just melts off my face. However, in the winter I need something less drying. This is my go to foundation that works for my combination skin type, my deep pigment and it last all day.  I am happy with this.

name: CM
review: I use this make-up every day. It lasts all day long, never is shiny and covers well. For all of this it is at a very low price.  It covers better than any other foundations and I have tried a lot.

name: mariasofabb
review: im not a big fan of foundations, but this one is amazing! i have oily skin and when i wear this foundation i dont get oily at all. Best foundation i ever bought. so worth the money spent. i love!

name: Rosie
review: I use this product for everyday use. It stays on all day and covers everything with just a little bit of the foundation. Closer to the end of the day I tend to get greasy, but the makeup stays on and does its job.

name: Mabx3mommy
review: Love this brand and coverage! I have oily skin and this foundation works great no issues last all day I use a matte setting spray for days I want a different look. Overall I would recommend this product to family and friends

name: Terry
review: use this product every day of the week

name: Jai
review: I can just say, I purchased this foundation not knowing how'd it be, I love it! I wear it for school, and so far it has been over 24 hours still going strong! It also matches me so perfectly, and gives me good coverage while not looking TOO glam for school. I have combination skin(oily in T-zone) so when I finish blending my concealer I just bake those areas and set everything else with air spun, works lovely! Definitely repurchasing!

name: Jaz
review: Replaced my MAC fix fluid

name: Adriana
review: Everyone made this foundation seem like the best drugstore foundation for oily skin and wanting medium to full coverage. People say it blends very easy, long wearing, not cakey, and light weight. I personal disagree with that. I got a sheer to semi- medium coverage, lasted up to 6 hours, and no matter how I applied it, it would look cakey. It suck to all my dry patches, and made my acne look even worse than it did without makeup. It doesn't work well with other products on the face. Over all, this foundation was a fail for me.

name: Jazzy
review: I watched a YouTube video and saw this was a dupe for some high end foundations and so I tried it and it works very well. I do have oily skin so I had to set it but once I did it lasted all day

name: Katie
review: I did not like this at all. It did not settle good on my skin, and emphasized everything on my skin. It also didn't last on my face. There's so many better foundations out there I really don't get the hype on this one

name: Trish
review: I have pretty much used this my whole life I have veered off and tried others but always come back to this one. My only complaint is that in settles in lines and wrinkles which is the only reason I have tried other brands

name: Amber
review: Love the new almond color

name: mom
review: For years I've went from very expensive brand name foundations to the inexpensive drugstore brands. It took me 11 years since I started wearing make up to finally find something that works with my imperfections! My problem when not wearing make up are my acne scars and even with Chanel or HD foundations, instead of thinking the best type of brand name products would work best, doesn't give the full coverage I needed to hide my scars. This worked wonders and it saved me so much $$$ ! This lasts the longest too without needing to reapply. The only problem is it's very difficult to get off with just make up toilettes and one wash. You'll need a really great make up remover and possible an exfoliating brush.

name: Active teen
review:
Great coverage and finish.
The product is not usable for me because of the smell.

name: ana banana
review: This is the best cover up makeup i have found for my acne marks. It does not cover them completely, but it is the most non expensive foundation i have found that does the best job than others out there.

name: Linds_444
review: I love this product! I have a difficult time finding foundation that will stay on for a full work day. There's many times when my make-up looks just as good at 3pm as it did at 6am using this product

name: M
review: I wear makeup everyday and I have been looking for one I can apply once in the morning and it stays on all day. This makeup really does last me 12+ hours. I seal it with a really light layer of powder and my face has yet to look oily or cakey.  I only need a small amount because it is pretty full coverage which I like to cover my freckles. It is inexpensive and the bottle lasts me a long time. I would recommend it to almost anyone especially with oily and combination skin because it leaves a great matte finish. I have fair/light skin and the 150 Buff matches great.

name: lollie
review: It's ok.. It does not last 24 hrs. Not even close! It does not apply well across the face. even oil- free, I am, like always left with an oil like feeling on my face.

name: renee
review: Does not cause breakouts. Stays all day.

name: giraffegirl
review: I had read great reviews of this foundation online and decided to give it a try.  I have gone through so many foundations trying to find the perfect one.  I really like Teint Idole from Lancome, but it's way too pricy.  This foundations comes very close.  I have very oily skin with large pores and this makes my pores appear smaller and my skin does not get as oily as it usually does.  Definitely recommend!

name: Charmin
review: My face doesn't look oily throughout the day when I apply this.  Great product but dries quickly so you must blend quickly. Overall nice finish and I would but again!

name: TanBarbiexo
review: I absolutley love this product. I have EXTREMLEY oily skin and I have been trying to find the perfect foundation for over a year. I used to use Maybelline's 24 hour stay makeup but I felt like i had to blot my face every hour. i finally got off that and went to something more expensive, Kat Von D's tattoo lock it foundation. It was a matte finish and very gorgeous, but, within a few hours, i had to blot my face again. I did my research and came across this one. It works so fantastic! I have yet to blot my face to get rid of excess oil. It lasts ALL day. I'm never having to touch up. I highly recommend this product for anyone with oily skin. Also, it is pretty great at matching skin tones. My face is fairly white. and it took me a try or two to finally get the perfect shade, but ulta lets you exchange if the color doesnt work, which is a huge plus.

name: Jac
review: I have heard so many good things about this product and as a person with very oily skin and very fair tone I was rather hopeful when I picked this product up. I never buy the same liquid drugstore foundation twice because I'm never happy with it, and I was really hoping this would change. I bought it in the lightest shade which seemed to match my skin quite well when I first applied it... until about five minutes later after it had oxidized about three or four shades darker. I managed to use powder to make it look somewhat believable, and hoped it would last the day. Unfortunately, the makeup nearly completely wore off on and around my nose which tends to be the oiliest part of my face at the end of the work day (about 7 hours). I'll continue to use this product until I'm done with it, but my high hopes have been a bit deflated. On the bright side it does have very buildable coverage, and stayed very well on the rest of my face with a nice matte finish.

name: Revlon Convert!
review:
I have VERY sensitive skin and have dealt with having (mild) acne since I was in middle school (now 20). Because of this, I have to be careful what kind of makeup I try because many things tend to break me out. There has only been two foundation products that I've LOVED that have not done this: Mary Kay foundation and Urban Decay's Naked Skin (which I've most recently been using).

I swore I had found the one when I switched to using Urban Decay's foundation. I was a woman obsessed. It didn't break me out, it lasted most of the day, it was easy to apply... but it costed me a good amount of money. My Naked Skin had began to run out and I was panicked because I wasn't sure that I'd be able to afford a new bottle. What was I going to do!?!

Lucky for me, I remembered a little foundation gem that I'd heard about from youtube beauty gurus. I'd see the name here and there in different tutorials, with some gurus deciding to wear the Revlon Colorstay for the day. However, I was sold when I found one woman who literally wore it every single day. Most everything else she used was name brand, but not her foundation.

I thought it was worth giving a shot, and I'm SO GLAD that I did! I like this foundation just as much if not better than my Naked Skin. It lasts me ALL day (maybe even looks better at the end of the day than Urban Decay) and gives me such a flawless look without looking too matte or satiny as many foundations do that are formulated for combo/oily skin. And you can't beat the price. Revlon has done such a good thing with this product. I pray they never discontinue it! Heck, I might have to buy myself 8 bottles or so... just to be safe...

Anywho, the only problems I had with this foundation were that it is difficult to get out of the bottle. I had to beat the bottle onto the back of my hand to get the product out, as the product is quite thick. It'd be great with a pump. The second is that it is a little heavier feeling than my Naked Skin, but it's totally bearable. Additionally, I wish it had a little bit more SPF in it. However, I get a good amount of that in my moisturizer so that's not a huge deal. But you can never be too safe from the suns rays!

Note*** This is only my second full day of wearing the foundation, I was just too excited about it. I had to share!

name: Drew
review: I am in such a love/hate relationship with this foundation. On one hand, it's not pricey compared to other high-end brands. A little goes a long way, so the 1 oz. bottle lasts awhile. The coverage is great, however, it doesn't last as well as I want it to. I was optimisitic when I saw they had two types: one foundation for oily skin, and one for dry/normal skin. Having incredibly oily skin, I obviously chose the one for oily skin. Even so, the foundation (even after I set it with powder), settles into fine lines I didn't even know I had, and gets splotchy halfway through the day. The coverage is unbeatable..I just wish it would last on my skin.

name: Liz
review: Love this product! This is the best full coverage foundation drugstore wise.  This foundation covers all my blemsish scars! The price is a little expensive for a drugstore foundation, but it is worth it. I rate this product an A

name: Drea
review:
This is my HG Foundation.
I've tried drugstore & high end foundations.
This is one of the best out there.
It's my go-to foundation. Especially if I've broken out from something else or I have a special event to go to.
Only problem is it not having a pump so it's easy to pour too much so you have to be careful. It's not runny though.
Blends easily, it's long lasting and covers up my Acne Scarring.
I wear shade Toast, although Golden Caramel works too. They have a very slight difference in color and I'm an NC42.
Love this foundation, it's never caused me to breakout

name: Belton, Tx
review: This product just covers very well when I use it with a foundation brush. It's not cakey and it gives the best coverage to my skin. I have very oily skin and it does not give me pimples. It also has the color that matches my skin perfectly. This foundation is the best foundation I've had so far and I love it!

name: A Lovely Lady
review: This foundation is pretty good for the price. I do wish it lasted longer, though, as it starts to flake and show wear about 12 hours in...half the advertised wear time.

name: Garden Girl
review: Great for the price!  Does what it says, lasts all day.  I haven't found a good color match yet.  My very favorite foundation for finish is Lancome Tient Miracle in Bisque 1N.  This Revlon product in Warm Golden - (hoping to blend with my slight tan) - looks darker in the bottle but is actually lighter than the Lancome Bisque - go figure.

name: beyerl.m
review:
I have been on the hunt for a good full-coverage foundation that will last me through my 12-hour shifts at work, and finally found one that works for me. I have spent so much on all sorts of brands (Urban Decay, Makeup Forever, Dior, Smashbox, Clinique, etc.) and go figure, Revlon to the rescue.

This foundation is super smooth and blends in easily. I do have more oily skin, especially on my nose and chin. It does not feel heavy or thick. So far, it's been awesome. I have mixed it with Smashbox's Artificial Light and it looks quite nice.

I only gave it 4 stars because I just started using it. I don't know if it's going to make me break out or anything yet. Also, it doesn't have a pump which is kind of disappointing, but I guess that's low on the list of priorities.

name: Wendy
review: I absolutely love this foundation! It stays on even through the heat. I used it to six flags in Valencia, CA. It lasted all day and even though I got a little sweaty the coverage never went away! I absolutely love this product. I recommend it to anyone with oily skin. I found it easiest to blend with a beauty blender or flat or round top kabuki brush.

name: Skeeter
review: It seemed to be my right color but then I discovered that the foundation (in my color 375) has a orange undertone to it that I'm not happy with.

name: KathyBeishir
review: First time using this product and love everything about it ❤️

name: jesspoo
review: After going through 3 bottles i decided i wanted to try something different just for the fun of it but i keep coming back to buy this! Other drugstore foundations are too oily, have bad coverage, make me break out, or dont match my skin tone. Though this foundation doesnt completely match my yellow skin tone, its the closest thing i've come to. I can look past it since it has a full coverage that i like but still manages to look natural. It does feel a little heavy compares to others and has a "make up-ey" smell but these things wouldn't keep me from buying!

name: **Sparky**
review: After spending so many years and so many $$ on foundations, I finally found the best of the best of foundation for my face.  I feel like I've tried everything at Ulta.  I figured if the brand name expensive side does not have any foundations that works for my skin, maybe the other side of over the counter foundation works.  I just walked in the first isle and say this foundation.  I have combination skin.  Very oily in the summer and in the winter I get dry patches.  By far this foundation is the best for me because its cheap, it gives me nice, natural coverage (have a little redness on my cheeks), blends well and above all controls my oil and gives me a matte look.  I don't like super matte looks, so all I do is add some highlight to my cheeks and the tip of my nose and WALLLAAAA!  I am so happy with this product.  Thank you Revlon Color Stay!

name: Brii
review: This item is great !

name: Beauty love r
review: I bought this product hoping that it would work for my oily skin. At first it did a good job but the color was too light for me and it didn't stay on my face for a long time.

name: Becs78
review: Best foundation I've used by far. Lightweight yet full coverage, lasts all day and my skin doesn't get shiny or dried out.

name: Make up geek
review: It feels good on my skin, has great coverage! Blends perfectly! Last for a really long time,  went hiking for hours and my make up still look great!

name: Miriam
review: For the first time buying, its an awesome products

name: Zumba Instructor
review: I should have been buying this instead of costly department store brands!

name: Knadala
review:
This foundation is making the claim that it is formulated for combo/oily skin and it totally delivers. This is the only drugstore liquid foundation I have tried which actually does what it says it will do for my combo/oil skin, without making it look dry or thick. I get the full coverage I want, the natural looking pigmentation, the ease of application, and it doesn't irritate my skin.
I don't recommend wearing it over breakouts because while it doesn't make it worse, it almost feels like it hinders the area from naturally healing itself, most likely because it is being clogged.
This foundation works great for me during every season except summer, I just need something more like the Rimmel matte liquid foundation formula because my oil combined with sweat from the heat, will be enough to break down most foundations.

name: Makeup  lover
review: I usually buy high end products but this foundation was amazing it has great staying power and it looks great too.  I have combo to oily skin and my t-zone tends to get super oily but this foundation worked great for my skin.

name: chattanooga1993
review: First off, I adore this foundation! I have acne prone, oily skin (that is exaggerated since I live in the south, and sensitive skin. I have very long days and I need my makeup to last. I apply this foundation on the back of my hand and then dot it on areas of my face (right cheek, ect.) and blend it out in sections with a beauty blender. I apply small amounts so I get a medium coverage. This foundation is so build able and lasts so long on your skin! It also controls oil well. I do still have to touch up, but it is after 5-6 hours in the summer. I absolutely adore this foundation and recommend it 100%

name: Pimanee
review: I tried this because it got so any rave reviews on youtube and I'm so glad I did! It keeps me matte for 8+ hours and it looks like I don't have any makeup on. It conceals redness and acne well. Stays put even without a primer! Build able coverage. Some days I don't even wear concealer. Love!

name: Blueluna
review: It blended well, the color was right. And does not break me out.

name: Ray-Ray
review: if blended well, it doesn't look like 'make-up', it just looks like you have a good complexion.  offers sheer coverage for the 9 to 5, but it's also buildable for if you want to do a 'going out full face'.

name: Jacki
review: With all the reviews that I watched and read, I thought why not try a drugstore brand foundation. I also have seen this show (which I forgot the name of it) in which they did a full hour of comparing low end make up, middle priced make up and high end make up. For the face make up (foundation, I initially thought. But I think powder is also a part of it), the high end definitely won with no comparison. Everything else, you can buy the cheapest or middle priced, that is just up to you. I have age spots on my cheeks and initially I used BB creams. This was before I ever really used any foundation. That really didn't work for me. I bought prescriptives flawless foundation, which I don't remember why but it wasn't for me either. I have an oily tzone and combination skin for the rest of my face. With this, I tried with a primer and middle priced loose powder and it stayed probably 4-6 hours. You really get what you pay for. The primer I used is high end, so it should've stayed. I do like how it is full coverage, but it doesn't feel horrible when you have it on. I've used the L'oreal foundation and that felt like I needed to scratch my whole face. With this, you have to pair it with a really good powder after. I used Physicians formula youth pressed powder and OMG my face looked terrible. I never saw my face look the way it did with that powder. If you don't use a primer with this and you have noticeable pores, in a few hours, it would seep into your pores and make your pores really large. This is good for people who are slithly oily, VERY slight. With small to unnoticeable pores.

name: NCVA
review: This is one of the best foundations I've ever tried. The color is right on!! Will purchase again, and again.

name: Eve
review: So before I buy anything I do my research. I bought this product cause everyone just SWORE by it.That it was a MAC dupe they said.Perfect coverage they said.I was highly disappointed. I have combo skin type. & it made me brake out around my lip/cheek area PLUS pealing!! I tried diff primers, moisturizers, brushes just in denial of the product but I give up. Will NOT be buying it again :(

name: Nicole
review: I bought the combo/oily version of this and I love it: it provides perfect coverage for me and definitely lasts all day long. In fact I actually had to buy new makeup removing face wash because I was having trouble getting it all off! The formula is generally really nice, I do notice it does tend to settle into the lines around my mouth but other than that it sits really nicely on my skin and makes it look amazing.

name: mylife__as__ana
review: good foundation. i use it with smashbox primer and set with rimmel stay matte powder. it can feel heavy, and a bit greasy if you  put on too much. i little really goes a long way.

name: j
review: Wouldn't change

name: Styleso_chic
review: This make up is great. It lasts long on my oily skin. Works like none other. I've tried higher end foundations like Make Up Forever's Matte Velvet + which failed horribly for me. I've also tried other drugstore brands like Maybelline Dream Matte Mousse in the pot which would work for a while then I'd be shining again.

name: Courtney
review: I LOVE this product! I recently bought it after reading all the wonderful reviews. I have very oily skin and have try just about every foundation there is! Tarte, Kat Von d, Mac, etc. This is by far my favorite! I love the color, you don't have to use a lot, and it lasted ALL day, with NO SHINE! That literally never happens to me. I'm in love with this, definitely recommended

name: liz
review: When i first bought this in the beginning of the year i really like it. However, I just purchased my second bottle and i'm starting to think otherwise...sigh i can never find just one good full coverage foundation.

name: Lisa The Fashion Blogger
review:
I have been using Revlon ColorStay Whipped for years, and decided to give the liquid a go. I have cystic acne, eczema, and natural redness in my cheeks. My skin is not dry (except for eczema patches) and is not oily.

I liked the look of it, as I put it on, and it felt similar to the whipped. The coverage was good, but I felt like I had to add a second layer to get the same coverage as whipped (full). An hour after having it on, most of my make up was off. I was so embarrassed because I was at work, and had no way to take it all off. It may have been just with my skin, so try it for yourself.

It was blotchy, didn't stay on, and left my skin looking oily.

Will I repurchase? Never. Do I recommend? I think I would recommend to someone with few imperfections, and someone willing to retouch multiple times.

It is not comparable to how great the whipped version is. In my experience anyways (:

// I used alone, once (experience explained above). I used with elf primer, Sonia Kashuk concealer, and elf HD powder (my usual routine) a second time and got the same results. //

name: Grace
review: This is my favorite drugstore foundation. Clinique was my first foundation, but didn't really care for it. Thank you revlon for this one. I love it...it lasts all day long...I tried loreal, almay ect (all drugstore product) but i always come back to Revlon Colorstay. I started using this last dec and im on my 3rd bottle now. I got the golden caramel and its a perfect match for my skin stone....you all should try this foundation..

name: Jennylynnsloves
review: First time user and recommend by Beauty Youtubers. I gave it a try, it is full coverage to me because I have acne and dark spots. The only thing that I don't like is that the ingredients aren't the greatest.

name: Abigail
review: This foundation is full coverage and does seem to last quite a while (about 8-10 hours with setting spray and primer) which both are good, but for me this foundation is sooooo heavy on my skin. I have worn it to work on occasion and feel like it is literally making my face sag from its heaviness. I also found it to be a bit cakey on my dry to combination skin (although I will admit I bought the oily skin kind because I was wanting it to last around my t zone). As a whole it's an okay foundation, but the revlon colorstay whipped is so much better (creaminess, coverage, lightness, blendability) and just barely more expensive. If I had to spend my money I'd definitely go for the whipped foundation over this one.

name: ashlove
review: This is hands down my favorite foundation. It has full coverage that lasts all day, doesn't break me out, and it's cakey at all. The only negative is that it doesn't have a pump to get the product out.

name: Mattie
review: This is one of the best drugstore foundations I have ever tried. I am pretty oily and live in Southern California, which is hot 9 out of 10 times. Most matte/oil control foundations I've tried are extremely heavy. But this one is so beautifully lightweight and it stays on so well. I usually wear my makeup for 9 hours and this stayed on very well and looked flawless throughout the whole day.

name: Liz
review: My skin breaks out so easily & it is very oily. It is very hard to find a foundation that will last all day, has great coverage and not break me out. this is perfect and for the money even better.

name: Alexis Diggs
review: I usually use the Mac Pro longwear foundation, but I was looking for something cheaper because it was only for one night. The revlon foundation is completely full coverage, and it lasts for the duration of the time you have it on. I loved it because it went on very even and even as I added highlighter and concealer, it remained well blended without any cakiness. I now use it for my everyday makeup, and I strongly recommend it.

name: Janie
review: This is a pretty solid foundation, it provides medium coverage and I would recommend it for people who don't have too many acne issues (unless you're also working with a good concealer).  There's a wide color selection, I bought two of the shades and I'm still not really sure which suits me better but you can mix colors and it will work fine.  Sometimes my nose gets patchy but a primer should work.  There isn't a smell that I notice.  Very lightweight though, I've only tested it in the summer but we'll see how it performs in the winter when the weather is a bit dryer.

name: Ash
review: I've been looking for a cheaper foundation that works well with my oily skin and has a fuller coverage for a very long time and never found anything. However, this product fills both of those requirements. I'm very happy I decided to try this foundation and will probably never use anything but it now.

name: Wandaroo
review: I haven't used this foundation in years ( although I always thought it was very good),  I thought I would pick it up again since it now has a pump and I heard it had been reformulated. I am absolutely loving this foundation for several reasons. One, I finally got a proper shade match. I am Asian,olive complected, and between a light and medium. (About NC25).  Sand beige is a perfect match- it has a good beige undertone. (Not too pink or too yellow). Secondly,  I love that this foundation has increased its sun protection factor, but has switched over to mineral sunscreens (titanium dioxide and zinc oxide). Lastly the application is very much the same or improved: good pigmentation, buildable with a nice thin, consistency and a matte finish. It also wears nicely: it doesn't break down or get too oily, although my own oils do peek through by the end of the day. Though, that happens to me with all foundations.  At this price point, you cannot beat this foundation for oily/combo skins.

name: Lisa
review: I have used this product for years, love it

name: Lena V
review: The best drugstore foundation for oily skin. It also beats most "high end". Nice matte finish, isn't cakey, does not oxidize, lasts all day with no fading, dries and sets quickly. They have a formula for dry skin types too.

name: Paris B
review: I love how it blends so well and the pump made it better

name: bre
review: Awesome

name: Anna
review: This is the best Revlon Foundation I have tried. The only problem I have with it is; you have to apply it fast because it drys too quickly. Other than that I have no complains.

name: Noel Day
review: I use this daily in a lighter color, but bough a darker one for my bridal photos when I got an airbrush tan.  It looked great with the tan!  Looked awesome in my bridal photos.  I have tried Forever HD liquid foundation and I still love This Revlon product more!

name: Dell Flower
review: I got this to use while traveling overseas so that i wouldn't arrive with "shiny face" -- not sure if it was all due to the product, or also to the dry climate in the planes, but it really worked.   THis stuff lasts, yet it doesn't seem overly heavy on the skin nor does it rub off easily onto necklines, etc.   No breakouts were caused and it didn't seem to clog up my pores either.  my skin is mature/acne prone and I have a problem getting something that doesn't age me yet doesn't allow the acne to take over.  THis is going to be one of my go-to products now.

name: MakeupLover100
review: Decided to use this product as it came highly recommended as a good "drug store buy" for darker complexion women. I loved it, it blends really well with my skin tone. However, you definitely need to use a finishing powder over it to allow the foundation to set.

name: Aussiegirl
review: I've used Revlon Colorstay foundation for the past 10+ years and it is still my favorite foundation. I have very oily, sensitive breakout prone skin and it provides enough coverage to cover any scars or dark spots I have without looking heavy or greasy. I work 10hr workdays so I have to have makeup that will last and not melt off my oily skin and colorstay is the only liquid foundation I've found that does just that. It dries fast and is a full coverage foundation so you have to apply it quickly and blend or it can make you look like you're wearing a mask. I use a primer before I apply colorstay and set it with a translucent powder to give it double security.

name: Megan
review: I've heard nothing but good things about this foundation. It melted off my face after two hours (with primer) and became cakey. A total mess on my face, and cheaper foundations have held up better on my oily skin. I had to return it.

name: Angel
review:
Goes on well and last all day. I really like the
Combination for oily/dry skin.

name: 5280 Girl
review: This is my frequently used foundation. For the price- it is an excellent buy. It blends well, covers well, doesn't smell, and stays put for several hours. I have very oily skin so I recommend using an oil control moisturizer, mattifyer for the oil, or wear a light powder because I do shine through after a few hours. I love that this makeup doesn't come off as easily as most, when it does- it WILL come out, so that is nice that it doesn't ruin your clothes. It has build able coverage but should be used FOR FULL COVERAGE gals only! This is not meant for tinted moisturizers or foundation newbies. If you have scars or serious blemishes- this is the stuff you want. Just be careful to close the bottle completely because it WILL leak. To me it has no scent, the color is a great match, and I discontinued using my Clinique ($32 foundation) for this one. Definitely recommend.

name: Barbie
review: I have to admit, ever since I was recommended this product by a fellow make-up artist and make-up review blogger friend of mine, I haven't looked back. For years I have used MAC Foundations, always thinking it was the best in the industry, BUT, I always noticed my skin was always shiny when using it. Since I had used it for years, I figured it was suppose to be that way and just got use to it. Then as the years went by and I got better and better with make-up application and then decided to go to school for make-up classes, I realized everything I was doing wrong and learned new tricks and can not complain.  Since I was just starting as a make-up and needed to bargain shop, but yet have a wide variety for the different types of faces, colors, etc...I asked around, did online research, etc...a friend who is a beauty reviewer and bloggers for different companies, recommended this foundation to me. I still wasn't considering it for myself, but more for clientele. So I didn't even try the product first and just ordered the entire line, when a sale went up on it. So once I received the merchandise, I then decided to use it on myself and see how it looks.  What can I say? Everyone complimented that night on how awesome my make-up looked and how great my skin looked. I thought maybe it was a fluke night, so I just continued to use it. I have to admit, I do not get shiny anymore, the make-up lasts all night long and I have even slept with it on, which I know I am not suppose to, and the next day it is still on my face. Ever since I purchased this product I have not used any other product on myself and I use this on my clientele and everyone loves the coverage and how nice their skin looks. I recommend it to everyone! It's affordable and looks great. I don't know how it would look on someone with VERY greasy skin, but I have used on combination skins and dry skins and no one complains about it.

name: r12345
review: I've been using this foundation for many years.  It has great coverage and is the only foundation that lasts for more than a few hours on my oily skin.  This is the first time I've ordered it from ulta; unfortunately, one of the bottles had leaked foundation over the packaging.  In addition, the foundation in each bottle is much thicker than usual (I had to add water to even get it out of the bottle) and I suspect it has been sitting around for a while.

name: Lovey
review: I wish the oil free foundation was kept more in stock.

name: Sydney
review: I wanted to love this foundation, I really did. But I don't. It claims to be formulated for combo/oily skin (which I have) and while the shade I bought was and EXACT match for my natural skin color, it just isn't up to par. First off the smell. I am very, very particular when it comes to scented items, as I am prone to headaches, and this foundation has a pretty particular, very noticeable scent that doesn't diffuse for a good half an hour. My other complaint is that no matter how much I exfoliate and moisturize and then apply this foundation, it cakes. It doesn't always cake immediately, but it does cake and clings to any semblance of dry skin it can find. I was really hoping to find a combo skin foundation solution, but it looks like I will be back on the market soon.

name: kelsey2255
review: I started using this after I saw it was a comparable dupe to Mac. I think this stuff was great, it covered my imperfections and it didn't feel cakey. the only problem for me is finding a color to perfectly match my skin tone since it's lighter than the rest of my body. I will be buying this again

name: Chattanooga2004
review: This is a great foundation! For those who have issues with caking-use a damp sponge or beauty blender. It made a world of difference for me. I use this foundation for my super long work and school days. It lasts forever and it keeps my oil under control. It also photographs beautifully. I have very sensitive skin and it has not broken me out at all. The best!

name: Becky
review: New try, wrong color.  Not enough help.

name: MUAddict
review: I finally tried this after hearing such good things about it.  It's medium coverage and I prefer a bit of a fuller coverage but I just dust a little powder over it and I'm good to go.  I really like this stuff. Pretty good at keeping my oil at bay, goes on smooth, dries quickly, doesn't break me out and lasts all day.  If I had one negative comment it would be the packaging. I really wish there was a pump. Other than that, this is a keeper for me.

name: Emily L
review: I totally love this foundation. The color is perfect and it completely covers all of my redness without looking cakey. My skin looks airbrushed and flawless!

name: JAG
review: Not many good things about this except it did last all day after a fairly heavy application - and no oiliness on my t-zone. It did cause breakouts, and I could not find a color to match my olive skin tone. Also, it did tend to feel heavy and thick on my skin all day.

name: Cactus Cat
review: I use this in Early Tan, which is an excellent shade match for me. This foundation has excellent, yet natural-looking coverage, and it definitely lasts until I wash my face at night. I need an occasional powder touch-up on my nose, but that's mostly because of my allergies. My only complaint about this foundation is actually a pretty big problem for me: I can't find a sunscreen that works with it. Having oily skin, the need to wear sunscreen every day is a pain. Of course, I'd rather have greasy skin than wrinkles, spots, or disease, so I wear sunscreen. So far, Clinique City Block has given me the best results with this foundation, but, sadly, this foundation is SO much better over bare skin. ColorStay doesn't add any special "glow" or texture or anything like that, but for a low-priced foundation it could be great for daily wear. I find this to be WAY more mattifying than Clinique Stay Matte, and it costs less than half the price.

name: Bree
review: This is the only foundation that does not break me out. It just happens to also be the least expensive one I've tried.

name: Su-mi
review: I have combination sensitive skin with moderate Rosacea (redness).  Colorstay works great for me.  It does not irritate my skin & I don't feel like I'm wearing anything on my face at all. It does not exacerbate the Rosacea and it doesn't cause me to breakout (if a product causes you to breakout, give it a week or so to see if the breakouts stop.  Sometimes if a new product is introduced to facial skin the skin may have a temporary reaction to it which will disappear over time). Over the years I've tried numerous brands of foundation with disappointing results and I'm surprised that an inexpensive brand is the best match for me.  This makeup is really THAT GOOD. I did, however, have a difficult time finding a shade that matched my skin.  I tried Nude and Buff but they have too much yellow.  Ivory is too pale.  I mixed Ivory & Nude at a 60/40 ratio and it's a dead on match for my skin shade.  I mix both shades together on the back of my hand and apply with my index finger.  Professional makeup artists recommend using a brush or sponge to apply foundation but these don't work with my skin.  I find I have more control over the product and use less of it by using my finger.  I also don't use powder to "set" my makeup because all the powders I have tried over the years settle in my large pores creating the appearance of little white flecks.  With powders I also experience dryness, flaking and peeling, even the talc free ones. I cleanse, tone, moisturize,  exfoliate using Missha's Brown Sugar Scrub and a Missha mask once a week. I'm doing everything that works for my skin. (Everyone's skin is different. If you find a product or application doesn't work for your skin it's not a failing on your part.  You just have to keep experimenting until you find what works for your individual skin.  That can be a costly hassle but it's part of being a woman who wears makeup.  Thankfully, stores accept returns!)  If my skin gets shiny in the T-zone during the day I'll apply a little dusting of powder to the oily areas only.  After trial and error I've found that the Colorstay combo/oily foundation works well for me in hot & humid weather.  I have to switch to normal/dry in the Fall and Winter or my face becomes too dry and tight.  There are many positive reviews of Revlon's Colorstay and there's a reason for that.  This foundation is truly the best one out there.  I highly recommend Colorstay.

name: Melissa
review: This is a great foundation. I am a devoted user of Laura Mercier foundations, but I love Revlon's Colorstay. Full coverage, blendable, cheap, staying power.

name: Tee
review:
I have tried other foundations but keep coming back to Revlon.
I love the formula and it covers extremely well.

name: Beauty Health Fitness Novice
review: I enjoy this product for medium coverage. Would really like it to last a little longer. But has a beautiful matte finish the best I have found so far.

name: Starry7698
review: I heard great reviews on this product so I decided to try it out. I was having troubles finding a good foundation as I have oily skin and am prone to breakouts. Although I have tried several foundations, I keep going back to this one. It gives me flawless coverage, and stays all day. The biggest benefit, it doesn't cause me to break out!!!! Definitely a great value!

name: Andrettisky
review: Love this product.  I've used it for years and nothing lasts all day like this.  I even tried some different brands, Estee Lauder, Clinique, Bobby Brown...this is cheaper and it works wonderful!

name: Jo44
review: This foundation lasts forever. You can layer the coverage, though I generally find that even with minimal application, it still comes on quite heavy so only wear it if you want full coverage. I would also by a primer that hides pores well before applying this, because I found that this foundation tended to accentuate pores without the use of a really good primer.

name: Picky Nicky
review: This foundation has received good reviews on most sites and I have no clue why. I absolutely hated it.  It went on thin and watery, felt oily and didn't blend well, and to top it off broke out my oily, acne prone skin.  No thanks.

name: Sarah
review: This is a pretty good foundation. It blends nicely into the skin and lasts well throughout the day and does not get patchy if worn for a few hours. The coverage is good as well, depending on how you apply it. The only issue I have with it is the shade selection does not cater well to people with warm undertones. I chose the warmest shade, golden beige, and it still looked a bit too cool toned for me. But other than that i have no complaints, another great product from Revlon!

name: PinkCorgi
review: I really love this product every time I use it I get compliments of how my skin is so flawless. Actually I have acne-prone skin and sensitive skin as well so it is really hard to find a product that I can use for my problem areas. I use a primer before putting this product on so it makes my face look even more flawless. I love this product and would recommend it for anyone with any type of skin. They also have one for dry skin.

name: MeliMel
review: This stuff has AMAZING coverage! I started using this because my chin was breaking out and super oily. It covered any redness I had very well! Once my skin started clearing up and my natural oils were more balanced, I noticed this did dry my skin out a bit. Definitely best if you have oily skin! Just made sure you use an acne treatment & moisturizer (even if u have oily skin) underneath!

name: kristad
review: I love this foundation, but it feels kind of splotchy on the skin. I wish it was more light. But it is very well for coverage,I don't have much to say much about how long it lasts but there is not a lot of foundation on my makeup wipe at the end of the day.

name: Blair
review: I like the color match of this foundation and it looks so smooth on the skin.

name: Becca
review: This product is really good. I think it does really well for what I want it to. It was not super expensive, but it's a good product

name: I am TRASH
review:
I have extremely pale skin, all the way up to too faced foundation in snow, and I picked this up today and so far the pigment is great and doesn't seem to oxidize. I have pretty sensitive skin too, and usually have a reaction within the first couple of hours, and so far seems pretty okay. I have two fairly bad looking zits today, and I was able to cover them up easily.

The foundation is velvety, it's smooth, and it doesn't really feel like I'm wearing much except my false eyelashes. I did use primer, finishing powder, bronzer, blush, highlighter, on top of this, but if you're only going to go with this product, it really feels like nothing is there. I've had much heavier feeling makeup than this, so it's extremely pleasant to be able to breathe. My pores look a little large up close, but that can be fixed with a pore minimizing primer.

Tip: don't use a beauty blender, get yourself a brush (preferably something firm that you can stipple into your skin and then blend out- I use one from it cosmetics, but elf seems to have a really nice one for liquid foundations). It applied so much better with my brush, and it built more coverage as well. I think most of the people who say it's light coverage used their hands or a beauty blender in all honesty, because I have no need for concealer or color corrector.

I'm still wearing this for a few more hours to see how it goes with my combination skin type where I get oily throughout the day, but for now I give kudos to revlon for changing their formula for this product.

name: hope
review: I used it as a foundation like I was suppose to and it was just poor coverage, didn't last long, and way too greasy

name: Mn
review: I wish it was better on coverage

name: BudgetBecky
review: I love this product! This foundation has great coverage and stays on all day! Works well with my oily skin and acne.

name: Rose
review: I love this so much, this is my go-to foundation. I tried Kat Von D lock it foundation and it creased and separated horribly and revlon colorstay didn't do either, I love this

name: D
review: The easiest foundation to blend that I own. (Too faced and clique) it was even easy with a beauty blender. It lasted for a while I pray it doesn't cause break outs bc I have sensitive skin . So far I love !!! Also right now buy one get one 50% off !!

name: Kristi
review: Things that aren't so great about it

name: makeup addict
review: I heard so many great things about Revlon Colorstay and decided to try it for myself. Totally fell in love with this product! I only have to use a tiny bit and I get medium coverage which is great for everyday use. I'd layer on a bit more for full coverage. I still prefer Mac's Studio Fix Fluid in NC15 for special occassion use just because it seems to give me a bit more of a polished, flawless look. If you're looking for a cheaper alternative, go with Revlon Colorstay!! You won't regret <3

name: Cady
review: I absolutely love this foundation. I tend to get oily and shiny in my t-zones throughout the day and this foundation doesn't get super oily throughout the day like most do. I try using a very light application with little concealer for problem areas and a setting powder to really matte my t zone to get that flawless finish. It's the best foundation I've found yet that gives a natural look and blends well. Even compared to high end foundations (believe me I've tried them all) I would prefer this one!

name: Rene
review: My skin regime includes Tarte and other high in cosmetics, but since I have severe scaring for full coverage I recommend only this foundation.

name: misskikib
review: I originally planned on picking up the version for normal to dry ski, yet accidentally grabbed this instead. It ended up working out great! Even though my skin is a bit on the dryer side it worked well to keep a matte finish without wearing off, and I barely had to set it. It also has great coverage.

name: Proud to be a Christian
review: This foundation is what I have been looking for.  I had quit using liquid foundation because it just seemed heavy.  I used powder but it did not cover as well.  I am very pleased with this.  And the cost was reasonable.

name: linda
review: It provides good matte coverage that lasts. I bought a shade too light so I have been mixing it with some of my darker foundations.

name: John123
review: I'm a 14 year old STRAIGHT boy that has a slight bit of hyper pigmentation and I'm really self conscious about it so for the past 8 months I've tried so many different foundations/bb creams. This one by far is my favorite drugstore brand foundation ive ever bought. While Mac is great for 35 dollars for bottle of foundation, sometimes I don't want to spend that! This works just as well and blends flawlessly. I use this along with glamoflauge concealer in light to medium (my shade in this foundation is 150 buff) it is amazing on my combination skin and only I know I have makeup on! Others can't even tell because its not a cakey heavy full coverage foundation! While it is full coverage it's super light weight and awesome! Go buy yourself a bottle!!!

name: DJ
review: I like the coverage, but would like it put in a pump bottle like Cover Girls and also some small purse size containers. Price is good also.

name: Sensitive Skin
review: I love it. I normally have problems with skin allergies and breaking out from my makeup, but so far so good! I use a finishing powder over it and it keeps the shine from ever showing up. Big fan!

name: Summer
review: Love this product. Only con is it doesn't come in a shade light enough.

name: JayLove
review: Good foundation stayed on all day helped keep me matte.

name: shyy
review: I have oily skin and it gets worse as the day goes on, i usually look like a greaseball by the end of an 8 hour school day with $30 foundation. This stuff keeps my face dry all day! I usually have a tiny shine after about 10 hours but it is soooo much better! Doesn't break me out and I love the finish. Covers the occasional pimple so well! Doesn't feel too heavy on my face either. It is perfect! I would suggest this to anyone.

name: halz77
review: I've used this foundation for so long and I don't regret buying my first bottle at all! I first bought this about a couple years ago and it lasted me so long, even when I went to Florida, it worked wonders especially by covering up my acne! BUT I purchased another bottle of the foundation around May and it just wasn't the same. I noticed the new packaging and figured they must've changed the formula too. Now it is patchy and doesn't like to stay on. Maybe I got a bad bottle but I have to say I miss the old stuff tons! Don't know what to think..

name: Ladyjs4
review: Very fresh looking after 10 hours

name: Min
review: This is my holy grail foundation. I've tried many but always go back to this one. I have combination skin that starts out dry in the morning and gradually becomes an oil slick. Even with a primer most other foundations melt off of my face. The Revlon Colorstay foundation is the only one that lasts.  Instead of having to reapply by 2pm, I only have to dab on some powder in the late afternoon. This foundation also provides great coverage. I have red areas near my mouth and nose and don't even need to use concealer.

name: Vanessa
review: This product is amazing. I have used urban decay, kat von d, clinique, makeup forever, hourglass and more. And I have NEVER loved a foundation so much. I have found my holy grail.

name: Courtney
review: I have used this foundation before because there was such a big hype over it and it still lives up to that hype to this day. It is perfect for people with acne and oily skin. It doesn't clog the pores or make your skin breakout. I will continue using this as my holy grail foundation. Love, love, love it.

name: Ann
review: I really enjoy using a previous version of this products. I couldn't find the same color, but I  try to get as close as possible. However it was significantly lighter than the previous products and did not have the same degree of coverage. It did not last very long and was much less Matt expected. I would not recommend this product. I was very disappointed.

name: Deniece
review: love the revlon brand however it did not seem to stay on as long as I needed, I would buy this again for minamal coverage.

name: MakeupJunkie
review: I keep re buying this foundation because it is so flawless & the coverage & staying power is awesome! The ONLY dislike I have is trying to match a color to my skin is a little difficult.

name: Sun27babe
review: Wish it smoothed out better

name: Lil
review: Works fantastic for me. I have wasted my money in the past on high end foundations that do not work half as good as this.

name: Kailey
review: I REALLY love this foundation!! It's perfect for occasions. It gives me so much coverage and doesn't break me out! However, the two things I don't like about this foundation is 1... It makes my face look a little cakey sometimes. I sometimes have to take a tissue and wipe off some of my foundation after I apply it. And 2... it doesn't have a pump, which makes it run out fast. And this is a pretty expensive drugstore foundation... so getting more costs a lot. Besides these two slight cons, this is the best foundation I've ever had, hands down!!! I would surely recommend this to anyone and would buy this again!

name: Amazing Ashley
review: I have used Revlon colorstay foundation for almost 10 years now.  I've tried other department store brands that cost an arm and a leg and I keep going back to Revlon. The pigments are perfect!

name: Brenca
review: This foundation is amazing it so easy to apply. Excellent coverage but light wieght, its feels like im not wearing foundation. I love how it is matte, I have somewhat oily skin.

name: Jane Payne
review: This is the most amazing foundation ever!!!! I go for more natural looks and this foundation is too good to be true. My nose is really dry and oily at the same time and no foundation or concealer will help my nose area. it just makes my nose even flaky. Surprisingly, this held up really well and it smells good!!

name: Oily Maria
review:
It took me a while to find my right shade and almost gave up but I am so glad I didnt. I read so many good reviews about it and OMG this is great!!!
Buy it you wont regret it! And it is EVEN BETTER with the revlon colorstay powder afterwards just in case you want a more matte finish.

name: MW
review: I had just bought some of this for the summer, since I needed a darker shade, but now that it's winter, I can't go back to my more-expensive, high-end foundation.  It was very easy to pick out my exact shade and I think it gives my skin a sort of glow.  I love it.  It's full coverage, and lasts all day.  I've never liked liquid-foundation but this is the exception!

name: scaple
review: heard about this product from an online source. it even beats out alot of high name brands

name: Sue
review: Just love it. So easy to apply and blends beautifully.  My new holy grail.

name: KW
review: LOVE THIS FOUNDATION!

name: Heather
review: I was looking for a new foundation and decided to try Revlon Colorstay. It's been a battle finding something to cover my redness and not look cakey... plus match my paleness. This foundation seems to be the one... only downside is I seem to be breaking out some since I started using it. Oh, and the bottle design could be better (I would love a pump)

name: Christina
review: Its a good medium coverage. I loved it because it kept my face from getting oily throughout the day.

name: Ann
review: I never use a drugstore foundation but I have heard many great things about this revlon foundation that I had to try it. It worked just as well, if not better, than the pricey foundation I had been using. I will be repurchasing this foundation from here in out.

name: Kat
review:
First let me start by saying that I never write reviews and that I usually frown on "drugstore" foundations. I tried this because my aesthetician suggested I switch to a non-pore clogging makeup regimen. I've been using MAC Pro Longwear for quite some time to cover up acne scars and I was unsure about switching. I read up on this product and it's supposed to be a good dupe, but I think this product is actually better than MAC's and you can't beat the price.

I first tried it this weekend when it was humid and 88 degrees (I live in FL), I spent some time outside and I was running around doing errands. My foundation stayed in tact and matte with no touch-ups until I washed it off! I've never had that happen before!

The coverage is also good if you're looking to cover up hyperpigmentation. I usually apply a cream concealer, foundation and then use a little more liquid concealer for touch ups and better coverage. I've been able to skip applying the second round of concealer since switching to this.

The only con I can think of is that I have to mix 2 shades in order to get my correct color (I'm a lighter African American with gold undertones), but I was able to grab these on sale at buy one get one 50% off. That's 2 for $15!!! Revlon has made a believer out of me with this product I'm even thinking of trying the concealer next.

name: Makeup artist
review: This is great, specially if you bend it with a sponge!

name: Megapro3lover
review: I use this foundation every day. I.have found that putting it on with a damp sponge over lotion works the best for me. I have very fair skin and have problem finding the right color. I have pink undertones and have found that I need a yellow foundation to cover it. So many foundations are too pink or oxidized and turn orange. This foundation has never oxidized on me. I use buff. Perfect for my skin. I always come back to it. Use a good cleanser because it doesn't come off easy. I use a clarisonic with purity made simple and I don't break out. Try it and you will love it

name: Shannon_e
review:
I have very oily skin, and tend to break out a lot. I have tried numerous kinds and brands of make up on my face. And the Revlon ColorStay combo/oily skin foundation is the only makeup I found that does not make my face look cake-y by lunch time. It blends well, I can wear a powder over it to give that clean air brush look.

The only thing I have a problem with is the bottle. It is really hard to get the product out of a glass bottle.

name: Beaniebeans
review:
My favorite foundation has been the Make Up Forever (shade 123 or 127) and the sadly, now defunct HIP (shade 800, best make up ever). There has been a lot of talk of how this is comparable, so I compared...I think this product is a great alternative and the price is excellent!

I recommended it to my sister..we have different skin tones / types (I am normal-oily, she is oily; I am a medium skin tone, she is light/ivory; I get breakouts once in a while, she has rosacea). She loves this as well, and we have never had a foundation that works well on both our skins, and breakouts are not an issue, and the color range works well for both of us.

I've read some issues in regards to the scent..I personally like it - I am not a fan of "perfumey-type" foundations.

Dries quickly, and coverage can be controlled to be light-to-full. No greasiness. I use it with loose powder to prevent heaviness.

name: Mar
review: Good product for the price. Stays on and does not look oily after wearing all day. Good coverage while looking smooth and natural.

name: BY
review:
Revlon seemed to have changed the formula since they are now claiming 24 hour wear rather than 16 hour like they used to. With the formula change came color change. I recently ordered medium beige and compared to old bottle of medium beige, new one is so much pinker. So I would recommend checking the shade out in person rather than ordering same shade online.

Still great staying power. I don't wear foundation past 16 hour so I don't really notice a difference in wear time. Goes on nicely especially with little bit of water. Finish to me is not completely matte which is good. New one oxidizes less. But then again, it has less yellow/orange to begin with so maybe that's why

name: Luna
review: This product is very long-lasting and controls shine very well. That said, it goes on very heavy so apply very liberally and be prepared to spend some time blending. I prefer to mix it with my spf cream to get a tinted moisturizer thats more lightweight and day appropriate. I will definitely switch back to my clinique.

name: RaeRaeBallet
review: I'm a teenager and I have tried a few foundations and they all seemed to have the same problem...an oily finish. I love this because it is very matte and smooth on my skin. I don't have bad acne but it does control shine and covers up my few blemishes. The price is also a plus! I finish it off with a Physicians Formula powder and it really gives my skin a perfect airbrushed look. Love love love this foundation! I will never stop buying this stuff!

name: rach411
review: Provides great coverage and long lasting

name: KelsBuhgg<3
review: My friend bought this foundation and we have the exact same skin tone. I ran out of my old one, which I hated, so I thought, "Hey, why not try this one?" I put it on and loved it. I used my fingers since I don't own a brush and it blended so easily! My nose and cheeks are super red, which I don't like. But this foundation covered it completely! My nose also gets super oily by the end of the day, whether I wear face makeup or not. But while wearing this, I didn't see any oil after the day. And I did a lot of running around that day, but the foundation looked perfect. I am in love with it! Definitely going back to this one. Amazing foundation, great price, and all together worth it! <3

name: georgiagal
review: i have minor blemishes and its hard to cover with some products but this one is light weight and covers great and coming from a 15 year old girl i say its awesome and lightweight and easy to use.

name: Katie Cakes
review: This is one of the best foundations I have tried. My last foundation would leave me looking greasy after an hour. This foundation lasts all day and my issues with oil have gone away. The makeup has a heavy feeling, but I love that it gives a full coverage and lasts all day. I have dark spots from previous breakouts and I currently am struggling with acne breakouts. Since I started using this product I have noticed that I have not been breaking out as much. I love that this product is noncomodegenic. My only complaint is that the bottle I purchased does not have a pump and that makes applying it messy sometimes. I usually apply this with my hands because I have found it difficult to really blend with the foundation brush I have. Other than that I would highly recommend this product.

name: Picky With Foundation
review: I have tried a million and one foundations, and out of them all, I have only found TWO that I like. When I can afford it, I love the MAC Studio Fix Fluid, but lately I haven't really had the money to spend on that, so this is a very very close 2nd. I can't believe I finally found an affordable and so perfect for me foundation! I love this stuff, covers GREAT, easy to apply with a sponge. And I always set it with the MAC loose powder (Still haven't been able to find an affordable replacement for that one.) I find that with my skin, I definitely need a powder to set this stuff, but I get compliments on my skin ALL the time. I have a ton of hyperpigmentation and just plain uneven skin-tone, and whenever I use this makeup, people say I have perfect skin. Love Love Love it.

name: Mandi
review: This is a product my dermatologist suggested for my acne prone skin.  Works great!

name: SRC
review: Seems to enhance large pores and wrinkles. Not good coverage at all.

name: Rosali the makeup addict
review: I got the wrong color ! But over all ok

name: demar4244
review: I have good, but very oily skin. I've tried the Bare makeup, the Pure one, and other expensive and inexpensive ones, this one is the best for good coverage that stays put all day. Normally, my makeup slides off even with a primer. With this one, the color stays put until I wash it off. I still do get oily after about 5-6 hours, and have to blot, but it's far better than anything else I've tried. It doesn't feel heavy on my skin or make me break out, either.

name: makeupismyart
review: I have very oily skin and one day I saw this so i picked it up.... I used this off and on during about A week and a few days. I did not like it,the color was just like my skin, but it made me look like i was wearing a a ton of makeup that was oily and it weared of in my nose T zone

name: poisonkiss17
review: This foundation is good for controlling oil. It doesn't work for all day however. The color of this foundation is great. I have extremely porcelain skin and the Ivory shade is perfect for me AND it stays on all day! I wish the bottle had a pump though, because it is hard to control how much foundation you want.

name: Riss
review: I bought this as a recommendation from someone. I am always looking for quality stuff. So when I tried this I was surprised at how well it covered my  problem skin  for such a reasonable price. I noticed some people said this was to heavy, but you just may not be applying it correctly. I use a moist beauty blender to apply and you do not need a lot of foundation . With the proper face primer, it should go on easily and cover everything. You should dab/pat it on, not swipe. I love this foundation!

name: Alisa
review: Used to use MAC faithfully..this is surprisingly great..the color matched my skin better than MAC. The true test is if it breaks my skin out.  So far its been excellent...one week in.

name: Katiekin
review: I bought this because I wanted a nice coverage. It's a good foundation, it lasts long but it broke me out even with my intense face cleaning daily. I don't know if it was because it was summer and I sweat it into my pores but I will not repurchase this again.

name: M
review: My last two foundations have been bare minerals and smashbox.  I was looking for a good alternative and heard about this from a make up blog.  I have only used it a couple of times, but I am in love with this product.  I may have gotten one that is a hair darker than I need, but still great great foundation.  I have combination oily skin and this stays.  So happy and pleased that I bought this foundation.

name: workingontwo
review: Full coverage foundation with a friendly price. If you need full coverage, definitely try this product!!

name: Sophia_Vixen
review:
I have combination, horribly sensitive and acne prone skin, but I wouldn't say my skin is oily. I have scars from blemishes that need covering up and this did an alright job. The coverage is good and reduces redness on its own, so if you have concealer for color correcting you'll find you'll need little to none paired with this product. In fact it covers so much color on your face that you'd have to wear blush to look alive and bring warmth back into your face.. The finish is matte and blends quite nicely. I use a foundation brush to apply and it gives me a fresh face. This does feel a tad heavy but can be easy to forget after wearing for a while, but I'd hate to get intimate with someone and have them feel this heavy grease-like foundation on while leaning in for a smooch on the cheek. The fact that it feel oily is strange because I don't have oily skin. I can happily say this hasn't broken me out despite it's tad heavy, greasy feel.

If you're looking to just cover up redness, dark circles and scars, this is perfect. Leave the concealer behind and replace it with blush so you don't look sickly though. Good for its price.

name: Holly
review: I have been using still foundation but wanted to see if I could find a better deal and I have! This gives me the full coverage I want yet it looks like I have no make up on!

name: Tiff
review: It's a great medium to full coverage foundation. There are lots of tones to choose from, so you're almost guaranteed to find your match!

name: Beautifulme
review: I wear it to work everyday. Everyone always says they love my foundation, something I don't hear all the time when I wear high end foundations. But I always hear it when I wear this foundation.

name: Rennee
review: Very good product if you have combination/oily skin!! I've seen very good reviews so had to try it, no color matched me though, the Nude is too pink, and the sand beige is too grey for me, I even tried mixing the two and it was a decent match, just not good enough for me (very picky). I have a yellow undertone and couldn't find one that matched me:( at least i tried it though, I would DEFINITELY recommend this to everyone!

name: Kissy
review: I like that it stays on long and stays put on your face not on your clothes.

name: sweetchildk
review: Great Coverage! Long lasting. Absolutly love!

name: gembee
