review: i've tried several high end/drug stores foundation products in the past, but revlon colorstay spf 6 is the best so far, well, for my skin type.... i'm in my early 40s my skin tends to be too dry or oily at times...however when my 15 yr old daughter tried this product, it just didn't work for her skin, it looked cakey on her.... but anyhow... for me, I just love love this foundation esp for flash photography.. no regret buying this product...

name: KristyRi
review: I love this foundation. I have very oily skin and it is so hard to find a foundation that wont slide off my face. I prefer the Revlon Colorstay even over high end long lasting foundations. I find that the coverage is medium to full depending on how you choose to apply it. I like to use just my fingers for a full coverage and a damp makeup sponge for a medium coverage. If your new to this foundation using a damp sponge may be easier as it can set rather fast.

name: Jessica
review: This is seriously the best foundation I have ever used. I never use liquid foundation because I never really knew how to put it on right and I felt like it just looked bad. After reading the reviews I gave it a try and bought it for oily skin. I was amazed! For a drugstore brand it works really well, probably even better than name brand. Coverage is build-able and I'd say it is a medium coverage foundation. The only flaw is finding a shade. I'm not porcelain or fair but I would say I am light and I chose "medium beige" To me, the colors for this foundation run very light. I can't believe I finally found a foundation that works. This finish is beautiful too, it leaves a smooth, matte finish.

name: Mikaela
review: I am really loving this product. Wish it stayed on a little longer and kept me a little more matte, but definitely the best foundation I've tried so far.

name: lolly
review: I was really disappointed with this foundation. I was really excited to try it from all the hype but it was cakey and I have oily skin! this is actually one of the worst foundations I have ever tried.

name: Wanda
review: I use this product with the expert complexion sponge and the process is very fast. I was surprised how well it covers and spreads.

name: Grace Ander
review: I was looking for a cheaper foundation for great price!

name: CeeBiz1990
review: This is one of the best foundations available, high end or not. The coverage is absolutely custom, light to heavy, it's up to you. The finish is smooth and on the matte side. Covers well and lasts ALL DAY. This is one of the better values out there and is frequently mentioned by MUA's as a quality foundation for the price. I use this every day. You don't even really need a setting powder with this (unless shine is an issue). A good primer is all you need for all day coverage.

name: Christy
review: I want to switch over to mineral makeup, but the coverage rocks with Revlon foundation

name: klassi88
review: I returned my Mac Studio fix Fluid for this and here is why; This stuff is amazing. It took me a while to figure out my shade but the website "Findation" helped me so check it out. But anyways I had returned the Studio Fix for this due to the Mac foundation Oxidized like crazy. So I decided to try this stuff and I have super dry skin but I add Argon Oil as a moisturizer and it makes this foundation look amazing. You really need to work with a little at a time to get a great finish. One thing I loved about this is having dry skin you cant really add a whole lot of powder to your face, but this stuff dry's into a matt finish. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a dupe to a higher end foundation for half the price.

name: Annie
review: This feels like baby powder when you put it on. I love it!

name: Lila21
review: Perfect if you're looking for a medium to full coverage foundation that will last all day! It's super blendable with a natural finish. I have even gone swimming in this and it's stayed on. Only thing it needs is a couple powder touch ups throughout the day if you have oily skin. Love it!

name: Erika
review: I LOVE this foundation I bought it for the first time last year and I haven't stopped using it since. It controls my oil without looking too cakey. It is very easy to apply and blend, I set it with a powder and it looks beautiful on my skin. It lasts a long time and gives me the natural full coverage that I like. It is a perfect year round foundation.

name: Hannah
review: I was so excited about this product. It had amazing coverage but was a little cakey looking. Also, it broke me out really badly. I was really confused at first but concluded it couldn't be anything else.

name: makeuplover
review: I liked this product its wonderful for a drugstore foundation and gets the job done. But for it to be matte you NEED to use a good oil controlling primer.

name: Pomo Girl
review: I purchased this recently, and wow I can not believe how long and amazing the coverage for this product is. I have tried many different foundations, some expensive ones, and so-so.. But for the price this works as well as some of the high-end foundations. My skin is oily/combo, and with this coverage you can not even tell. I actually purchased a color that was one shade darker than my skin tone, and it still looks great. You can't even tell. I will be buying this again. Love at first buy. :)

name: Valerieabc
review: I tried this on a whim... typically I'm a name brand foundation wearer but I was able to actually test the product in the store and was pleased with the coverage it provided and was able to find a perfect match to my skin tone - something I HAD NOT been able to do unless I was in a department store and had a make up artist match it for me.  As a matter of fact I started wearing expensive foundation products because I was tired of taking back poorly matched drug store products - those color wheels never work!!!  Anyway, I like the product very much and no longer see the need to spend $40+ on foundation any longer. Its easy to apply with the Beauty Blender and blends well, providing as much coverage as you like.   I let my daughter use it and she went out and purchased her own she liked it so much.  Its long lasting and while I wish it had more of a matte finish I don't feel like I'm as shiny as a new penny at the end of the day.

name: budgetshopper
review: I love the this product. I have really oily skin and since I've been using this product I don't have a shinny face at the end of the day. You don't even have to apply podwer if you don't want to, it's wonderful.

name: Jpeffley
review: I was so scared to try liquid makeup as I have been for years a faithful Bare Minerals user but I took the plunge and tried it and I'm so glad I did. It gives the best natural coverage and it stays all day until I wash it off. It's not greasy and it doesn't settle into my skin (I'm in my 30's). I have combination skin and this helps cover the dry spots and the oily spots. It doesn't feel heavy and I'm use to a powder coverage so believe me when I say it's light feeling on your face. You can't go around with this foundation.

name: Flawless
review:
This was the best drugstore foundation I had purchased so far. It made my skin look flawless and had great coverage, I got addicted to it. I thought I had finally found the right one-- till I had the worst breakouts ever.

Now I have combination and acne prone sensitifve skin, So it was great covarage for my acne and redness. Little did I know that the ingredients inside would give me the worst breakouts ever. It took me six months to realize that because I was already breaking out, but it only made it worse over time, my pimples were becoming bigger and splotchier(if thats even a word) and it left marks that I am still suffering for atm.

So just be careful - find out if it is compatible with your skin type and if it works for you then thats great bc this product is awesome and at a good deal, it just didn't work for me :(

name: Marie
review: I loved this foundation at first. I loved the coverage and the long lasting matte finish. I have oily skin and would always need to touch up throughout the day. I also had a few blemishes. After using this foundation everyday for about two weeks, my face broke out like crazy! And yes, I did wash my face every night. Because of this, I stopped using this product. I tried using it two more times after waiting for my face to clear up  and after using it again, my face would break out again. If it weren't for the breakouts, this would have been the perfect foundation for me. Now I use the Covergirl Outlast Stay Fabulous, which works well for oily skin.

name: Marie Babe
review: I love this foundation. I have tried many products from high end to drugstore and ive had problems with coverage, breakouts etc... Ive always heard good things about this and i finally gave in and tried it and ive been hooked ever since. I apply this with a sponge because i prefer to dab the product on which works well for me. ive heard people say it dries fast but i havent had that problem because i apply this foundation one side at a time. If you want less coverage i would recommend lightly damping the sponge with water or something like fix + from mac. My biggest problem with this is the color selection, im yellow/olive toned and it was almost impossible finding my color, the darker colors like toast tend to turn orange on me but im currently using Natural Tan which works well once i blend it and add blush or bronzer. I havent tried using this alone. i always set it with Macs mineralize skinfinsh and omg its perfection!! Its also important to remove this properly! in my opinion its something to try! if u know how to apply this u will def get a great flawless look without paying crazy money for something more expensive!

name: Natb
review: I'm definitely a high end foundation fan because I feel the quality is just not there in drugstore brands. However after reading in multiple beauty blogs that the Revlon ColorStay is the best bargin brand foundation, I thought I'd give it a try. Overall for the price it was a good buy for me. I'm used to paying $35-$45 a bottle for foundation. The consistency is a little milky and I'm not crazy about the cheap smell, but the coverage is buildable and covers my blemishes well. It lasts throughout the day and wears well. The only big cons are 1. the cakey look it can give me if I don't blend it well with a brush and 2. the cheap packaging and bottle which causes you to go though the product quickly. Overall, I will buy again and use on days when I want to substitute and not use my high end foundations.

name: Makeup beginner
review: I was skeptical about buying a non MAC foundation, but after reading reviews online and watching videos about it on you tube I tried it. I'm so happy I did. It works great and last pretty well.

name: Momo
review: Favorite foundation besides the revlon whipped

name: Nicole
review: I absolutely adore this foundation. I have tried many other foundations before, but this one leaves my face nice and matte all day long. I highly reccomend this product for anyone with oily skin.

name: Nina
review: This is the best drugstore foundation there is! A little goes a long way so a bottle lasts around 4-6 months for me. It blends really well and is comparable to the MAC foundations I used to use. I ONLY breakout if I accidentally wear it to sleep without washing it off. It can look cakey if too much is applied though!

name: Susy
review: Medium to full coverage, buildable, long wearing, excellent color choices and a great finish, my only issue is that it doesn't come with  a pump. I can deal with the smell of it because it goes away almost immediately, but I wish it did have a pump

name: Morgan
review: I have red, acne prone skin and this product covers it up very nicely. The one downfall is that I apply with a foundation brush, but the product is very difficult to clean off of the brush-I guess long lasting isn't an issue though!

name: IndigoRose
review: After years of buying VERY expensive departments store brands, i finally heard about this product. I tried it, and it worked fabulous. The coverage is full without being heavy, it lasts a VERY long time without having to touch up, and its a GREAT product for the price. The only cons I have about it, is the color selection isnt that great. If you leave the cap off for long periods of time, the makeup will turn a shade darker due to oxygenation (normal with any product but this one changes a full shade), and lastly the top...ALWAYS screw it tight. IF its even missing the tinniest milimeter of a turn, it WILL leak. ANd its awful when it does. It has happened to me at least 5 times in my coach purse :( Aside from those things, its a REALLY good product for the cost.

name: jada
review: Great for daily use, & matches my skin tone to a tee, I love this with the photo ready compact for a flawless look

name: MakeupLover
review: Better than Makeup Forevers HD foundation. I have very oily skin and it makes my skin less oily by the end of the day. Very good for the price.

name: rain
review: i always get compliments about my makeup

name: Cherish
review: My second choice of foundation.. Does the job.

name: Sue
review: Great foundation for older women, does not settle in the lines and wrinkles.  Gives use a younger appearance.  I have recommend to friends!

name: Kkinim
review: All in Pro's and Con's list.

name: BooBoo Kitty
review: You have to put this foundation on fast. It starts to set quick.

name: 11livelaughluv
review: it can look caky but when you get it looking good it stays on all day and give great coverage

name: Sydneyb90
review: This foundation is probably one of the best at the drug store level. I have very fair, oily skin with some break outs here and there. It covers almost everything, but very red imperfectins will need a concealer. Make sure you apply it in small sections because it is difficult to blend once it begins drying. Once applied, it stays on all day and helps control the oil on my face.

name: Nicole
review: For the price, this product is fantastic! It has a medium coverage and does well with my combination skin, though my nose area starts to become shiny within about 4 to 6 hours. I have acne scaring on my chin and a little bit on my cheeks, and this does very well to conceal my problem areas. Best of all, it doesn't break me out, like the majority of foundations. However, it doesn't come with a pump, like the PhotoReady does, which is extremely annoying because I can't get the right amount of product I want.

name: Brittany
review: Lasts longer than normal foundation, but doesn't last as long as advertised. Colors matched my skin tone fairly well, but it doesn't cover my acne scarring very well at all. I build layers of it over those scarred areas, but it still somewhat pokes through. The oily skin formula does not help with oil control much, either, in my opinion.

name: amy
review: I have been using mac's studio fix fluid foundation for almost a year now and i thought it was pretty good until I bought this stuff. It has great coverage, lasts all day, and it's half the price of mac foundation. I have very oily skin and this product works great.

name: Arist
review: I always make sure that my mosturizer and foundation have similar ingredients so that it doesn't slip off my face. My nose can get really oily and that's the place that my makeup starts to disappear first, but not with this foundation. My makeup will be in the exact same place where I applied it 12 hours before. This foundation is very affordable and in my opinion better quality than the MAC and Makeup Forever foundations I've used before.

name: jewjewbinks
review: A lot of foundations cause me to breakout and look greasy. I haven't had any issues with this product.  It is also very light and blends so well with my skin!

name: Jess
review: This has become my new favorite foundation.  I just apply it with my fingers and it blends in smoothly and dries so I feel like I'm not wearing makeup.  The only downside is that it has no pump, so sometimes it gets all over the rim.  Other than that, I will definitely buy this over and over.

name: Spazmanda
review: So I decided to give it a try after reading several reviews.  I have to say that I was able to exactly match my color by guessing (Lucky me).  It goes on well and has a nice finish to it.  I do not think ths would be a good product if your skin is dry anywhere.  I think it is a great value, as many of my foundations in the past have been over $30. Not too shabby.

name: Meggie
review: Took me a while to try it and wish I hadn't waited so long. the absolute BEST

name: pnktaffee
review: I love Revlon colorstay. It does just as it says: Stays all day. My face is oily so I use the type for oily skin and it keeps the oil at bay. I use it with Porefessional Primer by Benefit underneath and Make Up forever powder to set. Lasts all day and makes my skin smooth. It is just as good, if not better, than high end brands.

name: Tine
review: Does the trick.  I normally don't wear liquid foundation but found that I am needing more coverage and saw the reviews were pretty good for this product.  Have been using for about a week and am enjoying it.

name: Betsy
review: I've used this makeup for years.  I love the excellent, full coverage without being heavy, especially covers some reddish spots.  Every once in a while I'll try a different brand, but always go back to this one because it's the best for me.

name: Kaycerae
review: I heard so many great reviews on this product.  It has great coverage but I felt it to be way too much for a work day setting.  I looked like "make-up face".  I got the combination/oily shin one and I was greasy on my t-zone and chin after about 2 hours with it on (in an air conditioned office).  I reapplied powder throughout the day to stay matte.  I think this will be great for going out (darker setting) but not great for work.

name: Fran
review: Love this stuff and the price

name: Bella
review: For a lower priced foundation, I was comeptetely blown away at the coverage and wear of this product. I prefer it over my high end foundation, which range from $40 to $50. The coverage is full and there's no harsh scent, so it great for sensitive skin. Also, it doesn't cause any breakouts for me. I can wear this all day, even in super hot weather, and it will literally last the whole time. I only have to touch up with powder once, maybe twice. It does take a little long to dry on my opinion, so I wouldn't recommend countouring immediately after applying the foundation. You wouldn't know my skin is extremely oily while wearing this, I love it.

name: Jaymay
review: Smooth appearance, lasts even in the heat/sweat

name: Dee M.
review: Love this product for my everyday foundation

name: FB
review: I have very fair, acne prone skin. I used to wear L'Oréal infallible but when it changed I switched to Estée Lauder. I was leaving for vacation and didn't have time to wait for shipping so I bought this and I'm just not impressed. It oxidizes and is too pink for me, even though it goes on a nice color. It just doesn't cover well either. Wouldn't buy again.

name: no nickname
review: I use this product every day. I have used this product for years.

name: Kimmie C.
review: I absolutely adore this foundation.  The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is because there are other products out there at this price point that are actually full coverage.  This one is more of a medium coverage foundation and that is not a bad thing at all. It lays nice on the skin and once it is dry, it gives a nice matte look to the skin without crease lines.  I did find that the best application method that works for me is with my bare clean hands.  I tried a beauty blender, a foundation brush and an Artis Brush, all of which gave the foundation a streaky look or swiped the product right off my face.  Using the tips of my fingers, I only needed one or two pumps and basically just applied it like a moisturizer all over and let it sit to dry.  Speaking of drying, I think this is a big step that most people fail to take and decide too soon that it is greasy or oily.  It is still a liquid foundation so give it a few minutes to settle and dry to see the actual color and texture.  I use this everyday and I have very naturally oily skin.  I have noticed that the foundation does seem to control the oil a bit more than usual.  Bonus, there is an SPF 15 in the product!  So many of us either forget or ignore applying SPF to our faces daily so this is an awesome feature for me.  There is a very wide selection of colors to choose from as well.  However, it would be nice if they could come out with some more cooler shades.  I currently use the shade True Beige and once it dries and settles, it blends well with my medium skin tone.  As far as rub off...of course it rubs off a little.  Honestly, they're aren't many foundations under $10 that don't have some sort of rub off throughout the day.  Overall, I am very happy I decided to give this foundation a try and recommend it to anyone with oily-medium skin looking for a light weight medium coverage foundation.

name: Claire
review: Great product for oily skin!! I could never find the right foundation and I saw this one in a YT video!! Stays in my face all day!

name: luvmesometori
review: Good coverage, covers my skin nicely, and the color was easy for me to match above all its affordable.

name: Ceci
review: I wore this foundation all throughout high school, and after a few years trying other ones, I haven't been as happy with any of them. It lasts a good 12-15 hours on my skin and even though it might look a bit shiny by the end of the day, doesn't get oily in a gross way. It's not heavy, but offers my preferred amount of coverage with one pump. My only negative is that it's a touch too dark for me, even in the lightest shade (maybelline fit me matte in 110 is my perfect match). I've found that after trying both shades multiple times, on me, 110 and 150 are the same amount of pale but with pink (110) or yellow (150) undertones. I'm definitely more on the yellow side, so I just mix some of the Nyx white shade adjuster in until it's pale enough, and then I'm good to go! This will always be my favorite!

name: Rebecca
review: love this brand

name: miss prissy
review: I've been using this product daily for years and it is my number one tool for hiding imperfections and providing great coverage. I am continuously receiving compliments on how smooth my skin looks.

name: Janet
review: Didn't do well as I expected. Didn't control my oily skin only 30 min but it did last all day. I would recommend to normal skin or dry skin.

name: Parker
review: I have really oily skin and I find my foundation melting off mid day and it drives me nuts. And I was tired of spending big bucks on prestige foundation, that just melted off also. So I tried this and so fare this is the best (drug store) foundation i've found to date that stays on my skin all day. I do set it with the Revlon Color Stay Powered (best powered for shinny skin). I don't find it showing shine and It hasn't made me break out either. i work at Ulta and I will recommend this to anyone with oily skin looking for a medium covered.

name: Purple
review: This product is great for anyone with oily skin. It applies easily and is buildable.  The colors are great too. I have very light skin and often cannot find a shade light enough. This is perfect. I wish it had more staying power. After applying I use powder to set the makeup but even so it only lasts about 5 hours and then I have to re-powder my face. That's still better than any other foundation I have tried. It doesn't make me break out, another plus.

name: Ellie O
review:
I. AM. OBESSED! I have only been using this product for 3 days but I am SO thrilled with it I know I will keep loving it. I chose this foundation because it got great reviews and it was a bargain at $9-12 in local stores.

I have really oily skin on almost my whole face - usually I can't wait to get home and cleanse to get the oil / makeup slick off! With this foundation (plus powder to set), I am matte all day long and only do a little blotting in the afternoon to draw off excess oil (which comes through my foundation instead of wiping it off).

It has great coverage and takes care of my under-eye area without needing additional concealer. For trouble spots / breakouts, I am using the Color Stay concealer on top of the foundation (set with pressed powder). I have never felt so "dry" with a liquid foundation before. I'm so impressed!

name: beautynatural34
review: I really have never been into foundation before, but I do get hormonal breakouts and I wanted something for special occasions that would make my skin look polished. I was scared at first to wear something that I've heard is so full coverage because I am not used to covering up my natural skin too much, but I have to say that I really like what my face looks like wearing this. My main downside is that the smell is pretty strong and lasted for a while. I have the Revlon photoready BB cream (which smells like sunscreen) and honestly, I prefer that scent to the heavy perfume of this foundation.

name: DRB
review: I love this stuff! I have very oily/acne-prone skin, and this really covers everything and doesn't get oily on me until near the end of the day.

name: Lola
review: Just a little can cover the whole face. It stays on for 24+ hours. Smooth and ungreasy feeling.

name: Kaylee Girl
review: This product works great!  I would order it again.

name: Kate
review: This is great for oily skin! I apply it with my beauty blender and set with UD's All Nighter. It doesn't start to slide off my T-Zone for at least 11-12 hours which is great for me. Even  mineral makeup was just sliding right off my T-zone by lunch. I would definitely recommend for oily skin. It's not too heavy. Full enough coverage to where I don't have to use concealer but light enough to where I don't feel like I'm wearing a mask.

name: Nurse Stef
review: This covers well with one coat. I have rosacea and it just takes one coat to cover all the redness and bumps. It doesn't last 24 hours but it does last at least 8. Then it starts to cake but I have very oily skin. Color matches perfectly. Glad it has a pump. I use it with a beauty blender.

name: Aa
review: Over all works good. I tried a $35 makeup and this works better. A little heavy but covers my rosecea

name: Linda
review: This product is good for a moderate price. It hasn't caused any breakouts so far. It has a semi matte finish. I have combination skin.

name: rbynn
review: I recently developed oily skin due to a change in my medication. This foundation used to look dry and cakey on my dry skin but I thought it would work well now so I bought a new bottle. I love the packaging update. The pump is AWESOME!!!! I found a great color match. I have tried this foundation with a few primers and powders and every time my face becomes an uncomfortable oily mess within a few hours. I don't feel like my skin is THAT oily, but for some reason it feels super oily and looks shiny with this foundation, even after applying powder throughout the day and blotting. If I rub my finger across my forehead it will wipe right off. This would be a great medium coverage foundation for someone with normal, not oily skin. I'm going to return it and stick with my current holy grail: L'Oreal Pro Matte foundation.

name: Miranduh
review: I liked the foundation until I realized it wasn't lasting all day, mostly on my chin. This used to work really well for me but I think they changed the formula. It may work better for people who don't have an oily t zone. I even tried it with primer but it didn't help.

name: Harcakes
review: I've been using this foundation for years, and it has never disappointed. Love the coverage it gives me, without looking cakey.

name: Maria
review: As a person with acne, finding a product that doesn't break me out is my first priority. This product works well with my skin, doesn't clog my pores and makes me break out. Love it. A little pricey, but workable.

name: Kat
review: Won't use any other foundation!

name: KatieMcD
review: I was actually impressed with this product. I got it on sale for 40% off, but will buy again even if its not on sale. It can cake up on you, so I buff it out and then go over with beauty blender and then set with powder. Stays on for 10 hours.

name: Oma
review: I was expecting more coverage. Is not bad either.

name: erinv
review: the color looked good in the store, but once I put it on my face it turned pink...it also made me break out.  if I mix it with something, my breakouts aren't as bad, but I'd rather just apply one product.

name: Heather
review:
Even though I've picked a shade too light, I am loving this foundation. I am usually a foundation snob - I like high end foundations and I was on a mission to find something amazing at a drug store price. And.... I like this better than my $45 foundation. Eeep! I have combination skin with some random acne. It covers really well without caking (thank god) and without drawing attention to any of my fine lines.

I use a flat kabuki brush and I get a great airbrush finish. The best part is that it really controls the oil in my T zone. I struggle with this constantly and I only felt like I really had to blot once in an 8 hour day.

Super impressed, and luckily a little bronzer and the too light shade doesn't even matter!

name: Lina
review: This product is amazing for oily skin. It keeps your skin a healthy glow without making you look cakey or oily. Love love love!

name: Havolina
review: I am a pale dirty blone with hazel eyes who dyes her hair red.  Revlon is the only moderately priced cosmetic line that is not too brown, pink, or orangey  on their full coverage foundation in their lightest shades!  Colorstays palest ivory color is very neutral and creamy....I would imagine it would alsobea suitable match for very pale Asian and Latina complexions that are sometimes difficult to match due to how very neutral the shade is!  Also, it really does stay put well, nsither rubbing off, fading, or migrating to sit in creases and open pores.....a simple dusting of powder at lunch or dinner if you tend to get shiny will keep this looking matte, perfect and fresh from breakfast through a long night out.  This ismy All Time Favorite Foundation!  Have used other Colorstay products, but this is my Favorite...followed very closely by liquid lip Top Tomato.....which is a very clasic matte 40's and 50's sort of red that will survive any meal or beverage, never smudges or feathers, and comes off easily with bentle cleanser, chapstick, baby oil, or your nightly facial lotion.

name: jdunc04
review: I love this foundation! I have acne scars plus discoloration on my face from a skin condition that I have. This makeup is medium-to-full coverage and does a great job at evening out my complexion. I apply this product with a makeup sponge and set with a light powder. The result is an even matte finish that is what I imagine to be as close to airbrushed as you can get with a liquid foundation. When set with powder this foundation will last you all day and well into the night. The only con I can think of is that it might feel a bit heavy for someone who doesn't like to wear a lot of makeup. For me though, I am not bothered by the product wear.

name: CiCi Maxine
review: I ordered two different colors, the Caramel and the Mahogany. The Caramel is the PERFECT shade for my skin, which is amazing, since I could never find the perfect shade. I was using Bare Minerals, but I don't like how the powder makes my skin look ashy and fuzzy. I was reluctant to switch to liquid because I have very oily, sensitive, acne prone skin. This foundation goes on light, has amazing coverage, and best of all it isn't harsh on my skin! I haven't broken out in the week that I've been wearing it, if anything my skin is feeling and looking BETTER! I workout at the gym every morning at 5am, and I use this foundation before my workout, and I still don't break out, and it even lasts through the workout. A couple cons as to why I didn't give it a full rating is, it's a bit difficult to get the product out of the glass bottle. Also it doesn't last as long as the product claims. I mean it stays on, but I get oily in my Tzone after about 6yrs into wearing it. I usually just use a translucent powder to dust on and I'm good to go again. Aside from that, I am absolutely thrilled with the product, and will be using again! Oh and I use it over the Ulta Matte primer and use the Tarte translucent powder to set and that's it! No concealer needed! :-)

name: Mar
review: This product covers extremely well. I have blemishes, dark spots and some red patches on my face and when I use Revlon ColorStay makeup I don't even need to use concealer. It's very gentle around the eyes and eyelids too.

name: Makeupholic
review: Here's the thing! I have dry, sensitive skin and I use a moisturizer for dry, sensitive skin that works very well but leaves my face a bit oily. But when I heard of this product and how it works well for dry skin, I immediately gained interest in it! Little did I know, I purchased the Colorstay Makeup for Combo/Oily Skin instead of Dry Skin but this was no problem.  Because of the shine my moisturizer gave me, this product perfectly balanced the condition of my skin and provides a smooth, flawless finish!

name: Kelsey
review: I love this foundation soooo much! I am in the shade 200/220 and I mix it with my MAC Studio Fix Fluid SPF 15 in the shade NC25 and together they give a flawless finish that lasts all day and covers up all of my acne and flaws! Also, I use the Smashbox primer and spray the elf setting spray on my brush and dab it on my face when I'm done which makes it last even longer! Love!! Will continue to buy. A must for someone who wants a good covering foundation but doesn't want to spend money on expensive sephora brands.

name: Jennifer
review: It's probably the best foundation I've ever used. But it makes me breakout. And it isn't a little pimple here and there, no. My whole face has exploded in blemishes.

name: Jersey gal
review: I was in desperate search of a foundation that was good for acne prone skin. I tried all the expensive brands and they all either broke me out and made me look tranny like a man. This foundation make me look beautiful and flawless!! My tip will be to use it with a good primer and to wash your face 2 or 3 times as it can be hard to come off. Not a problem for me tho just giving you guys a aheads up! Also use a flat foundation brush!

name: Cruelty-free Makeup
review: I wear this everyday, as a cosmetologist in training i needed to start wearing makeup only problem i had was oily face and major breakout most stuff would clump up on my face but revlon does not the only problem i have is that it does rub off but that is after 6 or so hours of lousiana heat and sweating so i think this is a great product.

name: discountmakeup
review: I am a teenager and suffer from redness,acne and EXTREMELY oily skin and this is the only stuff that stays on my face with the coverage I need. but it does tend to look cakey and not very natural on my face but by the time my oils kick in it looks more natural.but over all it is the best foundation for me!

name: Si
review:
I just love this foundation!
Before I bought it I heard it was really good from some people, and then that it wasn't so good from other people. I heard it kinda feels like a mask when it dries, but it doesn't to me. I couldn't even tell I was wearing it. It really does stay on too! It even stayed on during my whole workout!
I'm very happy with this product.

name: Cole
review: Its a love hate kind of thing. I love the coverage and love I dont need to touch it up at all during the day or night, it stays true to its word it really does stay, the con about that is that its so hard to get off that its causes me to breakout. Ill stick with PurMinerals

name: Ari
review: This product is pretty good but maybe a little thick on skin.For best use i wouldnt reccormend using a flat foundation brush or fingertips a mac 187 as shown on youtube would be best in circular motions!The price is awesome!the coverage is great but maybe too thick if you put on too much (this foundation is thick enough to the point where A LITTLE GOES A LONG WAY!)But i tried once and got the wrong color i thought it was somewhat my skintone in the bottle but it was way too dark once i got it on my skin! Bottom line i would purchase again now that i know how it is best applied and how to use it to have a perfect flawless complexion!!!

name: Rachael
review: I have oily skin and it is hard for me to find a foundation that has full coverage, stays on all day, and doesnt make my face look shiny. I have tried a lot of foundations even some expensive ones like mac and benefit. Ive even tried primers underneath the foundation to help for better coverage. None compare to this product, i love it! A definate must have for any girl's makeup collection!

name: psychoticblackmakeup
review: this stuff really stays but in my opinion it makes your skins flaws in textures show up. you really need to exfoliate well other wise dead skin make your skin look scaly with this stuff on. but over all it lasts FOREVER!!

name: makeupfreak
review: i use this everysingle day it feels like theres nothing on your face. it blends with your skin good it matches covers blemishes. better than all the exspensive makeup.

name: Essence of Pure Beauty
review: Love the coverage.  Use only a dime size for a all day coverage.  Use along with the colorstay finish powder and a mist of finish spray.  Very Matte and a full coverage. I put my foundation liquid into a pump bottle.. works great and gives me the right amount of liquid.
